title: Reconciliations Accountant - Toronto, Canada
description:
Job no: 512135
Brand: Flight Centre Travel Group
Work type: Full time
Location: Ontario
Categories: Finance & Strategy

Corporate Central Finance - Reconciliations Accountant

Who we are:

It all started with one double decker bus in 1973 – and over four decades Flight Centre Travel Group (FCTG) has grown to be one of the world’s largest travel retailers and corporate travel managers. Headquartered in Brisbane, Australia, FCTG has company-owned leisure and corporate travel businesses in 23 countries.

We are fellow travellers passionate about helping others see the world.

In a nutshell: we’re a family. We have many members from all different backgrounds, and our connections spread to the far reaches of the globe. We work hard, have fun and open up the world for those who want to see.

About the opportunity:

As a member of Corporate Central Finance – The Americas, the Corporate Central Finance Associate will prepare bank reconciliations for teams across brands in the Flight Centre Travel Group (USA and Canada) Corporate business as well as other reconciliation projects as assigned. Duties include reconciling checks, deposits (direct and 3rd party) and internal transfers, researching and noting discrepancies, identifying possible fraud items, communicating results with the Commercial Finance Team and other misc. clerical tasks.

Responsibilities:

  • Perform a high volume of numerical detail work with speed and accuracy
  • Advise operations team members and commercial finance team members of discrepancies identified to ensure quick resolution
  • Learn new internal accounting systems, processes and procedures quickly
  • Track status of all bank reconciliations and communicate them with commercial finance team members
  • Ensure compliance with company policies, relevant accounting standards and FCTG minimum standards for financial systems and processes
  • Take on other duties as assigned

Experience & Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or equivalent, including courses in accounting (post-secondary education is desirable)
  • 2+ years of experience in bookkeeping, accounts payable, or other applicable finance related work
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Dynamics 365 (desirable) and Microsoft Outlook
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Possess strong initiative to resolve issues and pursue opportunities as they are identified
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to deal with change and a pressured work environment
  • Proven time management and organizational skills
  • High attention to detail
  • Exceptional interpersonal & communication skills with ability to develop relationships at all levels

Work Perks! - What’s in it for you:

FCTG is renowned internationally for having amazing perks and an even better culture. We understand that our people are our most valuable asset. It is the passion and dedication of our teams that keep the company on top of the industry ladder. It’s also why we offer some great employee benefits and perks outside of the norm.

  • Enjoy the freedom and flexibility of a hybrid work structure
  • Have fun: At the heart of everything we do at Flight Centre is a desire to have fun.
  • Reward & Recognition: Celebrate the success of yourself and others at our regular Buzz Nights and at the annual Global Gathering - You'll have to experience it to believe it!
  • Use your smarts: Our people use their quick thinking, expertise, and tenacity to always figure things out.
  • Love for travel: We were founded by people who wanted to travel and want others to do the same. That passion is something you can’t miss in our people or service.
  • Personal connections: We are a big business founded on personal relationships.
  • A career, not a job: We offer genuine opportunities for people to grow and evolve.
  • We back our people all the way: We are strongly committed to supporting every single employee in their professional and personal development.
  • Giving Back: Proud Corporate Social Responsibility platform through the Flight Centre Foundation and Brighter Futures programs supporting nominated charities through Workplace Giving, Volunteering and Fundraising.

Benefits Include:

  • Generous remuneration structure - this role offers an annual salary of $52,000 CAD.
  • Travel perks/discounts.
  • Health & Wellness Programs and Employee Financial Wellness Services
  • Generous paid-time-off policy
  • Diversity & Inclusion initiatives
  • Benefits include vision, medical, and dental
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • RRSP with matching
  • Employee Share Plan
  • Ongoing training and professional development

Location: Toronto, ON

If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for and you would like to be part of our award-winning culture then APPLY NOW.

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Our promise is to provide an environment with equality of respect, dignity and opportunity for all our employees. We value an inclusive and supportive workplace which truly reflects the diversification of our society. Flight Centre Travel Group is committed to providing a barrier-free pathway throughout our recruitment selection process. If you require accommodation because of a disability at any stage of our hiring process, please let us know in advance by contacting our Recruitment Team at fccareers@flightcentre.ca

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
We are a growing Downtown Vancouver real-estate brokerage and property management firm looking for a competent and diligent addition to our team.

The hired candidate will be responsible for various clerical tasks, most notably in maintaining our social media platforms, updating advertisements for furnished and unfurnished rentals and some light bookkeeping duties. As the company grows, there will be opportunity for growth and advancement.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Slack, Monday or similar softwares is a must.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Being a Travel agent or in the rental industry - Advantage.

*Keeping all rental ads up to date (Airbnb, Canada Stays, Rentboard, Craigslist, Kijiji, etc) by making sure the ad calendars, photos, and price points are always current according to availability and season
*Creating copy for new units (posting to the above platforms)
*Remain alert, courteous, and helpful to all staff members of the office

*Light reception duties

*Light duties in document processing

*Light bookkeeping duties (accounts payable and receivable etc)

*Always maintain a professional demeanor, attitude, and professional appearance
*Responsible, resourceful, and accountable for all duties assigned

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

*Has excellent to near-perfect English language skills, oral and written communication is central to this position

*Has intermediate to expert computer skills

*Familiar with programs and websites such as Microsoft office, Craigslist, Airbnb, Canada Stays, Rentboard, Dropbox, Slack, Monday.com etc

*Some experience with Quickbooks or similar accounting software is preferred.

*Effective time management skills
*Some experience in property management, real-estate, travel or the guest service industry preferred, but not required
*Authorized to work in Canada
*Completely fluent in the English language
*Ability to perform well under pressure
*Ability to problem solve with little or no supervision in a diplomatic and tactful manner
*Ability to accurately follow instructions, both verbal and written
*Highly detail orientated and organized
*Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
*Ability to work courteously as a team in a professional, public, and private environment
*Ability to work a flexible varying schedule that includes evenings, weekends, nights and holidays

This is a full time position at $24 an hour. Hours will generally be from 9am to 5pm, Monday to Friday.

If you think you could be an asset to our team, please tell us why in your cover letter and include your resume.

Experience:

  • administrative assistant: 2 year (Preferred)

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$24.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We are a very small office (3-5 people max are in the office at one time). We can easily accommodate a socially distant environment and we are not open to the public. Hand sanitizers are available in office.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • Have you had any work experience in Travel Agency or property Rental?

Experience:

  • Bookkeeping: 1 year (preferred)
  • administrative assistant: 3 years (required)

title: Sales / Tour & Travel Coordinator
description:
Sales / Tour & Travel Coordinator

At Holiday Inn® we want our guests to relax and be themselves which means we need you to:

  • Be you by being natural, professional and personable in the way you are with people
  • Get ready by taking notice and using your knowledge so that you are prepared for anything
  • Show you care by being thoughtful in the way you welcome and connect with guests
  • Take action by showing initiative, taking ownership and going the extra mile

JOB OVERVIEW

Coordinating the Tour & Travel market segment, achieving all goals and objectives set forth by the Sales
Department. Work as the communications centre for the Sales and Catering team, General Manager, and
Assistant General Manager.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

FINANCIAL RETURNS

  • Achieve budgeted revenues and personal/team sales goals and maximize profitability
  • Responsible for the Tour & Travel market segment that represents 8% of the overall market mix at the hotel – responding to inquiries by phone, email, or fax, coordinating confirmed bookings, establishing rapport with existing clients, and prospecting new accounts, etc.
  • Administrative support to Sales Managers, Catering Manager and Director of Sales including but not limited to preparing proposals, contracts, BEOs, rate agreements, and reports
  • Leading the social media marketing campaign for the hotel and in-house restaurant
  • Preparation of monthly reports and monthly data input into Delphi system
  • Coordinate marketing initiatives with the Director of Sales
  • Assist in the planning and execution of sales and marketing collaterals for the hotel and in-house restaurant
  • Maintaining all filing systems for the Sales Department
  • Perform other duties as assigned

PEOPLE

  • Assist Sales Managers with follow ups for rooming lists and client call backs
  • Engage with existing and potential clients at client events
  • Work with other department managers to ensure proper communication and execution of specific initiatives

GUEST EXPERIENCE

  • Assist in Familiarization Tours, client events, preparation for Sales trips as required
  • Provide clients with information related to the brand and hotel (loyalty program, restaurants, area attractions, facility information, etc) to enhance the guest experience
  • Develop and maintain relationships with key clients and outside contacts in order to produce group business, to include room sales, food & beverage sales and catering/banquet services

RESPONSIBLE BUSINESS

  • Develop awareness and reputation of the hotel and the brand in the local community by participating in networking events
  • Identify operational problems that reduce the effectiveness of marketing activities and overall hotel sales performance and work with appropriate department on solutions

This position also includes supporting the administrative requirements of the General Manager and the
Assistant General Manager. These are to include, but not limited to: typing, filing, faxing, preparing reports, etc.

ACCOUNTABILITY

This position reports directly to the Director of Sales

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

  • Full proficiency in all office procedures and clerical duties
  • Computer experience at intermediate to advanced level with knowledge of Microsoft Office, Illustrator,

Wordpress, Photoshop

  • Previous Sales experience in a hotel environment an asset
  • Must be a strong team player, professional and enthusiastic with excellent organizational skills, creativity and be a self starter
  • Must have outstanding people skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven ability to multitask and react positively in a demanding and stressful environment
  • Proven ability to independently prioritize job tasks and guest needs
  • Must be fluent in English
  • Candidates must have Canadian work Authorization

The statements in this job description are intended to describe the essential nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be ALL responsibilities or qualifications of the job.

Page 2 of 2 Sales – Tour & Travel Coordinator.doc

Salary: From $41,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • DCS / DEC (preferred)

Experience:

  • sales coordinator: 1 year (preferred)
  • Customer service: 1 year (preferred)

title: Tour Guide 1 - Revelstoke Dam Visitor Centre
description:
We’re BC Hydro and we have a big job to do.

Keeping the lights on for over 4 million people across the province takes a lot of talented people doing
many different jobs. From working deep in a generating station, atop a power pole, or behind a desk,
whatever it is that makes you tick we offer challenging careers to help you reach your potential.

We’re investing more than $2 billion per year in major capital infrastructure projects to help meet the
growing demand for safe, reliable power. We’re upgrading transmission lines, building new substations,
and investing in our hydroelectric generation facilities.

We aim to provide meaningful and challenging work, opportunities for growth and a healthy work/life
balance. We’ve been recognized for excellence and been named one of B.C.’s Top Employers and one
of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers.

It's our vision to be the most trusted, innovative utility company in North America by being smart about
power in all we do.

JOB DESCRIPTION
Duties:

  • Greets visitors to the Visitor Centre as an ambassador of BC Hydro. Explains the self-guided
tour or guided tour information. Answers questions about other tourism opportunities in the area
and provides directions where possible.

  • Provides guided tours following established tour content, tailoring content to meet the needs and
interests of the assigned group. Explains how electricity is generated, discusses the history and
construction of the generating station/dam, and provides information on BC Hydro’s current
initiatives, services and programs, including environmental programs and local capital projects.

  • Responds to non-routine enquiries and questions by sharing information with visitors, referring
visitors to other resources within the organization where appropriate. Assists others over the
phone or via email with enquiries about the Visitor Centre or general BC Hydro questions.

  • Utilizes the Point of Sale (POS) system to process admission fees and retail purchases from the
gift shop. Handles cash, counts daily intake, and completes end of day reporting. Trouble shoots
problems with the POS system and escalates as required.

  • Performs clerical duties such as filing, completing reports, answering telephones, checking
safety equipment and supplies, and taking minutes at meetings.

  • Performs duties of a minor nature related to the above duties which do not affect the rating of the
job.

Qualifications:


  • Partial completion of high school, plus some experience in customer service, public speaking,
giving presentations and/or leading groups. Completion of in-house training program upon hire.



ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

This position is affiliated with the Movement of United Professionals union (MoveUP/COPE).
http://moveuptogether.ca

MOU#83
This offer is for a position that is covered under MOU#83 of the Collective Agreement between
MoveUp, Local 378 and BC Hydro.

BC Hydro’s Visitor Centres aim to educate visitors on hydro-electricity, electrical safety and
energy conservation, and to tell the story of BC Hydro in the region. Tour Guides have an
important role in providing a positive educational experience.

Our ideal candidates for Tour Guide jobs at the Revelstoke Dam Visitor Centre would have an
interest in electricity, customer service, travel / tourism, as well as a zest for learning and an ability
to translate these learnings to our visitors. As a Tour Guide, you act as an ambassador for our
company and are a primary resource for sharing knowledge on how electricity is generated, the
history and construction of the facility, and BC Hydro’s current initiatives, services and programs,
including environmental programs and local capital projects.

  • This is a casual temporary employment opportunity starting May 2, 2022 and ending September
5th, 2022. Hours vary depending on candidate availability, visitor centre hours, and scheduled
tours. Typically, successful candidates are scheduled to work 20 to 30 hours per week. Schedules
are shared in advance.

  • The Revelstoke Dam Visitor Center is located on Highway 23 North, Revelstoke, B.C. and is
open weekdays and weekends. The successful incumbents must be available to work on
weekends and holidays. Please note that public transit does not serve this location.

  • Preference will be given to candidates that are familiar with the local community and visitor
centre, candidates that are enrolled or have completed a post-secondary tourism program, and/or
students enrolled in an electrical trade, technology or engineering post-secondary program.

  • Ideal candidates will have a basic knowledge of the operation, construction practices and
systems/equipment involved in a generating station, or will quickly acquire this knowledge upon
starting employment. An interest in the environment and history is also considered an asset.

  • Completion of an in-house training program is required upon hire.

  • Tour Guides earn an hourly wage of approx. $22 (this includes a percentage in lieu of benefits).
Tour Guides may be eligible to receive a stipend of $200 per month payable at the end of the
completed contract in accordance with MOU#83.

  • BC Hydro employees will be required to provide proof they are fully vaccinated effective
November 22, 2021

** To learn more about our visitor centres, please visit www.bchydro.com/revelstoke

Working Conditions:
  • Majority of time spent on feet and may be exposed to unpleasant sections and areas within the
generating station.



We're always looking for exceptional people to bring new ideas, fresh thinking and the motivation
to help shape the electricity system in B.C. It's an exciting time to be a part of our team as we
invest in our system and prepare to meet the challenges of tomorrow.

Our values guide our work. Want to join us?

We are safe.
We are here for our customers.
We are one team.
We include everyone.
We act with integrity and respect.
We are forward thinking.

BC Hydro is an equal opportunity employer.

We include everyone. We welcome applications from anyone, including members of visible
minorities, women, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, persons of minority sexual
orientations and gender identities, and others with the skills and knowledge to productively
engage with diverse communities.

We are also happy to provide reasonable accommodations throughout the selection process and
while working at BC Hydro. If you require support applying online because you are a person with a
disability, please contact us at Recruitmenthelp@

All BC Hydro employees will be required to show proof of full Covid-19 vaccination.

Flexible work model role definitions
===========================
Our four role types identify the degree of flexibility an employee could have to work from home
based on the type of work they do. The flexibility for an individual job is up to the manager for
each position and the operational requirements. Employees also have the right to work full-time
from the office if they prefer. All of our roles require at least some in-person time.

IBEW/Field – No option to work from home
Resident – Works primarily (4+ days per week) in the office.
Hybrid – May be able to work from home up to 3 days per week.
Remote – Works from home 4+ days per week



HOW TO APPLY

Don't forget to update your Candidate Profile with your current resume and copies of your
certifications. If applicable, include your Trades Qualification. This will ensure we have all the
necessary information to assess your application without any delays.


Date Posted: 2022-04-25 Closing Date: 2022-05-06

title: Administrative Assistant, Cruise & Tour Agent
description:
Our travel business is growing and Maple Leaf Tours is looking for a Crack-a-lackin’ Admin Assistant/ Tour & Cruise Agent! Now’s the time, it’s time to take your love of travel and share it!

About us: Maple Leaf Tours is the worlds’ most awesome group tour agency and we are open for happiness! Our mission is to change lives through travel and if you’re another Happy Pants, we’re looking for you! From the beginning, 30 years ago, we’ve always stood for creating memories and enriching the human experience through shared travel experiences.

Our team brings passion, expertise and commitment to working with our clients, providing them with a wealth of first-hand knowledge and experience from North America and beyond!

We are looking for a fellow dynamo to do just that. In this position, you’ll be providing high-level customer service in office, by phone, email, social media and live chat handling the customer journey from the first point of contact to the pre/post trip.

Position Summary: Joining our Maple Leaf Tours Team as a Happiness Ambassador means you will become part of a forward thinking and constantly evolving and growing family business that is 100% Canadian owned, founded and operated by an Indigenous Female Entrepreneur. Join Maple Leaf Tours and become part of a dynamic, growing team with a company that is well-known and respected throughout Canada and Internationally. We are passionate about what we do and we are amazing at juggling multiple items every day from booking awesome tours, epic cruises, fantastic holidays all while singing Broadway tunes! Our enthusiasm is contagious, and it shows on the phone, via email or in office as we work on quotes, issue travel insurance and preparing tour packages!

Maple Leaf Tours is Eastern Ontario’s leading Tour, Travel and Cruise center with our head office located in Kingston, ON.

Our Wish List:

  • Minimum College Diploma in Tourism, Travel, Hospitality, Sales or Similar
  • TICO Certification (an asset – not mandatory)
  • Sales experience (travel and cruise products)
  • Amazing customer service skills
  • Out of this world verbal and written communication skills
  • Sales (preferably travel and cruise products)
  • Number cruncher

Must Have:

  • Proficient in Microsoft Programs – Work, Excel, Outlook, Power Point, etc.
  • A great sense of humour, a love of people and a genuine desire to help clients achieve their dreams of making wonderful travel memories is high on the list!

Why Maple Leaf Tours?

  • Member of many International Associations such as CLIA, ETAO, CCAB, NTA
  • Award winning, family-run business
  • 100% Canadian owned and operated
  • Indigenous Female Entrepreneur founder
  • Attractive compensation package and amazing travel benefits

Want to join us? Here’s how:

  • In person at 2937 Princess Street, Kingston.
  • Zoom (We’d love to see your Happy Face!)
  • Email us at Travel@MapleLeafTours dot com
  • Apply online https://mapleleaftours.com/careers/

Travel Industry Council of Ontario (TICO)#: 50023381

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 24 per week

Salary: $18.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Company events

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We use protection!
Masks, Plexiglass, Social Distancing and Vaccines, we've got it all!

Application deadline: 2022-04-30

title: Corporate Travel, Fleet & Accommodation Clerk
description:
The Corporate Travel, Fleet & Accommodation Clerk is responsible for the incorporate and administration of the Northern Health
Region (NHR) Travel Policy regarding corporate travel, fleet and NHR accommodations; to ensure the most cost effective mode of
transportation/accommodation is booked; to maintain monthly spreadsheets in order to compile reports and inter-departmental
billings; to administer fleet checks on the vehicles and assist with Apartment cleaning based on guest needs.

The incumbent must fulfill the requirements of the Criminal Records/Vulnerable Person, Child Abuse Registry check, and Adult
Abuse Registry check and adhere to all Northern Health Region policies and procedures.
QUALIFICATIONS

  • Grade 12 education or equivalent
  • Post-Secondary Education in Office Administration/Bookkeeping Certificate or Business Administration Diploma (alternate
combinations of education and experience may be considered)
  • Valid Manitoba Class V driver’s license and access to a vehicle
  • Excellent knowledge of Window based programs (Microsoft Word, Outlook) and Internet; Intermediate level proficiency in
Microsoft Excel required
  • Minimum three (3) years’ experience in a customer service environment and in a computerized office environment
  • Exceptional organizational, problem-solving, multi-tasking and prioritization skills
  • Knowledge in travel industry, medical terminology, supplies handling, distribution and inventory in a computerized office
environment
  • Knowledge and understanding of the geographical characteristics/ challenges and transportation links within the Region
  • Working knowledge of procurement systems (such as Microsoft Dynamics)
  • Basic Mechanical/Vehicle Aptitude
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to speak Cree an asset
  • Demonstrates interpersonal skills through clear communication and positive behavior
  • Demonstrated ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Must be able to adapt easily to change
  • Good organizational skills and the ability to work independently
  • Ability to prioritize and work well with time-sensitive materials
  • Satisfactory employment record required
  • Successful candidate subject to provide security checks in accordance with Security Checks for Employment Policy (HR-02-
80. Waived for internal candidates with current checks on file.

For a full listing of qualifications please:

  • Internal Candidates: Refer to the Job Description which is posted on the Intranet under Department/Human
Resources/Job Description, then select the applicable department; or,
  • External Candidates: Contact Human Resources to request a copy

Northern RHA strives to have a diverse workforce in an inclusive and accessible workplace,
which provides opportunity for reasonable accommodation.


Indigenous applicants are encouraged to self-declare when submitting applications & resumes.


We thank all candidates for applying. Only those selected for interview will be contacted.


Using Google Chrome, Apply online at www.northernhealthregion.ca on or before

OPEN UNTIL FILLED
Note: In the event of technical difficulties with the online application, please contact Human Resources at

recruiteast@nrha.ca for assistance prior to the closing date.

title: Junior Accounts Payable Clerk
description:
Join us in making vacation dreams come true !

Are you searching for a fun, passionate, travel loving team? –Sunwing has the EPIC work culture you have been searching for. We are currently looking for a Pilot Logistics Coordinator to join us in making vacation dreams come true. As the Junior Accounts Payable Clerk you will be responsible for processing vendor invoices and vendor statement reconciliation on time so payments are made according to the terms. The position will report to the Accounts Payable Supervisor and will be in Toronto, ON. Apply now and have your career soar to new heights - under our wing!

W ork Perks :
  • Remote and/or Hybrid Work Opportunities
  • Great travel perks!
  • Goodlife Corporate Discount
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • RRSP Matching Program
  • Growth opportunities
  • Free Parking
  • Open concept, collaborative workspace
  • Fresh Café with delicious snacks and meals at a subsidized price!
  • Opportunity to give back through our social responsibility initiatives
  • See for yourself! @sunwinglife

What You’ll Do:
  • Review, Enter and post customer refunds request in Great plains and Process payments (EFT, Cheque, Wire)
  • Review all refunds request/invoices for appropriate documentation and approval prior to payment
  • Communicate with Vendors/Customers and reconcile discrepancies
  • Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with policy and accepted accounting practices
  • Record all cheques, EFTs, credit card payments and wire transfers. Prepare for mailing and maintain filing of accounts payable
  • Audit and process credit card statements
  • Verify transactions to comply with financial policies and procedures
  • Manage and distribute incoming e-mails
  • Other duties and projects as requested

 What You’ll Need:
  • Minimum 1 year experience in accounts payable.
  • Fast learner and ability to lead the team when needed.
  • Excellent computer skills & MS office along with experience in accounting packages
  • Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
  • Must be comfortable working in a fast paced environment under tight deadlines
  • Good communication skills both in oral and written form
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as an active team member
  • Demonstrate sound work ethics complimented with flexible work attitude.

About Us:

Sunwing Travel Group is the largest vertically integrated travel group in North America and during this unprecedented time, we are continuing to search for top talent. We are looking for candidates who are EPIC (entrepreneurial, passionate, innovative, and customer-centric) to join our team and help deliver our purpose “passionate people making vacation dreams come true”.

We want to continue to do our part to help end this pandemic, protect our employees and those vacationing with us, and to support the travel industry’s full recovery. Sunwing requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for our new and existing employees. We will make accommodations for qualifying medical or religious exemptions.

To learn more about our vaccination policy, follow this link: https://rb.gy/b2xavb
Also, learn more about our Safe with Sunwing commitment and how Sunwing is keeping its employees and customers safe here: https://rb.gy/havndq

We thank all who apply however only those who meet the qualifications will be contacted.

At Sunwing, diversity is important to us, follow this link: https://rb.gy/uqytsl to learn about how Diversity and Inclusion has always been, and continues to be, a top priority for us. We are proud that our workforce is made up of passionate people from all experiences and backgrounds. We are also committed to employment equity and to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. We welcome applications from everyone. We will accommodate all applicants throughout the hiring process. If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, please email arozario@sunwing.ca

About us: Maple Leaf Tours is the worlds’ most awesome group tour agency and we are open for happiness! Our mission is to change lives through travel and if you’re another Happy Pants, we’re looking for you! From the beginning, 30 years ago, we’ve always stood for creating memories and enriching the human experience through shared travel experiences.

Our team brings passion, expertise and commitment to working with our clients, providing them with a wealth of first-hand knowledge and experience from North America and beyond!

Your organizational skills will be a great assets to this role, with the ability to multitask you will be on top of everything to keep the 'Cruise Ship Sailing Smoothly'.

title: Administrative Assistant, Real Estate (Travel to Collingwood...
description:
SALES COORDINATOR, RESIDENTIAL NEW HOMES SALES PROGRAM, COLLINGWOOD, ON

Help us make memories!

This administrative support role assists the Sales Manager in the residential sales program by helping keep the sales program organized, functioning and well-supplied.

You will work closely with the Sales, Marketing and Construction and Development teams to help them achieve their goals. This is an opportunity to work with a high-energy, collaborative, and customer- focused team.

Travel to Collingwood, ON is required, but we are offering a hybrid work model. (currently 2-3 days per week can be performed remotely)

Responsibilities and Duties:

You will be working closely with our external team of sales professionals to monitor, measure and enhance our program and processes. Some of your tasks will include: o Monitor home sales programs and update daily/weekly/monthly reports o Create and distribute weekly sales updates to multiple teams o Review and update legal documents as needed (Agreement of purchase and sale, reservations agreements) o Review Offer Summaries with Sales Manager and CFO o Coordinate daily sales inquiries received through corporate channels o Oversee relationships with external business partners, such as legal and sales teams o Facilitation, documenting and updating of Standard Operating Procedures for the

Sales Program and flagging areas that are out of compliance

You will add value to our marketing efforts by: o Tracking and ensuring all frontline sales teams have printed collateral o Ensuring project websites are accurate and updated as needed
o Reviewing and advising on email marketing campaigns and deployment scheduling o Contributing to brand identity projects for new residential communities o In collaboration with Customer Experience team, work to understand Parkbridge customer demographics to help drive the business, customer retention and attraction of new customers using survey analytics

Liaison with Construction and Development Teams o Attend Project Status meetings for new and existing sales programs o Work closely with Construction coordinators on Schedule B creations for new projects and updates. Assure all changes are communicated across the sales programs, o Assist the Warranty team in addressing any issues that may change home specs or home options and upgrades

You will support our financial teams in the following areas: o Track financials throughout the year to ensure budget compliance o Review statements to ensure accuracy; liaise with teams to complete updates as needed o Submit for payment sales related invoices from suppliers and external partners. This includes external partner commissions, homeowner and co-broker referral programs. o Confirm and adjust yearly rent increases for new home sales, ensure updates are made to the revenue workbooks, agreements and marketing collateral o Coordinate Revenue Workbook process, work with Sales Manager, VP, Brand, construction and Finance throughout all steps of the process

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 1-3 Years’ administrative coordination experience
  • Strong technical skills (Excel, Word, Outlook, CRM)- Experience with MS Excel is essential
  • Attention to detail – must be able to review contracts/spreadsheets for accuracy
  • College Diploma or University Degree preferred
  • Knowledge and experience in Real Estate sales is preferred

ABOUT PARKBRIDGE:

Given the rising costs of real estate, home ownership is quickly becoming out-of-reach for many

Canadians. Parkbridge is one of the few companies that offers a solution. We are Canada’s leading owner, operator and developer of residential and recreational land lease communities. Our business model offers our customers the advantages of home or cottage ownership without the expense of purchasing the land. This fills a gap in the real estate market between rental and freehold.

Being fully-owned by BCImc, one of Canada’s leading asset managers, and working closely with

QuadReal, we are stable and well-capitalized. Our current portfolio consists of almost 100 communities throughout Canada. We have a mandate for sizable growth within the coming years.

We boast a culture of collaboration and community, and we put our people first.

APPLICATION INFORMATION:

Parkbridge has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in our offices or sites. Accordingly, a successful candidate offered employment at Parkbridge will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment, subject exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.

Candidates from diverse groups are encouraged to apply. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier free and accessible environment. If you have been contacted for an interview and require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please advise, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Please note that applicants must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment criminal background check.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to reliably commute to Collingwood, ON (2-3 days per week)?

title: newTravel Clinic Assistant (Medical Office Assistant)
description:
Job Description:
Job Title:
Travel Clinic Assistant (Medical Office Assistant)

Work Site:
Travel Clinic - Vancouver, BC

Status:
Regular Full Time

Start Date:
As soon as possible

Salary:
$20.50 - $22.64 per hour

Hours:
0830-1630/0900-1700/1300-2100
Days off: Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays

Reference#:
163104-mpe

Come work as a Travel Clinic Assistant with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Travel Clinic Assistant with a Medical Office Assistant certificate to join the Travel Clinic in Vancouver. Apply today to join our team!

As a Travel Clinic Assistant with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:
  • Play a significant role in ensuring that clients have a positive experience with the designated service within a fast paced, high volume clinic environment.
  • Perform administrative support functions such as:
    • scheduling and confirming client appointments
    • greeting clients and visitors
    • inputting client information into computerized client information systems
    • typing technical and non-technical material
    • composing and signing correspondence
    • responding to general inquiries related to the Travel Clinic
  • Assist the community/public health nurse and other team members in the organization and operation of immunization clinics.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience
  • Grade 12, Medical Office Assistant Certificate supplemented by one (1) year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid BC Drivers License. Local area travel requires the use of a personal vehicle for which mileage will be reimbursed.
K nowledge & Abilities
  • Knowledge of office practices and procedures.
  • Knowledge and proficiency in relevant software. (Word, Excel, graphic applications)
  • Ability to keyboard 5,000 keystrokes per hour.
  • Medical Terminology.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to work independently and effectively with others.
  • Ability to be sensitive, tactful and diplomatic with clients and the public.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize work and deal effectively with changing priorities.
  • Ability to compile information.
  • Ability to perform relevant calculations.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.



***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Administrative Assistant
company: Faro Travel Services Ltd DBA Marlin Trav
description:
Administrative Assistant
Faro Travel Services Ltd DBA Marlin Trav
Whitehorse, YT
Full Time
Compensation: $16.75 to $18.50 Hourly
Benefits package available. Fam trips and Training Academies

  • Administration And Clerical

  • Recreation & Tourism

Duration
Permanent
Job Level
Entry level
Intended job posting audience
Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

We are seeking a self-motivated, team player who has the ability to multi-task and has a "can-do" attitude. the person must have excellent computer skills and be proficient in both written and verbal English.

Primary duties will be assisting the manager with general bookkeeping, filing and standard travel agency duties. In addition, be responsible for assisting the manager in the preparation of quotes for clients. Previous travel agency experience or agency training preferred, Familiarity with Galileo by Travelport and Travcom/Client Linq accounting an asset but training available.

Additional Application Instructions

Email or fax resume with reference and contact information for references. No phone calls please.

title: Scanning Clerk
description:
REFERRAL BONUS 150$ 

 Are you reliable and customer service oriented? Our client requires your services like Scanning Clerk to assist in a poultry factory. This is a great opportunity to benefit from excellent working conditions and acquire a permanent position; join the team today!

 

 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Pick/Pack Orders

  • Verify the products against sale orders before packing
  • Pick/Pack all regular, wholesalers’ orders and transfers
  • Pick/Pack the refrigerate products

Ship Packages

  • Inspect package, make sure all information is correct
  • Follow proper shipping procedure for food safety
  • Carry out any other similar tasks.

 

JOB BENEFITS

- Three salary increases in the first year!

- Starting salary 17 – 18$/hr

- Permanent full-time position based in Montréal-Nord

- 5-day/week schedule, (12:00 p.m. to 6 p.m. )

- Weekly pay

-Subsidized meals

 

OUR REQUIREMENTS

- Professional, reliable and customer service oriented

-Person must be able to communicate in English and French

-Preferably have experience Using RF scanner for inventory control

 

 

CONTACT

Canada Global Recruitment

Talent Acquisition team

 

☎514-548-3505

• WhatsApp and Text messages accepted

title: Préposé à la manutention de matériel / Material Handling Clerk
description:
Qui nous sommes?

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde.

C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un coeur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde.

Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel.

C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Nos Attentes

Dans un environnement manufacturier à la fine pointe de la technologie, les candidats recherchés seront appelés à :
  • Distribuer le matériel à travers tous les secteurs de l’usine
  • Manipuler différents objets, boîtes, pièces, chariots avec les équipements de levages appropriés
  • Recevoir, vérifier, préparer et émettre tout matériel
  • Utiliser des transactions informatiques et des logiciels pour accomplir son travail
  • Participer à des activités d’amélioration continue
  • Tenir à jour des registres
  • Conduire différents véhicules de manutention
  • Effectuer des inventaires au besoin

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Le candidat sera appelé à travailler dans plusieurs postes de travail au sein de l’équipe logistique :
  • Manutention de pièces, de moteurs
  • Réception / expédition
  • Emballage
  • Magasin

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Diplôme : DEP secteur aéronautique, logistique ou tout autre formation connexe
  • 1 à 2 années d'expérience de travail en milieu industriel
  • Aptitude à effectuer du travail manuel avec des outils divers
  • Aptitude démontrée à travailler en équipe
  • Fait preuve d’initiative
  • Connaissance de l'utilisation d'un ordinateur dans l’environnement Windows
  • Aptitude à conduire un chariot élévateur et autre véhicule industriel
  • Certification pour autoriser l’expédition de matières dangereuses (atout)
  • Bonne condition physique sera considérée comme un atout

Ce qui vous attend
  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom
  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Développement de technologies vertes et durables
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Programmes de formation sur le leadership et mentorat
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Pratiques reconnues en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement
  • Programme de santé-mieux -être en entreprise et groupes de ressources pour les employés
  • Programme d’aide pour les congés parentaux
  • Culture d’entreprise valorisant la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion et l’engagement communautaire

Informations additionnelles

Horaire selon les modalités de la convention collective en vigueur.

Bien que toutes les demandes d'emplois soient prises en considération, seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.

Diversité et inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

______________________________________________________________________________

About Us

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world.

That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde.

C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un coeur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde.

Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel.

C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Nos Attentes

Dans un environnement manufacturier à la fine pointe de la technologie, les candidats recherchés seront appelés à :
  • Distribuer le matériel à travers tous les secteurs de l’usine
  • Manipuler différents objets, boîtes, pièces, chariots avec les équipements de levages appropriés
  • Recevoir, vérifier, préparer et émettre tout matériel
  • Utiliser des transactions informatiques et des logiciels pour accomplir son travail
  • Participer à des activités d’amélioration continue
  • Tenir à jour des registres
  • Conduire différents véhicules de manutention
  • Effectuer des inventaires au besoin

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Le candidat sera appelé à travailler dans plusieurs postes de travail au sein de l’équipe logistique :
  • Manutention de pièces, de moteurs
  • Réception / expédition
  • Emballage
  • Magasin

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Diplôme : DEP secteur aéronautique, logistique ou tout autre formation connexe
  • 1 à 2 années d'expérience de travail en milieu industriel
  • Aptitude à effectuer du travail manuel avec des outils divers
  • Aptitude démontrée à travailler en équipe
  • Fait preuve d’initiative
  • Connaissance de l'utilisation d'un ordinateur dans l’environnement Windows
  • Aptitude à conduire un chariot élévateur et autre véhicule industriel
  • Certification pour autoriser l’expédition de matières dangereuses (atout)
  • Bonne condition physique sera considérée comme un atout

Ce qui vous attend
  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom
  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Développement de technologies vertes et durables
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Programmes de formation sur le leadership et mentorat
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Pratiques reconnues en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement
  • Programme de santé-mieux -être en entreprise et groupes de ressources pour les employés
  • Programme d’aide pour les congés parentaux
  • Culture d’entreprise valorisant la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion et l’engagement communautaire

Informations additionnelles

Horaire selon les modalités de la convention collective en vigueur.

Bien que toutes les demandes d'emplois soient prises en considération, seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.

Diversité et inclusion

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. P&WC souscrit au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi et est déterminé à encourager la diversité et l’inclusion. Nous sommes heureux d’étudier la demande d’emploi de tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à leur race, couleur, religion, orientation sexuelle, genre, nationalité d’origine, âge, handicap, statut d’ancien combattant ou tout autre statut protégé par la loi.

______________________________________________________________________________

About Us

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world.

That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Nos Attentes

Dans un environnement manufacturier à la fine pointe de la technologie, les candidats recherchés seront appelés à :
  • Distribuer le matériel à travers tous les secteurs de l’usine
  • Manipuler différents objets, boîtes, pièces, chariots avec les équipements de levages appropriés
  • Recevoir, vérifier, préparer et émettre tout matériel
  • Utiliser des transactions informatiques et des logiciels pour accomplir son travail
  • Participer à des activités d’amélioration continue
  • Tenir à jour des registres
  • Conduire différents véhicules de manutention
  • Effectuer des inventaires au besoin

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Le candidat sera appelé à travailler dans plusieurs postes de travail au sein de l’équipe logistique :
  • Manutention de pièces, de moteurs
  • Réception / expédition
  • Emballage
  • Magasin

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Diplôme : DEP secteur aéronautique, logistique ou tout autre formation connexe
  • 1 à 2 années d'expérience de travail en milieu industriel
  • Aptitude à effectuer du travail manuel avec des outils divers
  • Aptitude démontrée à travailler en équipe
  • Fait preuve d’initiative
  • Connaissance de l'utilisation d'un ordinateur dans l’environnement Windows
  • Aptitude à conduire un chariot élévateur et autre véhicule industriel
  • Certification pour autoriser l’expédition de matières dangereuses (atout)
  • Bonne condition physique sera considérée comme un atout

Ce qui vous attend
  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom
  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Développement de technologies vertes et durables
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Programmes de formation sur le leadership et mentorat
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Pratiques reconnues en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement
  • Programme de santé-mieux -être en entreprise et groupes de ressources pour les employés
  • Programme d’aide pour les congés parentaux
  • Culture d’entreprise valorisant la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion et l’engagement communautaire

Horaire selon les modalités de la convention collective en vigueur.

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte. About Us

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world.

That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

title: commis réception expédition
description:

Chez Pratt & Whitney, nous croyons que le vol motorisé a transformé, et continuera de transformer, le monde.

C'est pourquoi nous travaillons avec un coeur d'explorateur et un acharnement de perfectionniste à concevoir, produire et entretenir les moteurs d'avion les plus avancés et les plus fiables du monde.

Notre portefeuille diversifié - composé de moteurs commerciaux et militaires ainsi que de moteurs destinés à l'aviation d'affaires, générale et régionale, et aux hélicoptères – nous permet, ainsi qu’à nos clients, de passer du possible au réel.

C'est ainsi que, chez Pratt & Whitney, nous abordons notre travail et ce qui nous inspire à nous dépasser.

Nos Attentes

Dans un environnement manufacturier à la fine pointe de la technologie, les candidats recherchés seront appelés à :
  • Distribuer le matériel à travers tous les secteurs de l’usine
  • Manipuler différents objets, boîtes, pièces, chariots avec les équipements de levages appropriés
  • Recevoir, vérifier, préparer et émettre tout matériel
  • Utiliser des transactions informatiques et des logiciels pour accomplir son travail
  • Participer à des activités d’amélioration continue
  • Tenir à jour des registres
  • Conduire différents véhicules de manutention
  • Effectuer des inventaires au besoin

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Le candidat sera appelé à travailler dans plusieurs postes de travail au sein de l’équipe logistique :
  • Manutention de pièces, de moteurs
  • Réception / expédition
  • Emballage
  • Magasin

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Diplôme : DEP secteur aéronautique, logistique ou tout autre formation connexe
  • 1 à 2 années d'expérience de travail en milieu industriel
  • Aptitude à effectuer du travail manuel avec des outils divers
  • Aptitude démontrée à travailler en équipe
  • Fait preuve d’initiative
  • Connaissance de l'utilisation d'un ordinateur dans l’environnement Windows
  • Aptitude à conduire un chariot élévateur et autre véhicule industriel
  • Certification pour autoriser l’expédition de matières dangereuses (atout)
  • Bonne condition physique sera considérée comme un atout

Ce qui vous attend
  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom
  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Développement de technologies vertes et durables
  • Programmes d’avancement professionnel et de scolarisation
  • Programmes de formation sur le leadership et mentorat
  • Gamme d’avantages sociaux, régime d’épargne et régime de retraite
  • Pratiques reconnues en matière de santé, sécurité et environnement
  • Programme de santé-mieux -être en entreprise et groupes de ressources pour les employés
  • Programme d’aide pour les congés parentaux
  • Culture d’entreprise valorisant la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion et l’engagement communautaire

Horaire selon les modalités de la convention collective en vigueur.

Le générique masculin est utilisé sans discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte.   • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)

About Us

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world.

That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.

  • Participer à des activités d’amélioration continue
  • Tenir à jour des registres
  • Conduire différents véhicules de manutention
  • Effectuer des inventaires au besoin

À quoi ressemblera votre quotidien?

Le candidat sera appelé à travailler dans plusieurs postes de travail au sein de l’équipe logistique :
  • Manutention de pièces, de moteurs
  • Réception / expédition
  • Emballage
  • Magasin

Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir
  • Diplôme : DEP secteur aéronautique, logistique ou tout autre formation connexe
  • 1 à 2 années d'expérience de travail en milieu industriel
  • Aptitude à effectuer du travail manuel avec des outils divers
  • Aptitude démontrée à travailler en équipe
  • Fait preuve d’initiative
  • Connaissance de l'utilisation d'un ordinateur dans l’environnement Windows
  • Aptitude à conduire un chariot élévateur et autre véhicule industriel
  • Certification pour autoriser l’expédition de matières dangereuses (atout)

Ce qui vous attend
  • Entreprise d’envergure mondiale de renom
  • Produits innovateurs à la fine pointe de la technologie : moteurs d’avions et d’hélicoptères de nouvelle génération (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)

About Us

At Pratt & Whitney, we believe that powered flight has transformed — and will continue to transform — the world.

That's why we work with an explorer's heart and a perfectionist's grit to design, build and service the world's most advanced and unrelenting aircraft engines.

We do this across a diverse portfolio – including Commercial Engines, Military Engines, Business Aviation, General Aviation, Regional Aviation, and Helicopter Aviation – and as a way of turning possibilities into realities for our customers

This is how we at Pratt & Whitney approach our work, and this is why we are inspired to go beyond.

What Are Our Expectations

In a manufacturing environment at the leading edge of technology, candidates will be required to:
  • Distribute equipment throughout all areas of the plant
  • Handle various objects, boxes, parts and carts using the appropriate lifting equipment
  • Receive, check, prepare and issue all equipment
  • Use computer transactions and software to complete their work
  • Participate in continuous improvement activities
  • Maintain logbooks
  • Drive various handling vehicles
  • Perform stocktaking when required

What You Will Be Doing

The successful candidate will be required to work in several different work centres within the logistics team
  • Engine and parts handling
  • Receiving/dispatch
  • Packaging
  • Store

What You Need To Succeed
  • Degree: Vocational diploma (DEP) in aeronautics or logistics or any other related training
  • 1 to 2 years' experience working in an industrial environment
  • Ability to perform manual work with a variety of tools
  • Proven ability to work in a team
  • Evidence of initiative-taking
  • Knowledge of using computers with Windows software
  • Ability to drive a forklift truck and other industrial vehicles
  • Certification to authorize the dispatch of hazardous materials (an asset)
  • Good physical condition will be considered an asset

What You Can Expect
  • A renowned, global company
  • Innovative, state-of-the-art products and technology: next-generation aircraft and helicopter engines (PW800, PT6E-series, F135, etc.)
  • Development of green and sustainable technologies
  • Career development and education programs
  • Leadership training programs and mentoring
  • Range of employee benefits, savings plan and pension plan
  • Recognized environmental, health and safety practices
  • Corporate health and wellness programs and employee resource groups
  • Assistance program for parental leave
  • A corporate culture that values diversity, equality, inclusion and community involvement

Additional Information

Working hours in accordance with the terms of the current collective agreement.

Although all applications will be considered, only successful candidates will be contacted.

Diversity and Inclusion

The masculine pronoun is used without discrimination and solely for the purpose of making the text easier to read. P&WC is an equal opportunities employer, seeking to promote diversity and inclusion. We will consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by law.
