title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
Hexoskin is looking for a Customer Support Specialist to join its Sales & Marketing team!

About Hexoskin

Hexoskin is the leader & pioneer in non-invasive sensors, software, data science & AI digital health solutions. Founded in 2006 in Montréal, Hexoskin's mission is to record and organize personal health information and make it accessible and useful.

Hexoskin provides solutions and services directly to customers, researchers, and professionals in Academics & Research Institutions, Pharmaceuticals, Healthcare, Law Enforcement & First Responders, Defence, and Aerospace organizations.

Hexoskin's headquarters are located in Montreal at 5800 St-Denis St. Our office is close to public transit (Metro Rosemont), a 5-minute walk from the Plateau and Mile-End, and a few steps to a bike path.

We are a fast-growing team that promotes a diverse, talented, and skilled workforce. Hexoskin promotes an inclusive culture, work-life balance, flexible hours schedule, and work from home. Women, visible minorities, First Nations and Inuit applicants, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ candidates are invited to apply.

Work Environment

The Customer Support Specialist is in charge of supporting and educating Hexoskin clients on how to best use Hexoskin products in different contexts. The chosen candidate will work closely with the Sales, Marketing & Support team and interacts with people throughout the company (software, hardware, design, data science, logistic, finance). Our team is result-oriented and passionate about delivering leading innovative products to a large

Responsibilities

  • Be an active ambassador of the Hexoskin products and solutions
  • Provide customer support from initial onboarding to project completion and post-implementation
  • Develop & maintain strong relationships with the Hexoskin users, partners, and developers' community.
  • Be active during the full sales cycle, from initial contact to close. 
  • Prepare customers' orders for shipping. 
  • Educate new clients about the best physiological monitoring solutions for their needs. 
  • Provide memorable customer service to Hexoskin clients.
  • Manage incoming customer service tickets and oversee their resolution.
  • Post Support & FAQ articles on the Hexoskin Support Community Knowledge Base.
  • Monitor and improve customer satisfaction by developing surveys and other tools to collect customers' feedback.
  • Prepare the shipping documentation.
  • Collect proof of deliveries
  • Manage incoming merchandise from suppliers.
  • Manage and report the inventory on an ongoing basis.
  • Manage media requests and coordinate PR events.

Key Competencies & Skills

  • Flawless English and French written and spoken communication skills.
  • 1-3 years experience in sales/customer service.
  • Engineering or life sciences university degree a plus.
  • Knowledge in logistics and shipping a plus.
  • Experience with a CRM a plus.
  • Experience with digital tools to manage customer support, logistics, and inventory.
  • Experience in healthcare, biopharmaceutical, defense, and academic customers a plus.
  • Rigorous work ethics & customer focus.

What We Offer

  • Working in a fast-growing startup recognized as an industry leader in health sensors & AI.
  • A rewarding career with growth opportunities.
  • Work on health-related projects (health research, clinical research, patient remote monitoring, etc.).
  • Many opportunities to innovate and take initiative.
  • You get to work with the latest remote patient monitoring technologies.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Health benefits.

How We Measure the Performance of the Customer Support Specialist

Performance is measured by Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), sales volume, customer success rate, and customer satisfaction.

Type of Position

Full-time - Flexible options

How to Apply

Candidates are invited to apply before May 30, 2022.

title: Customer Service Representative - Work From Home
description:
Customer Service Representative - Work from Home

$18.00-$22.00/hr + Benefits

Inspire Direct Marketing is a Canadian fundraising agency on a mission to inspire fundraising.

We are one of Canada's premiere fundraising call centres helping to provide a warm and friendly voice to many of the largest and most respected charities in Canada. We contact current and past supporters to raise funds for important causes around the globe. There are no cold calls or high-pressure tactics, but we are a performance team and results matter. We hope they motivate you as well. 

If you are a professional sales or call centre representative join our team and use your skills to help end poverty and make our world a better place.

Qualifications you must have:

  • A minimum of 2 years' call centre experience
  • You are looking for full-time hours, 40 hours a week
  • Available to work evenings, until 10:00 pm EST Monday to Thursday
  • You have exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • You are technically savvy and self-reliant

Home office requirements:

  • A newer-version PC or laptop computer
  • A USB headset and webcam
  • A secure high-speed internet (25 mbps down/5 mbps up)
  • A private home office (with door)

What you can expect:

  • Permanent, full-time employment
  • $18.00 - $22.00 hourly wage
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • 100% paid training and health benefits (at 3 months)
  • Incentives, bonuses and rewards

Please note: This is a work-from-home position. We want to thank everyone for their interest however only qualified candidates may be contacted.

title: Part Time Customer Service Representative-Kiehl's Since 1851 Sherway Gardens
description:
We have an exciting opportunity to join the Kiehl's family as a Kiehl's Customer Representative. This position is responsible for achieving individual sales goals established by management team. Provide superior customer service and develop customer relationships that will result in repeat business. Responsible for product and brand image presentation while maintaining a neat and organized store.

Job Responsibilities:

• Delivers a best in class experience to customers

• Win with integrity and uphold our highest brand standards

• Act with agility to drive sales results

• Regular attendance and timeliness for all scheduled shifts

Qualifications:

· Retail and/or cosmetic experience preferred

· Customer service experience

· Communication skills

· Analytical skills

· Basic computer skills

· Must be willing to work flexible hours including nights and weekends

· High School Diploma or GED required

· Must be 18 years or older

· Physical Environment: Must be able to work on the sales floor for extended periods, walk up and down a flight of stairs and/or ladder as necessary, and lift up to 25 lbs. on a regular basis

· English mandatory, second language an asset

  • Apply To Position

title: Modern - Customer Service Representative
description:
Modern Sales Co-op is one of Canada's most diverse co-operative organizations linking over 400 suppliers of automotive and other products with several hundred member locations across Canada. Operating for over 80 years, Modern Sales Co-op has grown to become a leading national distribution organization with a vast membership network coast to coast in Canada.  Our distribution centers are established in British Columbia, Manitoba, and in Calgary, Alberta, all supported by our head office and main distribution center located in Barrie, Ontario.  With over 130 employees, our team strives to continue to provide optimum service to meet the needs of our growing membership.  As a result, we are currently looking for a dynamic individual to join our Member Services team as a Customer Service Representative in our head office in Barrie. Salary is commensurate with experience.  We also offer a very competitive benefits package covering group insurance and retirement plans. 


Under the supervision of the Manager, Member Support and Service, this position assumes the responsibilities for delivering superior customer service to our members, associates and vendors within a high volume, fast-paced environment by identifying and anticipating the member's needs and providing assistance that exceeds their expectations.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provides optimum member satisfaction by answering member inquiries on a timely basis and handling issues as per company standards.  Tracks calls and identifies if it is an inquiry, an order or a member or vendor billing inquiry.
  • Records details of complaints and comments as well as take action on any issues.
  • Ensures orders and returns are keyed into the Vision computer system on a timely basis.
  • Creates RGA's and credits, as needed.
  • Keys in and analyzes member returns.  Reports overages to manager and communicates either approvals or refusals to the members.
  • Reviews shipping paperwork once the warehouse has received the returned products and makes required adjustments and processes.
  • Tracks missing products which may include inquiries with courier companies or other members and takes all necessary actions to ensure the member receives their products.  Ensures members are updated throughout this process.
  • Acts as a liaison between members and inventory control for new product inquiries, arrival times for inbound products, price discrepancies and other related areas.
  • Liaisons with various departments to satisfy general inquiries.
  • In collaboration with the warehouse, investigates short shipments by checking the current stock on a given product.
  • Educates members on how to use the Modern's Extranet, Member Connect online ordering portal and other resources provide to the members, and HOD (Host on Demand) system.  Communicates any system issues with the IT department including changes required within the Vision computer system.
  • Prepares invoices for shipped orders.
  • Tracks trade show orders.
  • Ensures all information changes or issues for members i.e. pricing etc. are reported to the appropriate department manager.
  • Other general duties, as assigned.

Requirements:

  • Completion of College Diploma or University Degree in Business Administration or related field
  • A minimum of five (5) years' experience in an office environment providing customer service or administrative support
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Applications and ERP systems

The successful candidate must demonstrate the following:

  • Positive and respectful attitude
  • Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills, in person and over the phone
  • Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills
  • Ability to multi-task in a high volume environment
  • Ability to interact with all departments to ensure business objectives are aligned and met
  • Ability to work cohesively with co-workers and managers as part of a team
  • Ability to problem solve and resolve conflicts
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure with simultaneous deadlines
  • Detailed oriented and excellent organizational skills
  • Possess a high level of professionalism and integrity while maintaining the confidentiality of all organizational related matters

We thank you for your interest in our position!  Only those applicants that respond to our pre-qualifying questionnaire and who are selected for interviews will be contacted.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidate's request.

title: Appointment Coordinator - DestinationToyota Burnaby
description:
At Destination Auto Group we're not your traditional dealership group. And we're not looking for traditional dealership people. Recognized as the 2019 Canadian Automotive Dealers Association (CADA) Laureate Award Winner for Business Innovation and one of Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates for 2022, Destination Toyota Burnaby is on the hunt for an Appointment Coordinator to joint their team! This individual will develop ongoing, mutually beneficial relationships with customers and continually maintain a professional image of the company.

It's Different Here - What we can provide for you:

  • A competitive compensation plan!
  • Enhanced group health benefits program.
  • An environment that is friendly, respectful, collaborative and ultimately supports your success!
  • Long term career opportunities!

What you'll be doing:

  • Receive inbound calls for appointment bookings, product requests or information, following up as necessary to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction.
  • Perform outbound calls to schedule service appointments for customers.
  • Recommend services and repairs based on Toyota Canada's maintenance schedule and documented vehicle history.
  • Marketing outstanding campaigns, promotions, and/or other services to customers.
  • Confirm and update customer information within Destination and Toyota Canada databases.
  • Contacting customers at specific time intervals to notify of upcoming appointments.
  • Booking appointments to ensure a balance of shop utilization and customer preferences.
  • Record necessary customer feedback, concerns, or complaints and forward to management as required.  Follow up as necessary to ensure a prompt resolution.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

What you bring to the table:

  • Always brightly beaming positivity and smiling!
  • Previous experience in a call center, or similar, environment.
  • Previous experience in a Dealership setting considered an asset.
  • Prior or similar customer service experience may also be considered.
  • Extremely high level of customer services skills.
  • Strong computer skills (including MS Office suite); experience with CDK and X-Time is an asset.
  • Excellent verbal, written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficiency speaking a 2nd language is considered an asset.
  • Someone who is very self-motivated, independent and a team player with a sense of urgency and attention to detail.
  • Exceptional organizational skills and ability to multitask, prioritize and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

If this sounds like you submit your resume to our human resources team today.

Destination Auto Group is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Receptionist (3/4 Time)
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

If you are an independent, enthusiastic, and driven professional searching for an opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. Working from Monday to Friday 9am-3pm, this ¾ time Receptionist position is located in Saskatoon SK and will report directly to the Regional HR Partner.

The Receptionist is responsible for providing administrative and clerical support and services and is the first point of contact within the office environment. This position is responsible for such administrative duties as basic accounting procedures, processing payables, filing, faxing, photocopying and ordering office and other supplies. Duties also include maintaining front desk security, switchboard operation, greeting and directing guests and visitors, and scheduling appointments and boardroom space.

Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

  • Operate telephone system to answer, screen and forward telephone calls, take messages and provide information as required
  • Provide administrative/clerical support to the team, including filing, faxing, photocopying and preparation and maintenance of documents, memos, spreadsheets
  • Maintain office equipment service and supplies and prepare, receive and distribute bi-weekly office supply order
  • Research special supply and promotional item options, pricing and ordering
  • Refill orders for B&M printed materials including envelopes, invoice paper, service reports and business cards
  • Prepare outgoing mail and receive, open and distribute incoming mail
  • Prepare waybills and schedule both local and inter-company courier
  • Maintain main floor kitchen including loading/unloading the dishwasher and preparing and receiving monthly coffee order
  • Meeting and conference preparations including printing and compiling meeting documents, catering needs and boardroom booking and set-up
  • Assist with employee asset tracking, recording and monitoring
  • Assist with cell phone ordering, upgrades, set up and restaging
  • Assist with scanning and labelling employee file documents
  • Assist with assigning courses through the Company online learning system LITMOS
  • Sort, organize and distribute payables and vendor statements
  • Assist in day to day processing of accounts payable and reconciliations within established procedure
  • Cell phone summary and allocation
  • Other duties as assigned

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Change Orientation
  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Be able to work within a team environment as well as work without supervision
  • Values and Respects Others
  • Excellent and professional written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient with computer and mobile applications
  • Be able to multi-task and meet deadlines as required

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

  • A College Diploma or equivalent in Office Administration is beneficial and experience in the construction industry would be considered an asset.

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Extensive administrative experience in an office environment may substitute for post-secondary education requirements.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience and knowledge of a variety of software is beneficial including Microsoft Office Suite and JD Edwards.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Knowledge of Black & McDonald Limited

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Service Advisor - Destination Mazda Vancouver
description:
Recognized as the 2019 Canadian Automotive Dealers Association (CADA) Laureate Award Winner for Business Innovation and one of Canada's Best Employers for Recent Graduates for 2022, Destination Mazda Vancouver is looking for a Service Advisor who is looking to take the next step with their career! This is an excellent opportunity for a highly adaptable person looking for a multifaceted and fast-paced environment within a growing automotive company.

It's Different Here - What we can provide for you:

  • A competitive compensation plan!
  • Enhanced group health benefits program.
  • An environment that is friendly, respectful, collaborative and ultimately supports your success!
  • Employee recognition, celebration and company culture events.
  • Long term and accelerated career opportunities!

What you'll be doing:

  • Liaising with technicians to confirm status of repairs, inquire about recommendations on client's vehicles.
  • Handle client concerns / misunderstandings with a polite, courteous, and high regard manner.
  • Serve clients efficiently to ensure client expectations are met or exceeded.
  • Identify additional service work required for vehicles and effectively communicate to clients.
  • Review, explain, and monitor repair process to ensure clients are up-to-date from open to closing of service.

What we need from you:

  • Minimum 2-years worth of experience in a Service Advisor role.
  • Automotive knowledge required to effectively communicate with customers.
  • Superior customer service abilities.
  • Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. 
  • Driven to succeed, self-starter, with a strong work ethic.
  • Strong computer skills (including MS Office suite); experience with CDK and X-Time.
  • Valid BC Driver's License, with a clean driver's abstract.

If this sounds like you submit your resume to our human resources team today.

Destination Auto Group is an equal opportunity employer.

title: AMBASSADEUR EXPERIENCE CLIENT
description:
Description de l'emploi


Voir au-delà des chiffres MC
À la Banque Laurentienne, nous croyons que nous pouvons changer l'expérience bancaire pour le mieux. Fondée à Montréal en 1846, la Banque Laurentienne aide les familles, les entreprises et les collectivités à prospérer. Aujourd'hui, nous comptons plus que 2 800 employés qui travaillent ensemble, comme Une Équipe, pour offrir une vaste gamme de services financiers et de solutions axée sur le conseil à nos clients partout au Canada et aux États-Unis. Nous obtenons des résultats en plaçant nos clients au premier plan, en faisant le meilleur choix, en agissant avec courage et en croyant que chacun a sa place.


Ce poste est à pourvoir au sein de Banque Laurentienne, une filiale de Banque Laurentienne Groupe Financier.

Le titulaire du poste accueille non seulement les clients en succursale et virtuellement (téléphone/courriel de la succursale), il les aide en répondant à leurs questions courantes transactionnelles. Il les accompagne aussi dans leurs besoins de support additionnel pour les solutions alternatives électroniques ou digitales, dans le but d'améliorer la fluidité de l'expérience globale omnicanale en les dirigeant vers le service approprié. Ce nouveau rôle permet une meilleure transition pour nos clients vers de saines habitudes numériques.

L'ambassadeur Expérience client s'assure de créer le contact avec les clients « walk in », de rencontrer leurs attentes et de les dépasser en offrant un service à la clientèle de qualité et efficace. Il joue un rôle clé d'introduire les clients dans la boucle conseil et est amené à faire de la vente simple de produits transactionnels. Il s'assure que les clients sont écoutés, que leurs questions sont répondues ou référées au bon endroit, peu importe leur provenance ou assignation. Il est également responsable au quotidien de responsabilités de conformité de la succursale d'un point de vue transactionnel.

Responsabilités



º Accueillir chaleureusement en présentiel chaque client et répondre à ses besoins
º Répondre aux appels entrants en succursale et diriger, au besoin, les appels vers les bonnes ressources
º Répondre par courriel aux questionnements, demandes d'informations et suivis de la clientèle de la succursale et des divers départements et diriger, au besoin, vers les bonnes ressources
º Identifier et anticiper les besoins du client afin de bien les prendre en charge
º Accompagner le client dans la transition vers les solutions électroniques (ex : guichet, BLCDirect, application mobile ou site internet) ou vers le bon rôle conseil
º Promouvoir l'offre conseil et renseigner les clients sur les politiques et procédures de la Banque ainsi que sur les différentes campagnes et promotions en cours
º Se positionner comme un point de contact, en collaboration avec les équipes de succursale
º Servir le client ou introduire le client à la ressource concernée afin d'assurer une expérience client efficace et créer un lien de confiance
º Coordonner des demandes clients, des conseillers et de directeur - inter succursales
º Effectuer des ventes simples de produits transactionnels lors de la détection d'opportunités
º S'assurer que les besoins des clients soient traités à la satisfaction de ceux-ci et selon les normes établies


º Effectuer des tâches administratives et assurer le soutien administratif avec les différents services
º Effectuer le suivi du manuel des responsabilités en succursale, des procédures et des normes établies de conformité de la succursale et d'expérience client
º Toute autre tâche connexe pour contribuer à l'amélioration de l'expérience client, à l'accompagnement de nos clients dans la transition numérique et au succès de la succursale, telle la participation aux différentes initiatives locales de performance de l'équipe

Qualifications


Qualifications minimales

º Diplôme d'études secondaire complété
º Bilinguisme (selon les besoins et les régions)

Compétences spécifiques

º Habiletés relationnelles centrées sur le service à la clientèle
º Propension à offrir un service à la clientèle rapide et efficace
º Forte aptitude dans l'organisation du travail et la gestion des priorités
º Forte aptitude de communication (en personne, par téléphone et par écrit)
º Minutie et soucis du travail bien fait

Renseignements supplémentaires


Équité, diversité et inclusion:
Nous sommes fiers d'être un employeur respectueux de l'équité en matière d'emploi, nous nous engageons à favoriser un environnement de travail inclusif et accessible qui reflète la diversité de nos clients et de nos communautés. Nous accueillons et encourageons les candidatures de personnes de tous les groupes, y compris les peuples autochtones, les femmes, les minorités visibles et les personnes handicapées, indépendamment de la race, de l'origine nationale ou ethnique, de la couleur, de la religion, de l'âge, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité ou de l'expression de genre, de l'état matrimonial, de la situation familiale, des caractéristiques génétiques, du handicap ou tout autre motif protégé par la loi.
Accessibilité:
Des accommodements pour les personnes en situation de handicap sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats, et ce, tout au long du processus de recrutement.
LPRDE:
Nous pouvons recueillir, utiliser ou divulguer vos informations personnelles dans le but d'établir une relation de travail avec vous.

title: Member Services Coordinator
description:
(Work place: La Tuque)

Desjardins values diversity and equity in the workforce and is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities by adapting the recruitment process, as needed.

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-04

The incumbent coordinates Member Services operations. He or she organizes daily head office or service centre activities and ensures the quality of services provided to members and customers.

General Information on the Position

Main Responsibilities

  • Participate in work planning and assigning employees based on identified priorities. To this effect, update work schedules and plan for employee replacement to maintain the smooth operation of member and customer services.

  • Act as a resource for sector employees and provide them with the necessary support to carry out their activities. Assist them with processes and tools, authorize operations, and resolve cases of greater complexity.

  • Regularly monitor the queue and make necessary adjustments to boost productivity and improve service quality for members and customers.

  • Participate in resolving complaints and problems communicated to him or her.

  • Oversee the service centre's cash management: order, return and supply equipment, record cash transactions and reconcile general ledger accounts.

  • As needed, carry out monetary transactions and sell convenience products and services (e.g. Desjardins access card, Visa Desjardins card, AccèsD registration, fund transfers, account changes, traveller's cheques, authorized transit limit, inter-caisse authorizations, safety deposit boxes, cash orders). Perform the required operations, and, when necessary, follow up with members and customers.

  • Ensure that all activities are completed in a timely fashion and in accordance with prescribed quality standards.

  • Maintain the security of transactions and operations in accordance with current policies, practices and standards

Other working condition

  • Number of jobs available : 1

Qualifications

  • High school diplomas in a related field

  • A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience

Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

  • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

Specific knowledge

  • Knowledge of all counter and convenience products and services

  • Knowledge of all Desjardins products and services aimed at caisse members and those offered by business centres, components, distribution networks/channels and as well as those of competitors

  • Knowledge of security measures, legal framework and internal controls

  • Understanding of the philosophy and fundamentals of financial services cooperatives

  • Knowledge of policies, legislation, standards and ethics governing the operations of the caisse and its centres

  • Knowledge of operating procedures related to convenience products and services and automated and assisted transactions

  • Knowledge of service standards

Desjardins Cross-sector skills

Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

Key competencies for the job

Work Location

Caisse Desjardins de La Tuque

Trade Union

CAISSE DE LA TUQUE (T: 10103)

Unposting Date

2022-05-18

Job Family

Management support and expertise support (FG)

To this effect, update work schedules and plan for employee replacement to maintain the smooth operation of member and customer services.', 'Participate in resolving complaints and problems communicated to him or her.', "Oversee the service centre's cash management: order, return and supply equipment, record cash transactions and reconcile general ledger accounts.", 'High school diplomas in a related field', 'Act as a resource for sector employees and provide them with the necessary support to carry out their activities. title: Technicien, Support Technique
description:
Stradigi AI est l'un des principaux fournisseurs de plateformes d'IA d'entreprise SaaS en Amérique du Nord qui permet aux organisations de concrétiser rapidement l'IA qui accélère les activités. Sa plate-forme Kepler comble le manque de talents en IA en permettant à tout type d'utilisateur d'accéder à des flux de travail automatisés intuitifs de science des données, conçus pour générer des résultats pour des centaines de cas d'utilisation dans de nombreux secteurs verticaux.

La plate-forme Kepler permet aux utilisateurs d'extraire des informations clés de leurs données pour améliorer l'expérience client, augmenter les revenus et gagner en efficacité dans plusieurs secteurs, notamment CPG/FMCG, e-commerce, plates-formes en ligne, fabrication, services financiers, logistique, etc.

En tant que Technicien, Support Technique chez Stradigi AI, vous assisterez nos utilisateurs finaux au quotidien. Relevant de notre vice-président de la technologie, vous serez responsable de maintenir le système de tickets et de répondre en temps opportun. Vous configurez les ordinateurs, les systèmes téléphoniques, les imprimantes et vous assurez que nos systèmes fonctionnent correctement et sont à jour en tout temps.

Responsabilités:

  • Installation et configuration de systèmes informatiques;
  • Surveillance et maintenance des systèmes et réseaux informatiques ;
  • Dépannage des problèmes de système et de réseau, diagnostic et résolution des pannes matérielles/logicielles;
  • Assurer le bon fonctionnement des systèmes informatiques et remplacer les pièces au besoin;
  • Fournir la documentation d'appui, y compris la documentation procédurale ;
  • Exécution d'applications réseau pour prendre en charge le système et les utilisateurs;
  • Prise en charge de nouvelles applications;
  • Gérer l'accès des utilisateurs aux systèmes et aux applications;
  • Configuration de nouveaux comptes d'utilisateurs;
  • Effectuer des sauvegardes, des récupérations de données et la sécurité du système;
  • Test et implémentation de nouvelles technologies et/ou outils.

Qualifications requises:

  • Un minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire;
  • Très bonne connaissance des systèmes d'exploitation Mac, Windows et Linux;
  • Bilingue (français et anglais), écrit et parlé;
  • Expérience avec G Suite pour les entreprises, Office 365 et Slack ;
  • Expérience avec les systèmes MDM (Jumpcloud, Jamf, Air Watch ou similaire);
  • Expérience en réseautage - Ethernet, TCP/IP et VPN, etc. ;
  • Résoudre les problèmes techniques avec les réseaux locaux (LAN), les réseaux étendus (WAN), (WLAN) et d'autres systèmes ;
  • Expérience avec les services d'annuaire (Active Directory, LDAP);
  • Quelques connaissances en script (fichiers batch, PowerShell, Shell scripts, etc.) requises;
  • Expérience avec les fournisseurs SSO et SAML 2.0 (Jumpcloud, Okta, Onelogin);
  • Expérience avec Jira et les systèmes de billetterie.

Pourquoi considérer Stradigi AI

  • Nous offrons des salaires très intéressants;
  • La possibilité de détenir des actions de notre société via notre programme ESOP;
  • REER correspondant jusqu'à 3 %;
  • Un programme de vacances généreux et des congés payés supplémentaires pendant les vacances;
  • Soins de santé, dentaires et de nombreux autres avantages de bien-être;
  • Travail en présentiel.

Faites partie d'une entreprise d'IA innovante et avant-gardiste qui valorise vraiment ce que vous faites, ce que vous pensez et ce que vous ressentez.

title: Techno Administrative Clerk
description:
You are looking for a job as a clerk and you have a well-developed techno side? Here is a new opportunity as an administrative clerk to work in the business law department of a large law firm in downtown Montreal.

Main functions:

-Perform reprography work (printing from electronic files, scanning, photocopying, etc.);

-Time entries and invoicing;

-Prepare expense reports for professionals;

-Classify digital or paper documents and files;

-All other related tasks.

Your qualifications:

-Post-secondary studies (DEP, AEC or DEC) in secretarial or office technology;

-A minimum of 1 year of relevant experience preferably in a professional environment;

-Bilingualism French/English;

-Excellent command of the Microsoft Office suite;

-Attention to detail and work well done, rigor;

-Ability to organize and prioritize work with method and precision;

-Demonstrate dynamism and a positive attitude;

-Autonomy, initiative and ability to work in a team;

-Good learning ability for the use of various software;

-Tact, courtesy and discretion.

Are you very comfortable at the computer, do you like contact and are not afraid to ask questions?

You are the person we need to come and lend a hand to the assistants in the department!

Open salary based on experience and full range of benefits.
Send us your application!

As an equal opportunity employer, Personnel Alter Ego values diversity in its workforce and seeks to ensure all groups remain fairly represented. Candidates must have the legal right to work in Canada.

title: Customer Service Consultant (Bilingual & Full Time)
description:
This is a remote position which means you get to work from home! 
We ask our teams to rally one day a month at a Rogers location for a special culture day once we return.Location: 800 de la Gauchetière Ouest, Montréal,QC
 At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment. Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuels us, and moments define us. Wondering what it takes to join our team? Click here to try our interactive experience. We recommend that you use Chrome, Safari, Firefox or Internet Explorer 11.37 or above. You can also try it on your mobile device! Rogers is a proud Canadian company with a rich family history. That’s why it’s always been important to us to give back to our communities and make a positive impact where we live and work. Our team is dedicated to making more possible every day for our customers and for our communities across Canada.  Not only is our business strong, but so is our culture. We genuinely care about each other and we know what makes you different makes us great. That’s why we believe in challenging work, rewarding opportunities and building an inclusive future for everyone. Because when our team learns, grows and reaches their true potential – we can make more possible. At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities, build the future you want with us.  Let’s make your possible at Rogers. Are you passionate about customer service and looking for the best team to join? Listen to this: We believe in challenging work, rewarding opportunities and giving back to our communities. We’re committed to investing in your development to unleash your potential so we can win as a team. We know that what makes you different makes us great. With us, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities and you can build the future you aspire. Life at Fido – What’s in it for you <<@Fido or follow us on LinkedIn>>As part of the team, you will have access to a ton of amazing resources, discounts and perks.  To name a few: Employee discounts to our products and services such as 50% on your wireless account.Full benefits including our wealth accumulation plan that includes Rogers shares; you invest in our company and we match your contribution up to 50%, this is like receiving a bonus every pay!Giving back to our community is a value at Fido: you get paid time off for volunteeringYour wellbeing is important to us: We have creative programs that focus on physical fitness like LIVX and Mental wellbeing providing you unlimited access to Headspace Premium for mindfulness training – and many more.Are you part of an equity-seeking group? We have employee resource groups to continue to shape our culture of allyship. People of Colour, LGBTQ2S, Indigenous Peoples, Person with Disabilities, and Women. Have other ideas? We want to hear it. We believe in Inclusion and Diversity.  https://youtu.be/i8Cp-R42LtIWorking from the comfort of your home until it is safe to come back to our amazing brand-new renovated office in downtown Montreal which includes a Gym, Cafeteria and much more.Be part of the iconic Fido headquarters based in Montreal that offers extensive career opportunities in all lines of businesses. If your friend thinks that:You are friendly and empathicYou have great listening and communication skills both in French and EnglishYou love helping others and solve problemsChange is something you embrace, and you are driven by a fast-paced environmentLearning new computer systems doesn’t scare youWorking a flexible schedule fits your lifestyle …Send us your resume! What You’ll DoOur customers come first, and they inspire everything we do.  As part of our team, you will be providing world-class customer service by connecting with our customers, analyzing their needs and offering customized solutions.  You will be navigating through our systems to find the solutions and/or the products that best suit our customers and you will be speaking to different people from across Canada. Are you up for the challenge and the fun? Available to start on June 21th 2022? Let’s talk. We want to get to know you and tell you more about this opportunity. Who You Are  High School Diploma or equivalent 
1 years of customer interaction in a professional role, either face to face or over the phone 
Expert in communication and listening in English & French 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
Ability to work a flexible schedule  
Navigate multiple computer systems

title: Member Service Representative (Part-time)
company: DUCA Financial Services Credit Union Ltd.
description:
Member Service Representative (Part-time)

DUCA is currently looking for a part-time (15-20 hours per week) Member Service Representative (MSR) to join our dynamic CBC branch! 

The ideal candidate for this role is passionate about delivering outstanding customer service and enjoys working with a team to achieve objectives! We are looking for driven, organized individuals who thrive on interacting with customers, and are committed to helping Members by identifying opportunities through communication and inquiry. MSR’s are curious about what Members need and want to know what they can do to help Members do more, be more, and achieve more with their money and their lives.

Branch Hours

Mon to Wed: 9:30 am to 5:00 pm
Thur: 9:30 am to 7:00 pm
Fri: 9:30 am to 5:00 pm

Job Purpose & Summary

Reporting to the Branch Manager, the Member Servcie Representative provides outstanding customer service that is accurate, timely, and efficient. MSRs partner with other members of the branch team to collaborate and deliver the best solutions to help our Members achieve their financial goals. The MSR acts as a representative of DUCA and greets Members when they arrive and ensure they feel welcome. 

MSR’s also uncover opportunities where we can better help DUCA Members, and potential Members, with our fantastic array of banking solutions and services. Once they identify the opportunity, the MSR figures out who can best help the Member, whether it be themselves or a DUCA advisor (Financial Services Officer). They will always follow up to ensure the Member was taken care of once they have referred.

As for the day-to-day responsibilities, the MSR will maintain cash balances, list and balance outgoing cheques, and balance all daily transactions. The MSR will ensure they are aware of, and adhere to, operating procedures and policies to safeguard the assets of the organization and the member.

Key Accountabilities & Duties

  • Provide outstanding service to Members (both at the front counter and/or by phone), answer inquiries and always strive to increase Member satisfaction through service provided. The objective is to delight the member.
  • Making outbound awareness and service follow up calls to members.
  • Handle Member requests for deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and other basic transactions.
  • Promote DUCA’s services by explaining benefits and features of DUCA solutions.
  • Identify and fulfill Members’ financial service needs, including cashing and certifying cheques, processing bill payments, ordering cheques, buying/selling foreign currencies, processing Member statements, identifying the need for travel insurance, processing RRSP and term deposit transactions, assisting Members in getting a debit card, and online banking set up.
  • Promotes DUCA products and services when a need or opportunity specific to the member is identified.
  • Having up front dialogue with members to identify unrealized needs. Proficient at “opportunity spotting”.
  • Make referrals to specialists and advisors as required.
  • Solve member issues and know when to escalate if required.
  • Participates in the counting of large cash deposits.
  • Rotate with staff to cover reception duties and tasks.
  • Assists with general office duties, processing and administration as required.

Occupational Experience & Education Requirements

  • High School Diploma or equivalent (Post-Secondary School Preferred)
  • Experience helping Members or customers in either a bank or credit union for a minimum of 2 years considered an asset
  • Previous experience with sales is considered an asset
  • Cash handling experience

Knowledge, Skills & Attributes

  • Basic mathematical skills 
  • You have a desire to learn and grow
  • Working directly with members and customers is what makes you tick
  • You are a big fan of team work and demonstrate your enthusiasm for your job and member every day
  • You are a terrific multi-tasker and can organize and prioritize other work while putting the member first
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • You have a keen attention to detail and emotional intelligence.

Department: Retail Banking

Primary Location: CBC Branch - 17 John Street, Toronto ON M5V 3G6

Employment Status: Part time 

Hours per Week: 15-20 

Job Grade Level: Two (2)

About DUCA

DUCA exists to help people do more, be more and achieve more with their money and their lives. We’re driven by a co-operative philosophy that puts our Members (and Owners) at the centre of every decision we make, gives them a voice in how we’re run, and rewards them for their loyalty by sharing our profits.

At DUCA, we’re dedicated to creating a positive environment where our employees have growth and development opportunities, a healthy work/life balance, opportunities to give back to the community, and a focus on doing what is right for our Members. DUCA offers a competitive total compensation package including base salary, a short-term incentive (bonus) program, a comprehensive benefits program, pension plan, and employee banking benefits.

DUCA is committed to employment equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Recruitment related accommodations will be provided upon request.

Qualified applicants are encouraged to submit their application. Applications must include both a resume and cover letter.

We thank all applicants but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Représentant(e), Service à la clientèle (Jusqu'à 19$/hr selon l'expérience)
description:
Spécialiste de location

easyhome constitue la plus importante société de location-vente de marchandise au Canada. À partir de plus de 170 succursales d'un océan à l'autre, nous offrons aux clients des meubles de maison, des électroménagers et des appareils électroniques de marque de la plus haute qualité par l'intermédiaire d'ententes de location pratiques hebdomadaires ou mensuelles.

Salaire: 17-19$ de l'heure (selon l'expérience) incluant bonus mensuels disponible et avantages sociaux

 

Que fait un spécialiste de location?

  • Il crée des expériences client hors pair dans nos magasins de détail en fournissant un excellent service à la clientèle et en vendant des baux pour des meubles et des appareils électroniques aux nouveaux clients et aux clients existants.
  • Il maximise la croissance du magasin de détail – Les spécialistes des ventes assurent la rentabilité du magasin de détail et s'assurent que chaque vente est optimale autant pour le client que pour notre entreprise de détail.
  • Il gère les activités de vente générales quotidiennes – Les spécialistes des ventes gèrent les comptes client, les activités de recouvrement, ainsi que le marchandisage et l'entretien du magasin.
  • Il veille à fournir des expériences client positives lors de chaque interaction tout en veillant à ce que tous les clients potentiels dans le magasin soient accueillis de manière chaleureuse et empathique.
  • Il tire profit des occasions de ventes additionnelles et de produits supplémentaires en portant attention aux besoins des clients tout en assurant un service à la clientèle de la plus haute qualité.
  • Il est ouvert. Il fait preuve de transparence pour communiquer les modalités de nos ententes de location et il respecte les meilleures pratiques de vente afin de minimiser les recouvrements futurs.

Voici ce que nous recherchons :

  • De l'expérience en vente ou en recouvrement est un atout, mais nous voulons vraiment des personnes motivées par le succès qui surpassent les objectifs. Une attitude compétitive en vente et dans le service à la clientèle, puisque c'est la clé de notre société de vente au détail.
  • De l'expérience de travail dans un environnement de vente au détail axé sur les objectifs de vente et une attention particulière portée sur le service à la clientèle constitue un excellent atout.
  • Un candidat axé sur la personne, entreprenant et bon communicateur qui a la capacité de fournir une expérience mémorable aux clients lors de chaque vente de produits financiers.
  • Des compétences avec les ordinateurs de bureau, la suite Microsoft Office (Excel, Word et Outlook), une excellente aptitude de saisie sur clavier et la capacité d'apprendre et de maîtriser de nouveaux programmes logiciels.
  • La capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois et une bonne adaptation aux changements dans un environnement de vente dynamique.
  • De l'empathie, de la compassion et la capacité à faire preuve d'intégrité lors de chaque vente – un grand soin porté à chacun de nos clients!
  • De l'expérience en conduite de camion de livraison serait un atout non obligatoire; capacité physique à déplacer des meubles dans le magasin de détail.
  • Un permis de conduire valide et un dossier de conduite vierge (pour les 3 dernières années), ainsi qu'une vérification positive des antécédents.

Information supplémentaire :

Tous les candidats envisagés pour le poste doivent se soumettre au contrôle du dossier criminel en lien avec l'emploi et faire valider leur expérience de travail afin de se qualifier. Les candidats doivent avoir un horaire flexible pour veiller à ce que les heures de l'emplacement puissent être comblées de manière à répondre aux besoins de nos clients – les détails concernant chaque emplacement seront abordés lors du processus d'embauche.

Nous remercions tous les candidats intéressés par le poste, toutefois nous ne communiquerons qu'avec ceux retenus pour l'entrevue et qui possèdent les compétences et les qualifications susmentionnées.

Inclusion sociale et l'égalité des chances en matière d'emploi

goeasy est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi. De plus, goeasy s'engage à prendre des mesures d'adaptation pour les candidats qui en font la demande à n'importe quelle étape du processus de recrutement, et ce, conformément aux exigences prévues par la loi partout au Canada. Veuillez nous aviser à tout moment durant le processus de recrutement si vous avez besoin d'accommodements en raison d'une invalidité et nous collaborerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

title: Temporary Customer Care Representative
description:
Temporary Customer Care Representative

 

GrandBridge Energy Inc., formed in May 2022 as the result of the merger of the former Brantford Power Inc. and Energy+ Inc., is the seventh largest municipally owned electricity distributor in Ontario. GrandBridge Energy delivers safe and reliable electricity to 109,000 customers in the City of Brantford, the City of Cambridge, the County of Brant and the Township of North Dumfries. The team provides safe and reliable energy solutions that are strengthened by an unwavering commitment to service excellence. 

GrandBridge Energy is looking for a temporary (12 month) Customer Care Representative (CCR) at our Brantford office who will be responsible for supporting all aspects of the customer’s experience with GrandBridge Energy. With a customer-focused attitude, the CCR will interact with customers to provide and process information in response to a variety of telephone and email inquiries, concerns and requests using superior contact handling and active listening skills. The successful candidate will have a good working knowledge of the Ontario electricity sector and will possess strong organizational and analytical skills, excellent written and verbal communications, and the ability to manage customer calls while working effectively and efficiently in a team-oriented environment.   

Applicants must have successfully completed a two-year college diploma in business administration or a related field. A minimum of one (1) year of relevant customer service experience is required, preferably in a utility customer service or call centre environment. Proficiency in the MS Office suite of applications is required. Candidates may be tested. 

Employment is contingent upon your provision of proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical reasons or based on creed, we would ask that you kindly provide satisfactory evidence in support of an accommodation under the Human Rights Code. 

We offer an excellent working environment, career path exploration and development opportunities, a comprehensive total rewards package, and opportunities to get involved with teams and charitable events that support and make a difference in our community. To become a member of our team, please forward your resume by May 19, 2022 to careers@grandbridgeenergy.com. When applying for the position, please quote “Temporary Customer Care Representative” in the subject line.

 

GrandBridge Energy

150 Savannah Oaks Drive

Brantford, Ontario N3V 1E7

or email: careers@grandbridgeenergy.com

Check us out at https://grandbridgeenergy.com/

 

  

 

We appreciate the opportunity to review all resumes, however due to volume, only those under consideration will be contacted. We retain all resumes for a period of 12 months. In the event a similar position becomes available, your application may be considered.

GrandBridge Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is AODA compliant.

title: Member Service Representative I
description:
Join the Cornerstone Crew!

Member Service Representative I (Casual)* - Wynyard Branch


Be Part of Something . . . . .

If you are an outgoing individual who thrives in a fast-paced work environment and prides yourself on helping others, we want you! We're looking for a customer focused Member Service Representative I with excellent communication skills and who is not afraid of a challenge to join our team at the Wynyard Branch of Cornerstone Credit Union!

As the Member Service Representative I you will promote and sell credit union products and services while processing member transactions through a range of routine cash and non-cash services to new and existing members. You will seek opportunities for our members financial wellness and make quality referrals to our retail team.

*This position is a casual position, so the available hours will vary, including up to full-time on occasion.


What We Are Looking For . . . . .

To be considered for our Member Service Representative I position, you must have Grade 12 education with post-secondary education being preferred, and up to one year of related sales and customer service experience. If you already know about the features and benefits of credit union products and services that's an extra bonus!

You must be able to recognize cross selling opportunities, make or refer sales, handle cash accurately and have strong verbal and written communication skills.

A commitment to continuous learning and development is an important part of being on our team as well as taking pride in caring for our members and providing top-notch customer service!


What You Will Receive . . . . .

Our employees enjoy a competitive compensation and benefit package that includes matched pension contributions and wellness and employment perks that contribute to a healthy work-life balance.

On top of earning a bi-weekly pay cheque, you will also be eligible to receive additional pay for outstanding individual performance through our incentive pay program!

Formal & informal development opportunities offering challenge and growth.

The opportunity to be an integral member of a team of professionals in a supportive and collaborative environment motivated to do the best for their team and their members.


We Say We Care, and We Mean It ♥

Cornerstone Credit Union has been named one of Saskatchewan's Top employers for 2022! This is the 6th consecutive year we have received this recognition.

We serve 35,000 members, employ 280 people and manage assets of about $2 billion.

This is an in-scope position, and membership in the RWDSU is required.

We are a Cornerstone family; fun, inclusive, supportive and respectful. Wouldn't you want to be a part of that!

Check out our website at www.cornerstonecu.com

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Key Food Equipment Services is looking for a full-time, permanent Customer Service Representative. The CSR's at Key are the first point of contact for the customer, so their main priority is to welcome them, hear their concerns, and leave them with the confidence that they have been listened to and that they will be looked after. The day goes by quickly in this fast-paced environment. There's always something to learn and this keeps the job fresh and challenging!

There are also professional development opportunities that come up as the company continues to grow. Strong interpersonal skills are absolutely essential for success in this role, as well as the ability to be careful, articulate, and accurate. This particular role includes participation in the on-call rotation for emergency calls, because we provide customer service 24/7. If you are professional, quick to learn, and accurate; and if you love interacting with people, we encourage you to apply to join our dynamic team.

What You Need

  • 2-3 years previous office experience and customer service experience preferred
  • Superior communication skills when dealing with challenging and reactive service calls
  • Excellent computer skills; savvy with new ERP programs and MS Office (Excel);
  • Typing speed of 40-60 wpm
  • Excellent attention to detail; accurate and efficient with data entry
  • Need strong memory retention - we service over 300 manufacturers and 1000's of customers
  • Geographically savvy; has better than basic understanding of western provinces
  • Flexible and able to participate in the on-call rotation and be available outside of office hours

Why Work for Key

  • We are profitable, stable, and growing - which makes us exciting to be a part of!
  • We are the industry leader in technical expertise and market penetration.
  • We recognize high performance and support continued development.
  • Our people are fun and collaborative while being hard-working and dedicated to the success of our business.
  • If you have the drive, we have the have opportunity for growth and input.
  • We provide a competitive compensation and benefits package and opportunities for education funding.

We look for people with a clear drive for delivering service excellence with integrity, from a team-driven and dynamic mindset. If this is the right fit for you, please provide your resume and cover letter, and let us know what makes you the right fit for Key!

title: Administrative Clerk II - (Job Number: 43393)
description:
Description43393
Qualifications

Integrated Infrastructure Services is looking for an organized and motivated individual with excellent multitasking capabilities to join our team. This is a challenging, fast paced and detail oriented position. Interested? Apply now!


As the Administrative Clerk, you will provide administrative support to the Director and Section more broadly. You will be responsible for providing a broad range of clerical and administrative services in support of the day-to-day needs of the Director and the smooth operation of the section. This position requires a high degree of collaboration, working as part of a greater administrative team supporting the Technical Services and Project Management Centre of Excellence sections. The work requires a high degree of independent decision making regarding the diverse and varied duties and assignments, and you will also work collectively with the mindset of contributing to and meeting the overall needs of all the areas within the Section.


In this role you will:

  • Provide and coordinate various administrative services including: coordination of telecommunications; directory updates; stationery orders; corporate procurement card transactions; reception duties;
  • Provide administrative support in the set up of new staff hires, workstation set-up and coordinate building maintenance requests as per corporate procedures
  • Perform IT Asset Management duties including: tracking of assets (computer hardware/software, cell phones, etc.), coordinating replacement of assets for staff
  • Provide support to the Director and section: responding to telephone, e-mail, in person inquiries and organize meetings
  • Manage the flow of incoming and outgoing correspondence, ensuring that documents are recorded and managed according to policy and procedures
  • Provide assistance in the administration and records management of staff vacation schedules, EDO's and other HR related administrative duties
  • Create and maintain files and file documents in accordance with Corporate and Departmental records management procedures and standards
  • Ensure document management, retention, disposition and distribution adhere to FOIP requirements
  • Manage the distribution of materials quality assurance reports for the Construction Materials Engineering & Testing area including: scanning paper reports, filing digital copies and sending the reports to the appropriate parties
  • Manage the Engineering Services Building Library, including payments and reproducing materials
  • Format various documents (memos, letters, reports, inquiries etc.) and ensure documents are in the appropriate applications required for publishing
  • Proofread reports and publications for accuracy, quality and consistency with department and city standards
  • Prepare and assist in the development of presentations; organize meetings and workshops including book meeting locations, prepare and mail meeting notifications and agendas, record and distribute minutes, follow-up to ensure work and action items assigned at meetings are completed

title: Bilingual Customer Experience Representative / Représentant Bilingue de l'Expérience à la clientèle
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security


At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond.


Job Description


At Allegion: We’re Redefining Security . Allegion products help keep people safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 highly recognizable brands sold globally like Schlage, LCN, Von Duprin, Glynn Johnson, Locknetics, Ives etc., we specialize in security around the doorway and adjacent area: everything from residential locks and portable security to commercial locks, exit devices, openers and closers, electronic access control and workforce productivity solutions.


At the core of this $2.7 billion business is the knowledge and experience of over 11,000+ dedicated employees across the globe and - we’re growing!


The Bilingual Customer Experience Representative will interact with external customers, via email and phone to provide superior level of customer service. This position will also work closely with various internal departments including sales, operations, marketing, IT, and finance to deliver a positive customer experience while meeting our corporate goals.


What you will do


+ Communicate directly with customers via phone and email to identify and resolve a wide variety of issues and inquiries regarding product availability, order fulfillment, post shipment issues, programs, pricing, and policies.

+ Research, document and administer product warranty programs including credits, replacements and return material authorizations.

+ Edit, enter, and modify customer orders in the business operating system in an accurate and timely manner, as required.

+ Act as consultant to advise basic product application.

+ Represent the organization daily through customer contact and relationship-building.

+ Work with internal departments to enable accurate account management and resolution of customer issues.

+ Make all necessary modifications and updates in the business systems to support all company processes.

+ Meet all service level agreements as set by management.

+ Adhere to all Allegion Canada Inc. policies and procedures including Health and Safety.


What you will need


+ Ability to communicate in a professional, positive, courteous manner always with all levels of customers, clients, visitors, and employees.

+ Understand basic customer needs and expectations to provide prompt effective resolution to requests.

+ Ability to communicate complete solutions to customers in ways they can understand and implement.

+ Self-motivated with ability to establish priorities and effectively manage time to complete multiple tasks within specified timeframes.

+ Excellent written and verbal communications skills with the ability to apply problem solving techniques.

+ Bilingual (French/English) is mandatory.

+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Office and manufacturing operating system (AS400)

+ Post-Secondary Education

+ Minimum 2 years related customer service /industry experience


Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if: 


+ You are seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others.  With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html) .

+ You value personal well-being and balance because we do too! 

+ You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development.  As we grow, we want you to grow with us. 

+ You want a culture that promotes work-life balance.  Our employees enjoy generous time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work! 


What You'll Get from Us:


+ A commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging: making a difference and leading with purpose

+ High energy, influential, cross collaborative team environment

+ Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through Clifton Strengths testing and coaching.

+ Customized individual development plans and growth maps to help you unlock your full potential and career graph with Allegion.

+ Competitive base salary

+ Flexible, Hybrid model of working


+ Health, dental and other insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy” (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)   

+ Tuition Reimbursement  

+ Employee Discounts

+ Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”  (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/culture.html#serve)


Want to know more about us? Follow this link https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/index.html to learn more.


Apply to join our team today. We look forward to hearing from you!


Ce poste interagira avec les clients externes, par courriel électronique et par téléphone pour fournir un niveau supérieur de service à la clientèle. Ce poste travaillera également en étroite collaboration avec divers services internes, notamment les ventes, les opérations, le marketing, l'informatique et les finances, afin d'offrir une expérience positive à la clientèle tout en atteignant nos objectifs d'entreprise.


Responsabilités Essentielles


+ Communiquer directement avec les clients par téléphone et par courriel électronique pour identifier et résoudre une grande variété de problèmes et de demandes concernant la disponibilité des produits, l'exécution des commandes, les problèmes après expédition, les programmes, les prix et les politiques.

+ Rechercher, documenter et administrer les programmes de garantie des produits, y compris les crédits, les remplacements et les autorisations de retour de matériel.

+ Éditer, saisir et modifier les commandes des clients dans le système d'exploitation de l'entreprise de manière précise et opportune, selon les besoins.

+ Agir en tant que consultant pour conseiller l'application de base du produit.

+ Représenter l'organisation au quotidien par contact avec les clients et l'établissement de relations.

+ Travailler avec les départements internes pour permettre une gestion précise des comptes et la résolution des problèmes des clients.

+ Apporter toutes les modifications et mises à jour nécessaires dans les systèmes d'entreprise pour prendre en charge tous les processus de l'entreprise.

+ Respecter tous les accords de niveau de service définis par la direction.

+ Adhérer à toutes les politiques et procédures d'Allegion Canada Inc., y compris la santé et la sécurité.


Connaissances,Compétences et Capacités


+ Capacité à communiquer de manière professionnelle, positive et courtoise en tout temps avec tous les niveaux de clients, visiteurs et employés.

+ Comprendre les besoins et les attentes de base des clients pour fournir une résolution rapide et efficace aux demandes.

+ Capacité à communiquer des solutions complètes aux clients d'une manière qu'ils peuvent comprendre et mettre en œuvre.

+ Motivé avec la capacité d'établir des priorités et de gérer efficacement le temps pour effectuer plusieurs tâches dans les délais spécifiés.

+ Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale avec la capacité d'appliquer des techniques de résolution de problèmes.

+ Le bilinguisme (français/anglais) est obligatoire.

+ Connaissance pratique de Microsoft Office et du système d'exploitation de fabrication (AS400).

+ L'Éducation Post-Secondaire

+ Minimum de 2 ans d'expérience dans le domaine du service à la clientèle et de l'industrie


We Celebrate Who We Are!


Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do. We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team .


© Allegion plc, 2020 | Block D, Iveagh Court, Harcourt Road, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin, Ireland


REGISTERED IN IRELAND WITH LIMITED LIABILITY REGISTERED NUMBER 527370


Allegion is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer (https://www.allegion.com/corp/en/careers/equal-opportunity.html)


Privacy Policy

title: Service Technician - Ontario Beer Operations
description:
Job Description :


We are looking for an individual who is safety oriented, dependable and strives to be an ambassador to Diageo’s portfolio of brands. Your technical proficiency and problem-solving skills, focus on customer service and overall focus on brand quality will assure our consumers experience the best possible product when visiting our partner licensee locations!


Context | Scope:


As a member of our team, you will be Diageo’s ambassador for full beer & spirits portfolio in the on-premise trade.


We are strongly focused on quality and customer service. Your positive attitude towards building solid foundations with our licensee base will compliment your technical abilities and skills!


Responsibilities:


+ Regular preventative maintenance of draught beer equipment in trade

+ Assess and audit brand quality in the field

+ Responsible for geographic account base of approximately 140-180 customer locations in a thorough and consistent rotation within a 30-45 day period

+ Timely response to installation and emergency repair requests

+ Advise customers of work performed or required to maintain draught beer systems

+ Maintain and submit records for all work performed

+ Co-ordinate with Operations Manager(s) and other team members to deliver on key business objectives

+ Occasional delivery of products to customer location and a backup resource to keg delivery team when required

+ Pick up COD payments and submit to office as instructed

+ Follow all company safety and quality assurance guidelines

+ Maintain a clean driving record

+ Operate vehicle in a safe manner

+ General upkeep and safety checks of assigned company vehicle(s)

+ Handle in-vehicle parts and materials inventory

+ Understand and adhere to all internal policies (Code of Business Conduct)

+ Promote Responsible Drinking in and out of the workplace


Relationships


+ Ontario Beer Operations team (Management, Customer Service, Service Technicians, Delivery and Warehouse personnel)

+ Ontario Sales / Marketing team

+ Ontario customer base (approximately 1800+ licensees)


Required Experience | Skills | Capabilities:


+ First class customer service skills based on genuine passion for our brands

+ Valid Ontario Class G License (or DZ an asset) and clean Drivers Abstract

+ Ability to locate customer sites within Ontario

+ Minimum 1-year external experience in draught equipment service OR 8-12 week minimum training period (in house) with skills evaluations and development

+ Some technical skills from other industries are highly transferrable

+ Expert problem solving and technical abilities around installation, maintenance, and repair of draught beer equipment

+ Strong attention to detail and highly organised

+ Excellent communication skills with a positive attitude

+ Proficient and flexible in time management

+ Adaptable to changes in business requirements

+ Strong evaluation and record keeping skills

+ Ability to work outside of regular business hours as required

+ Capable of working in a mobile environment with little supervision

+ Physical ability and willingness to assist in product delivery

+ Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19

+ Ability to make discretionary decisions appropriately


More About Us:


From Arthur Guinness to Johnnie Walker, our business was founded on people of great character and in 250 years, nothing’s changed. We’re the world’s leading premium alcohol company. Our brands are industry icons. And our success is thanks to the strength of our people, in every role. It’s why we trust them with our legacy. And it’s why we reward them with the career-defining opportunities that they deserve.


Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world. To achieve these, we need the world’s very best people.


We're looking for people with creativity, boldness and a sense of purpose to take Diageo and our timeless, pioneering brands to the next level.


Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you.


Worker Type :


Regular


Primary Location:


Dunwin


Additional Locations :


Job Posting Start Date :


2022-05-05-07:00

As a global leader in beverage alcohol, our 200+ brands are part of everyday celebrations in over 180 countries. Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world.


Ever since Arthur Guinness took out a 9,000 year lease on a Dublin brewery, some 250 years ago, we became a business that is defined by the character of the people who work here. It took immense character from Alexander Walker to convince the captains of every ship in the port of Glasgow to take crates of Johnnie Walker to the four corners of the world. Today, nothing’s changed.


We’re proud to be more than 27,775 talented people . While they make our iconic brands ever stronger around the world, we help them go further than they thought possible. Diageo is where you’ll find a wide variety of personalities, experiences and perspectives , wherever you’re based in the world. It makes for a stimulating and rewarding working environment, where everyone can flourish.


DRINKiQ


What's your DRINKiQ? Take our quiz to understand how alcohol is made and explore the effects of drinking. You can discover everything you need to know on DRINKiQ website (https://www.diageo.com/en/in-society/drinkiq/alcohol-facts/) .

title: Customer Service Representative (Part Time) - Vernon
description:
Are you passionate about working with people and technology? Are you looking for a job or career that is inclusive, fulfilling, and fun?  

As Canada's destination for the coolest tech, Best Buy offers one of the best work environments in the country! Annually recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, our culture is one of inclusion and recognition. We encourage our employees to learn, grow and advance within our organization.
 

What you might call a Customer Service Representative, at Best Buy we call an Omni-Channel Specialist. In this role you will create an amazing customer experience by: 

  • Processing our customers’ purchases at the checkout
  • Processing returns, trade-ins and more at the customer service counter
  • Responding to customer concerns with a focus on creating an amazing customer experience
  • Completing pre-opening and post-closing tasks
  • Ensuring store signage is accurate and open box items are appropriately marked
  • Ensuring shelves and displays are well-stocked and organized

What you’ll bring to Best Buy: 

  • Enthusiasm to support and assist our customers
  • Flexibility to adapt to dynamic situations that will arise during busy times 
  • An interest in growing your skills through company training programs and maintaining current knowledge of the latest technology products and industry trends
  • A commitment to representing our brand and values, upholding our operational standards, and maintaining safety protocols in our working environment  

What we proudly offer you:

  • Ability to work flexible schedule as per business needs
  • Employee discounts on awesome tech 
  • An enthusiastic, fun and supportive team who you will quickly call friends  
  • Opportunities to learn about products, achieve certifications and build new skills

We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology. 

Join our amazing team!

We are looking for people just like you.
