title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Customer Service Representative Position summary You’re a “get it done” kind of person who believes in outrageously great customer service and has fun solving problems and making things work
Guess what? So is everyone on Team Convoy! Whether online, on the phone, or walking into our store, our customers depend on Convoy’s Customer Service staff to be their Navigators for Success
This is a mission-critical, roll up your sleeves and your brain power kind of job
You will learn more about servicing the world of construction materials than you ever dreamed possible! Responsibilities Process customer transactions such as orders, quotes, and/or returns Coordinate delivery and/or pick up of customer orders with the operations team Educate customers on different products and their applications Generate, place and confirm purchase orders with suppliers Receive payment for merchandise or services sold and log sales into the computer; responsible for payments received and adhering all administrative and accounting related procedures Participate in the physical inventory of warehouse materials Qualifications Experience assisting customers with product procurement - preferably in the building supply and/or construction industry
Problem solving skills with a natural ability to respond quickly and accurately to inquiries, handle a fast-paced environment, and keep a sense of humor
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) Excellent decision making and ability to take initiative
Extremely organized, strong attention to detail Must be a respectful team player
The Offer Competitive salary - we take great pride in offering our workforce the best benefits and compensation packages in our industry, and we think you will too
Healthcare and Dental for single, couple or family coverage Insurance benefits and employee assistance program Group RRSP – save for retirement – you are eligible after 1 year of continuous employment and Convoy matches your contribution based on years of service Time Off – Everyone needs time away from work to recharge and be with family and friends - receive a generous amount of paid holidays Employee Referral Bonus Program Paid training/tuition reimbursement – Ready to further your education? Open door policy in a supportive and encouraging work environment Overtime available in peak periods Internal Promotions - Find out more at https://www
convoy-supply
com/careers/overview Additional information: Convoy can be a job… or a career
Find out more at https://www
convoy-supply
com/careers/overview Company overview Convoy Supply is a leading wholesale distributor of construction materials with 44 locations across North America, from the Canadian Rockies and Pacific Northwest forests, across the Prairies to the Great Lakes and places in between
Our company was founded in 1972 and Team Convoy prides itself on being the most responsive, problem solving and fun place for our customers to conduct business
We want them to know that they can LEAN ON US! Not magic
Convoy

title: Service Coordinator
description:
Would you be interested in a Coordinator (Admin & Finance) opportunity to gain experience supporting a Top Employer in Canada? Our client, a reputable organization in the Consumer Packaged Goods/Grocery Industry is seeking individuals with 1-2 years of administrative experience to fill an opening they currently have as a Service Coordinator. This role is a mix of finance and admin. This is a 7 month contract however there is always a possibility to move into another role within the team in future based on performance and business needs. This role will be working on-site in their Vaughan office.

Service Coordinator – Display Fixtures

What You'll Do:

• Dispatch technicians to service calls.

• Review time sheets for accuracy: Employee name & number, date, hrs claimed, job #’s, w/orders accounted for, signature on t/sheet, night shift premiums, lead hand, gas ticket etc. Calculate total hrs worked. Check for start times and OT hrs. Timesheets will be automated though our technician app called Officetrax and communicated to payroll. New tasks revolving this new process with be set at that time.

• Review work orders for complete information - store #, SAP work order numbers, correct GL acct #’s, date, name, materials, mileage, inventory #’s,po’s posted to the right w/order, Labour hrs match t/sheet. Fill out install sheets for various jobs. Attach to t/sheet.

• Review refrigerant information on work orders & leak reports for accuracy/completeness, & give to zone manager for review, & ensure all losses are report as mandated by provincial guidelines.

• Create customer and third party invoices using the Officetrax system. Add details to PO as to description of worked performed, verify hours, verify material purchased as well as inventory and refrigerant. Verify that all documents have been uploaded to the work order.

• Have manager sign off on all tools, safety gear, cell phone purchases and other expenses incurred by the branches. Signature required.

• Phone supplier for invoices when pricing is not complete on purchase orders.

• Check work orders for stores that are under warranty and give to manager for review and signature.

• Procure materials for manager/technicians.

• Review all expense reports, work with technicians to correct any deficiencies. Make sure for travel that itinerary is attached and hotel invoice is turned in timely. Check for baggage receipts, parking, and other misc receipts attached.

• Follow up with technicians by e-mail or phone call on missing po’s, w/orders, supplier invoices, warranty credits etc.

What You'll Have:

• 1-2 years of Administrative experience

• Demonstrated proficiency in all aspects of MS Office: with advanced knowledge of Outlook and Excel.

• High level of accuracy and attention to detail

• Excellent customer service orientation, sensitive to client issues and understanding of importance of diplomacy and confidentiality

• Demonstrated ability to interact professionally with people at various levels of an organization

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Ability to multi-task in a deadline driven environment

• Initiative, strong judgment and problem-solving abilities

• Ability to work independently and while supporting a collaborative team environment

﻿HirePower Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to accessibility for all persons with disabilities, HirePower Inc. will, upon the request of the applicant, provide accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure equal access to applicants with disabilities. We will consult with applicants to ensure a suitable accommodation is provided.

title: Temporary Customer Care Representative
description:
Temporary Customer Care Representative

 

GrandBridge Energy Inc., formed in May 2022 as the result of the merger of the former Brantford Power Inc. and Energy+ Inc., is the seventh largest municipally owned electricity distributor in Ontario. GrandBridge Energy delivers safe and reliable electricity to 109,000 customers in the City of Brantford, the City of Cambridge, the County of Brant and the Township of North Dumfries. The team provides safe and reliable energy solutions that are strengthened by an unwavering commitment to service excellence. 

GrandBridge Energy is looking for a temporary (12 month) Customer Care Representative (CCR) at our Brantford office who will be responsible for supporting all aspects of the customer’s experience with GrandBridge Energy. With a customer-focused attitude, the CCR will interact with customers to provide and process information in response to a variety of telephone and email inquiries, concerns and requests using superior contact handling and active listening skills. The successful candidate will have a good working knowledge of the Ontario electricity sector and will possess strong organizational and analytical skills, excellent written and verbal communications, and the ability to manage customer calls while working effectively and efficiently in a team-oriented environment.   

Applicants must have successfully completed a two-year college diploma in business administration or a related field. A minimum of one (1) year of relevant customer service experience is required, preferably in a utility customer service or call centre environment. Proficiency in the MS Office suite of applications is required. Candidates may be tested. 

Employment is contingent upon your provision of proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical reasons or based on creed, we would ask that you kindly provide satisfactory evidence in support of an accommodation under the Human Rights Code. 

We offer an excellent working environment, career path exploration and development opportunities, a comprehensive total rewards package, and opportunities to get involved with teams and charitable events that support and make a difference in our community. To become a member of our team, please forward your resume by May 19, 2022 to careers@grandbridgeenergy.com. When applying for the position, please quote “Temporary Customer Care Representative” in the subject line.

GrandBridge Energy

150 Savannah Oaks Drive

Brantford, Ontario N3V 1E7

or email: careers@grandbridgeenergy.com

Check us out at https://grandbridgeenergy.com/

We appreciate the opportunity to review all resumes, however due to volume, only those under consideration will be contacted. We retain all resumes for a period of 12 months. In the event a similar position becomes available, your application may be considered.

GrandBridge Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is AODA compliant.

title: Concierge Coordinator - SP / EN
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Achievers Employee Success Platform™ delivers high-frequency recognition that drives business outcomes for HR and business leaders, from decreased turnover to increased engagement. Designed specifically to meet the needs of today’s workforce, it empowers employees to recognize each other in real time and aligns them to the values and goals of the company. With more than 3 million users, the Employee Success Platform inspires brilliant performance in 170 countries. Visit us at www.achievers.com to learn more and join us in our mission to Change the Way the World Works™.

Overview:

The Achievers Reward Support Team is a group of passionate and highly motivated problem-solvers! The team is responsible for supporting our members with order-related inquiries, providing consistent, accurate, and up-to-date information as through to resolution. As an integral communication bridge between our members and Marketplace reward suppliers, the Reward Support Team directly solves all order-related challenges. The Concierge Team lives within Reward Support and is specialized in making exceptional reward experiences for those items outside of our preferred catalog. As a Concierge Coordinator on this team, you’re responsible for the strategic resolution of your cases while ensuring the best possible member experience!

Responsibilities:

· Get connected and handle inbound and outbound queries via email and web form submission in multiple languages, with a possibility of phone and/or live chat in the future
· Specialize your efforts on Concierge-specific cases in which our high point-redeeming members are looking to redeem for items outside of our global catalog
· Provide the highest level of customer service for our Concierge cases and truly treat each experience as your top priority
· Be a steadfast advocate for the member while honouring the policies of our reward suppliers by positively setting expectations accordingly
· Use your problem-solving skills to investigate and resolve inquiries, troubleshoot order challenges, and find the best resolution for the customer using available resources (i.e. vendor portals, external websites)
· When there is capacity, support the rest of the Reward Support team by resolving multiple case types from our members including order inquiries, reshipments, tracking requests, block and refunds, and more
· Submit, track, and resolve order requests directly with vendors
· Effectively partner and communicate with other internal teams to resolve member and client issues (Customer Care, Marketplace, Order Support, TSA) when required
· Navigate e-commerce portfolios for order status detail
· Troubleshoot issues with computer systems, web‐basedapplicationsand mobile technology
· Attend department meetings to report on member trends and identify process improvements
· Recognize your peers and be recognized for being your positive, spirited, awesome self!

Qualifications& Skills:
· 1-2 years of related work experience
· CRM (Salesforce) experience is an asset
· Proficient in English and French or Spanish
· Technical aptitude
· Previous related customer service experience
· Experience in a metric driven environment
· Fluent in computer applications (MS Work, Excel, Outlook)
· Ability to understand technical aspects of software functions
· Must have apassion for supporting customers andeager to learnwhat it takes to create an amazing customer‐centric team
· Attends to responsibilities through a qualityand attention to detaillens
· Ability to actively listen,communicate, and collaborate effectively
· Proficientin resolving conflict utilizing problem-solvingand negotiationskills
· An aptitude tocreate positivememberexperiencesthrough amember-orientedapproach

About Achievers:

As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and love our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.

We have been recognized in numerous publications for our contributions to HR, for technical excellence and for our outstanding workplace culture!

Check out our platform in action here

Achievers does not offer employment to prospects without first ensuring that qualified candidates speak directly with the hiring manager and a member of our HR team. All qualification will be done face-to-face, whether that is in person or over Zoom. Achievers does not send out offers of employment without meeting candidates and does not offer employment via text. If you are requested for any personal information via text and/or without having met a member of our hiring team in person, please disregard.

Our employees are a diverse and inclusive team of passionate, hardworking individuals. Achievers is committed to creating an environment where our employees can do the best work of their lives. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply to join our A-Player family. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</section>

title: Post Sales Customer Support
description:
Client ID: 5394

Post Sales Customer Service

On behalf of our client in the Professional Services Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Post Sales Customer Service

Post Sales Customer Service – Mandatory Skills

  • Bilingual english/French
  • Product expert by exuding confidence in accounting principles and workflow using QBO
  • Good communication skills, able to present to groups & leadership
  • Works well in teams and individually
  • Analytical & Problem Solving
  • Solution expert, identifies and digs deep into root causes
  • Ability to analyze financial statements and explain the context surrounding the data i.e., if there is a discrepancy in the AP Summary vs the Accounts Payable on the Balance Sheet, tell me why; what is the difference between a P&L and a Balance Sheet
  • Not afraid of technology or challenges
  • Willing to go the extra mile to understand the problem & find a solution
  • Product Knowledge
  • Hands on experience using QBO and/or a desktop accounting platform
  • Must be able to navigate at least 1 accounting software comfortably
  • Must be able to understand the capabilities of QBO from an application standpoint and how it relates to accounting principles
  • Project Management
  • Ability to multi-task and have excellent time management skills
  • Manage client needs end-to-end
  • Manage account managers assigned to you by asserting your knowledge and helping them understand their targets, fill in product knowledge gaps, defining ROI, and ensuring compliance with internal procedures with the highest integrity
  • Customer Service
  • Customer facing with clients/internal stakeholders
  • Strong empathy towards clients and fellow teammates
  • Deliver exceptional results so others can count on you

Post Sales Customer Service - Assignment Start Date

ASAP – 12 months to start

Post Sales Customer Service - Assignment Location

Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

title: Service Advisor- OpenRoad Toyota Port Moody
description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD


We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.


 We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their role.


If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today! 


OpenRoad Auto Group is currently seeking to expand our team with a Full-time Service Advisor at OpenRoad Toyota Port Moody.


A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:


  • Many opportunities for internal growth
  • Discounted vehicle purchase program
  • Associate perks program
  • Company social events
  • And more!


ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Handle customers inquiries promptly and accurately, listen to vehicle concerns and write repair orders.
  • Ensure repair orders and all paper work is legibly and accurately completed, with all customer requests or points of concern documented.
  • Obtain all customer (including signature) and vehicle data and fill in required spaces on all repair orders.
  • Process all paperwork as jobs are completed.
  • Review all repairs and changes with customer upon delivery of vehicle.
  • Assist in scheduling customer vehicles for service work by allowing adequate time for repairs/maintenance and securing additional time as required.
  • Monitor work-in-progress to ensure that repairs are being performed properly and time schedule is being met as promised. Notify customers if delays are expected or additional work is needed.
  • Use service files to suggest additional repairs or services if required.
  • Estimate costs and completion times, do not hesitate to ask Service Manager for assistance.
  • Identify and give special attention to repeat repairs, assign original technician on all comeback jobs.
  • Notify customers when backorder parts become available.
  • Determine warranty coverage and verify repair date, mileage, etc.
  • Resolve all customer complaints for a win/win outcome. Implement/suggest preventative measures to reduce number of complaints.
  • Perform walk-around inspection on all customer vehicles noting damage such as: scratches, dents, missing hubcaps, etc.
  • Arrange for alternate transportation as needed and manage loaner vehicles.
  • Work to improve dealership CSI and general customer satisfaction in accordance with OpenRoad’s philosophies, policies and procedures.
  • Maintain paperwork and ensure reception area is in a clean and orderly fashion.
  • Must follow company safety policies and practices, and immediately, report any and all accidents to a Manager/Supervisor.
  • This position will be expected to perform other duties as assigned by management.
  • OpenRoad reserves the right to modify this job description as business needs require.

 

 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Working knowledge of automotive equipment.
  • Ability to speak Mandarin a tremendous asset 
  • Knowledge of techniques of customer satisfaction and retention.
  • Ability to maintain records and prepare reports using a computerized equipment maintenance system.
  • Ability to work cooperatively with all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to communicate with others and to assimilate and understand information, in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
  • Ability to operate assigned equipment.
  • Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
  • A valid British Columbia driver’s license, with a clean driving record.


Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application. 


https://orag.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=3132 


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.


JOIN US AND GROW WITH US! 


We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

title: Service Specialist
description:
Not just a job…

a community

a partnership

a team

You’ll experience them all at London Drugs. As one of Canada’s fastest-growing and most successful retail chains, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team! We currently have opportunities for:

 

Service Specialist

 

The Service Specialist is generally responsible for providing any assistance required by customers throughout the General Sales area. This position is key in the company’s ability to fulfill our mission statement, which is to provide a superior shopping experience every day.  

You will also be responsible for handling customer issues and supervision of the front end of the store while on duty. Front end duties include monitoring cashier coverage, maintaining front end supplies, replenishing change float, and answering calls for customer assistance at the check outs. 

In addition to the above duties, this is also a customer service position which requires a great deal of customer contact. Applicants must be able to work effectively in a fast paced environment while at the same time providing quality service in a professional, courteous, and helpful manner.  

You will have good inter-personal, motivational, delegation and follow up skills, combined with a willingness to accept responsibility, and an ability to train others and monitor their work habits.   You will also be able to cope with stress, pressure, and remain calm when dealing with difficult situations.

A positive, mature, and professional leadership style, good inter-personal, motivational, delegation and follow up skills, and a solid understanding of policies and procedures are essential for this role.  Supervisory experience would be considered an asset.

If you have superior customer service experience, the ability to work with a sense of urgency, combined with excellent communication skills (good listener, patient, and articulate), then we have the opportunity for you to excel!

 

We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, and a comprehensive benefits program including:

  • Comprehensive, optional medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
  • Company matched RRSPs (Helping you plan for your future 
  • Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)
  • Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning)
  • Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counseling and support)
  • Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!)
  • Community Involvement (Giving back to our communities)

 

Applicants should be available to work a flexible schedule, Monday to Sunday.  

If you possess the necessary skills and expertise and would like to join an exciting team of professionals, 

Apply Now!

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services.

London Drugs may collect, use, and/or disclose your personal information (including the information in this application) where it is reasonable for establishing, managing or terminating an employment relationship. This includes the use or disclosure of your personal information to persons inside or external to our organization, for the purpose of checking references or gathering other information to support an assessment of your candidacy.

To protect yourself, do not respond to unsolicited job offers from individuals or e-mail addresses, and never disclose any sensitive details about your identity (including personal or financial) to anyone you do not know or trust or on any unverified website, or website you do not trust.

title: Bilingual Customer Service Representative - (Spanish, Portuguese, English) - Night Shift
description:
Job Description:

i2c Customer Service Representative is responsible for handling all customer concerns. Some of these responsibilities includes interacting with customers over the phone and/or via email. Our Customer Service Representatives are required to maintain a high level of professionalism and knowledge, as they are i2c first contact with customers. Each interaction is a great opportunity for i2c Customer Service Representative to add value to the organization

At i2c Inc., people are our strength. We are currently seeking On Site Customer Service Representatives for day and evening shifts to provide great service to our customers. If you enjoy helping others and making a difference, we want to talk with you!

**Night Shift: 23:00 - 7:30 AM. Night shift differential applies**

*** Onsite Position *** Not Remote Position***

Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Provide customer support to consumer cardholders. Confidently answer contacts, through multiple. channels (i.e. Phone, Email), from customers regarding products and services.
  • Follow defined Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) that support operational performance.
  • Share shift summaries and any required reporting with respective Supervisors and Managers.
  • Utilize a comprehensive approach during i2c customers call inquiries to reach a complete and accurate resolution preventing customer recontracts.
  • Must maintain a high level of confidentiality and discretion due to the data sensitivity nature of the work.
  • Responsible for following information security tasks as part of the work scope.
  • Works closely with relevant groups and timely reports and alerts concerned units for effective response regarding customer transaction inquiries.
  • Stays abreast with regulations and industry best practices.
  • Work on project assigned by management.

Required Education/Skills/Abilities:

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Must be Bi-lingual (English-Portuguese) or Tri-lingual (English, French, Portuguese), (English, French, Spanish)
  • Relevant CSR experience preferably with a background in call center operations.
  • Excellent verbal skills and professional
  • Familiar with basic computer operations.
  • Ability to manage time effectively and to meet attendance procedures to include a minimum of 40 hours weekly with shifts that include various days and hours.
  • An excellent written and verbal communicator with the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships.

Compensation including night differential:

  • $21.25 (Bi-lingual)
  • $21.75 (Tri-lingual)

Physical Requirements: Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.


#ZR

Id1000

title: Client Success Coordinator
description:
Do you want your day-to-day work to have a real meaningful impact on your entire team?

When people around you are overwhelmed and disorganized, you bring order to the chaos and lead by example with your detailed eye, reliable presence, and trustworthy self.

Who do we think we are?

Excellent question. WeyMedia is a proudly Maritime company with a simple mission:

Make money easy and fun for everyone.

To do that, we strive to make both moneyGenius.ca and creditcardGenius.ca the best in our space. Although we're a young company, these two websites have already become two of the top resources for Canadian consumers.

We serve over 250,000+ engaged users by means of our free tools and technology, actionable articles, and objective personal finance product reviews.

We also actively reward our readers through GeniusCash ‒ our very own cash back rewards program on participating credit cards.

(And if that wasn’t enough, check out our $10K Tesla giveaway at creditcardgenius.ca/offers.)

So if you want to help us make it easy for Canadians to make smart financial decisions, read on…

Who we need

We need a detail-oriented, reliable, and trustworthy Client Success Coordinator to be part of our growing team.

  • You'll nurture and develop relationships with clients ‒ ensuring we have a deep understanding of their goals and needs.
  • As a champion of our brands, products, and services, you'll prepare and review proposals that reflect what's right for all sides.
  • You'll collaborate with teams to meet client's needs, requests, and proposals.
  • You'll conduct regular research and data updates to various spreadsheets ‒ ensuring numbers and facts are 100% accurate.
  • You'll create and maintain business files, records, and processes using our accounting program, CRM system, and cloud office suite as needed.
  • You'll support business projects and assist the team as needed.
  • You'll facilitate client relations with excellence and service top of mind.
  • You'll investigate and respond to all inquiries promptly and accurately.
  • You'll schedule and coordinate appointments and meetings as requested.
  • You'll wear many different hats in a lean, agile, and fast-paced culture.

Who you are

You care about your work, you know your stuff, and you go the extra mile.

  • You're a citizen or permanent resident of Canada.
  • You have a Bachelor's degree in Business or equivalent and have at least 2 years experience working in a fast-paced professional services or start-up environment.
  • You have a background in finance so numbers and spreadsheets are in your wheelhouse.
  • You have a fine-tuned attention to detail and high standards when it comes to accuracy.
  • You can think on your feet ‒ no problem is too big, no question is too difficult ‒ you know how to find the right answers online and offline.
  • "Organized" is your middle name ‒ you get things sorted, completed, and delivered on-time (or earlier).
  • You're a self-starter, reliable, trustworthy ‒ you care about your team and doing your work well.
  • You have proven skills using G Suite, Office, and accounting software like Quickbooks online.
  • You're comfortable with technology, live in the cloud, and can learn and adapt quickly.
  • You're a lifelong learner, a student for life.

What you'll get

We take care of our team. Here's a quick list of benefits you'll get working with us:

  • Challenging and rewarding work that has a real impact on the financial health of Canadians.
  • Work from home anywhere in Canada with permanent remote full time status.
  • Opportunities for continuous growth and career advancement.
  • Competitive salary based on your skills and experience.
  • An equal share in a portion of the company's profits.
  • 100% paid premiums for health, dental, and vision insurance.
  • 26 vacation and wellbeing days per year which includes:
    • 3 weeks of vacation
    • 8 public holidays
    • 2 flex days
    • Your birthday off
  • New Employee Toolkit that contains everything you need to do your job well.
    • Includes a company laptop, second monitor, and a dozen other useful items.
  • Regular team building fun including team games, lunches, happy hours, competitions with prizes, and more.
  • Mental health support through inConfidence and the Calm app.
  • Mobile phone allowance to help cover part of your monthly bill.

Let's talk

If you think this is you, please apply with your cover letter addressed to Chelsea so we know that you thoughtfully reviewed our job description.

title: Customer Service Specialist
description:
The Customer Experience - Service Specialist will work directly with Norwood’s North American customers by phone, and online with the aim of providing premium-quality service. The Service Specialist is charged with upholding the Norwood Sawmills standard and commitment to providing our customers with the support and education required to be successful on their milling journey. The ideal candidate is service minded, an exemplary communicator, and seeks ongoing professional growth and development.

  • Adhere to the Norwood Values.
  • Become an expert in Norwood’s sawmills and attachments and share these insights with our customers. Learn all operational and technical aspects of Norwood equipment and competing equipment.
  • Engage, and build a rapport, with new and existing customers (by phone, email and in person).
  • Interact with new and existing customers, fellow Norwood team members and suppliers in a positive, constructive, courteous, timely and professional manner.
  • Handle large volume of incoming calls and emails from existing customers, as well as proactive outreach to customers in need.
  • Diligently work with tools and processes within the CRM and other software systems as directed by the Company.
  • Engage in process-driven communications and follow up, up-sell products and accessories over the phone.
  • Strive to meet or exceed Key Performance Indicators related to customer service
  • Process parts orders including liaise with order execution teams (i.e. shipping) and liaise with accounting department.
  • Consult with owners to evaluate their sawmilling needs, current and potentially future.
  • Educate existing customers about features and benefits of Norwood equipment.
  • Assist new and existing customers with customer service-type inquiries related to shipping, packaging and sawmill operation and service.
  • Provide technical support and assistance to existing customers by phone and email, and process, when applicable, warranty claims.
  • Ensure all customers receive prompt, useful information through professional communication and follow-ups.
  • Prioritize customer satisfaction and revenue growth.
  • Be an example of excellence in all respects including values, product knowledge, sawmill operations and functions, professional standards of communication, respect for adherence to internal systems and processes, work-ethic, etc…
  • Attend, and participate at, periodic tradeshows and fairs as requested (necessitating occasional weekend work and extended workdays).
  • Be committed to continuous learning by, independently and enthusiastically, reading, watching videos and actual, hands-on, operation of the equipment.
  • Share with the team responsibility to provide seamless service to customers by working a few mid-year statutory holidays (day in lieu given).
  • Be committed to continuous learning by, independently and enthusiastically, reading, watching videos and actually, hands-on, operating the equipment.
  • Other duties that may be assigned as required.

Are you looking to join a company that is loved by its customers? Do you want to contribute to the growth and expansion of an industry leader? Norwood Sawmill owners are passionate about the sawmilling way of life. Norwood Sawmills is a leading manufacturer of portable sawmills and related forestry equipment that are sold throughout North America and to 100 countries worldwide.

This is about effectively, efficiently, and authentically connecting with real people – individuals who have reached out to us to learn more about Norwood sawmills and supporting our Sawyers post sale. Our customers are resourceful, passionate, and they are ready to build their best futures through wood. We are here to empower them to do just that!

The Norwood team is looking for a positive, enthusiastic individual to fill the position of Online Customer Service Agent at our Canadian head office. The right candidate will be a service -minded individual who proactively engages with people interested in sawmilling to pair them with the right equipment, tools, and parts. The successful candidate will continually learn about our products and our industry to better service customers while remaining mindful of growing healthy revenues and margins.

Proof of Covid-19 vaccination will be required upon hire date.

We thank you for your interest in our position! Only those applicants who are selected for interviews will be contacted. We are committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the 'candidate's request.

title: Customer Service Rep
description:
Job ID:  [[403739]]


C.R. Laurence Co., Inc. (CRL) is the leading supplier to the glazing, architectural, railing, construction, industrial, and automotive industries. Offering more than 60,000 products, we serve the industry from locations throughout North America, Europe, and Australia.

 

Job Summary

The Customer Service/Will Call Representative provides exceptional customer service to all C.R. Laurence customers. Through the detailed understanding of all C.R. Laurence products the CSR offers solutions and facilitates a unique experience to all internal and external customers. In addition, completes general administrative support while in a hectic and fast passed environment. This position serves as an ambassador to the company and will be the face of the company through daily interactions.

 

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

· Maintain broad knowledge of clients, products and services.

· Document customer interactions and transactions

· Listen attentively to customer needs and concerns; demonstrate empathy

· Accurately process over-the-counter, phoned, faxed and e-mailed orders accurately and in a timely manner

· Receive and process payments of Will Call customers as well as over the phone (cash, debit, etc.)

· Answer multi-line telephone in a professional manner

· Face to face customers interactions

· Develop and maintain professional and productive business relationships with your internal and external customers that result in a clear definition and understanding of their service requirements and expectations.

· Respond to all inquiries in a prompt, professional, and courteous manner between internal working associates, manufacturers, and customers

· Build sustainable relationships and trust with customer accounts through open and interactive communication

· Go the extra mile to engage customers, adapt and respond to different types of customer requirements or requests

· Customer database management - Maintain records of customer interactions, process customer accounts and file documents

· Other duties as assigned

 

Skills, Knowledge and Ability Requirements

To be considered for the Will Call/ Customer Service Representative position, the following conditions must be met:

 

· 1 year of office support experience in a customer service role

· High School diploma or equivalent

· Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment

· Organized and able to keep others organized with ability to prioritize effectively

· Must be able to communicate effectively and conduct yourself professionally, with excellent written and verbal communications

· Demonstrate critical thinking and independent thinking skills to anticipate and resolve issues

· Utilizes strong time management and organizational skills to successfully multi-task

· Maintain business poise and professionalism under stressful situations

· Handle difficult situations and dissatisfied customers in a calm and professional manner.

· Able to read and perform simple mathematical calculations

· Bilingual preferred

 

Equipment

 

· Personal desktop computers, fax machine, copy machine, calculator, writing instruments, telephone, and various printers.

· Issued safety equipment

Safety

 

· This position is a largely sedentary; however, caution needs to be taken when listing files, boxes, opening file cabinet drawers, desk drawers.

· To avoid injuries to hands, back and neck, proper ergonomics should be maintained while working at desk/workstation.

 

Work Environment

 

· Primarily works in an office environment with controlled climate.

· Ability to perform light hand activity work at a computer/telephone station in an office environment. Position is primarily sedentary.

· Some duties may involve being in a plant environment where noise levels can be moderate to high and be subject to the same general climate conditions of the region (heat, cold, humidity, etc.).

· Chemicals, dust, pollen and other typical airborne particulate matter are present within the atmosphere of the production floor and may create some odors in the plant. The Company, in an effort to provide its employees with a safe and healthy working environment, limits exposure to chemicals through written procedures, engineering controls and PPE.

· While the chemical exposure and odors are under acceptable levels set by OSHA and the WCB, they nevertheless, can be smelled and are handled according to the company’s hazardous communication program.

 

What CRH Americas Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

About CRH Americas

 

CRH Americas has a long and proud heritage as one of North America’s largest corporations. We are a proud reflection of the hundreds of family businesses, local and regional companies and mid to large sized enterprises that together form the CRH Americas family. CRH Americas operates with a decentralized, diversified structure, letting you work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of a large enterprise.

 

C.R. Laurence Co., a CRH company, is a great place to grow! If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Please complete your online application and profile which will be sent directly to the appropriate Hiring Manager. Thank you for your interest in the CRH family!

 

CRH Americas is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

 EOE/Vet/Disability--If you want to know more, please click on this link. 

 

C.R. Laurence Co., Inc. (CRL) is an E-Verify Employer.

Laurence Co., Inc. (CRL) is the leading supplier to the glazing, architectural, railing, construction, industrial, and automotive industries. Offering more than 60,000 products, we serve the industry from locations throughout North America, Europe, and Australia.', '· Accurately process over-the-counter, phoned, faxed and e-mailed orders accurately and in a timely manner', '· Must be able to communicate effectively and conduct yourself professionally, with excellent written and verbal communications', 'What CRH Americas Offers You', 'C.R. title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

Here's How We Work:

Will work closely with the Administrative team and Administrative Office Manager. This role will be in office and both act as primary Reception and support administrative tasks largely computer based. The ideal candidate will have experience in a similar role, and possess proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel and Outlook, and strong typing skills. In addition, possess strong organizational and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail. 

Most of The Things You’ll Work on:

  • Greeting (and registering) all incoming visitors.
  •  Maintaining contact lists and logs
  •  Manage logistics for meetings (coordination of lunches, sanitization etc) 
  •  Answering telephone calls (VOIP system) and responding to general inquiries. 
  •  Supporting IBI Group staff through an administrative function - both in-office and remote based employees
  • Providing administrative support to office, business development and project functions.
    • Includes working within our CRM, reference documents, and project documentation.
  •  Creating documents and spreadsheets in Word and Excel 
  •  Coordinate outgoing and incoming mail/courier packages 
  • General office maintenance (ordering supplies, communicating with building facilities, maintain upkeep, boardroom support, etc)
  •  Handling various tasks assigned by Office Manager including rearranging office space as required, maintaining and updating the code books in the library, renewing licenses and subscriptions, etc
  •  As part of the administrative team, participate in general tasks such as:
    • vacation and sick coverage for other team members, document distribution, supply orders, kitchen/coffee/dishwasher support, document management in support of architectural jobs
  •  Liaising with the departmental teams and office groups as necessary
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have: 

  • Experience working in a large office or work environment
  •  Highly capable with Microsoft Office programs, particularly Outlook,  Word and Excel
  • Professional and pleasant approach to all interactions. 
  • Professional and pleasant phone manner. Switchboard experience an asset
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a group.
  •  Information managements skills (filing, IT processes, etc);
  •  Confident with the ability to build strong working relationships
  •  Energetic, diplomatic, flexible, problem-solving mindset
  •  Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  •  Architectural / Engineering / Real Estate Development experience beneficial


Additional Information

Why you should work for IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

  • Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
  • Robust Extended Medical Benefits
  • Participation in Incentives Program
  • Remote Work Options or Hybrid WFH-Office Schedule
  • Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Associations
  • Professional Development & Self Directed Learning Resources

We request applicants submit RESUME highlighting relevant work experience; please limit PDF files to 10MB. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Conseiller Service Client (Télétravail)
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Nous pourrions vous dire que nous sommes une entreprise de télécommunication et de divertissement à la fine pointe de la technologie.  Que nous sommes constamment en évolution pour non seulement offrir ce qu’il y a de mieux à nos clients, mais aussi à nos employés; après tout ce sont eux notre plus grande force.

Description du poste

Au-delà du CV, on cherche avant tout une personnalité.

Dans un environnement technologique en croissance, vous recevrez les appels entrants des clients. Vous devrez offrir un rôle-conseil exceptionnel tout en accompagnant les clients dans la compréhension et proposition de nos produits et services. Vous agirez à titre d’ambassadeur Vidéotron et serez appelé à instaurer un climat de confiance propice à la fidélisation.  

Nous offrons un emploi stimulant avec une panoplie d’avantages :

  • Télétravail à 100 %
  • Formation complète et rémunérée
  • Salaire: 19,17 $/h prime de soir et de fin de semaine
  • Vacances
  • Assurances collectives complètes (vie, médicale, dentaire et soins complémentaires)
  • Régime de retraite compétitif et possibilité d’adhérer à un REER collectif
  • Rabais employé VIP très avantageux (jusqu’à 80 % de rabais sur certains services comme le forfait mobile de Vidéotron)
  • Rabais corporatifs chez plusieurs partenaires des secteurs de l’alimentation, des loisirs, du divertissement, de l’électronique, des gyms, de l’hébergement, des assurances auto et habitation, etc.
  • Un programme de développement des compétences bien soutenu par nos équipes de gestion, plusieurs reconnaissances liées au rendement et bien plus encore…
Qualifications

  1. Être à l'aise à répondre à un volume d'appel en anglais.
  2. Avoir complété au minimum un D.E.S ou un D.E.P (ou équivalence scolaire TENS).
  3. Détenir toutes les autorisations légales et les permis valides pour travailler au Canada.
  4. Être disponible pour travailler 37.5 h/semaine le jour, le soir et la fin de semaine (Lundi au vendredi de 9h00 à 19h00 et les samedi et dimanche de 10h00 à 18h00).  Il est important d'être disponible tout au long de l'année les soirs et toutes les fins de semaine (pas de retour aux études prévues).


Informations complémentaires

La suite des choses ?

Au-delà du CV, on cherche avant tout une personnalité. Dans ce sens, si nous avons l’impression que vous avez le profil de l’emploi, nous vous contacterons pour en discuter de vive voix et vous ferons part des prochaines étapes afin de mieux nous montrer qui vous êtes…

Vidéotron remercie tous les candidats et les candidates qui postuleront. La diversité est une pratique fondamentale dans notre processus de recrutement. Ainsi, nous souscrivons au principe d'équité en emploi et offrons des chances d'emploi égales à tous. #LI-DM1

La personne qui occupera le poste devra se conformer à l’ensemble des politiques de la société notamment celle en matière de vaccination Covid-19 en vigueur le 1er novembre 2021.

title: Customer Service Specialist London, Ontario
description:
We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for Customer Service Specialists in London, Ontario.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Primary Responsibilities

Reporting to the Logistics Supervisor, the Customer Service Specialist is responsible for receiving calls and booking trips accurately and efficiently for our non emergency Patient Transfer Division. The role also includes providing a high degree of customer service in a fast paced environment.

The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications that include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Must be able to read and communicate in English effectively
  • High School Diploma or Equivalent; Emergency Telecommunications Graduate preferred
  • 1-2 years of Logistics experience
  • Ability to work independently
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Must have the ability to multitask and shift priorities as needed
  • Proficiency in Microsoft programs such as Outlook, Work and Excel
  • SHIFT: Afternoons, Evenings, Weekends

Why work for us

  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering for full time positions
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

Sounds interesting? Apply today!

Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Customer Service Representative
location: Centre De Service / Service Center Richmond, British Columbia Full Time, BC
description:
Description

Position at Speedy Glass

You are the person who likes to set the tone for the customer’s experience. As a Customer Service Representative, you will create ease in a fast-paced, action-oriented role. You will enjoy the variety of working both administratively and with the public while being the glue that makes things run seamlessly.  You will work closely with a supportive team and collaborate to solve problems.

If you are looking for stimulating work that makes an impact, this is the perfect place to start your career.

Your role at a glance:

Your role is to take pride in owning the customer’s experience and ensuring that we have made a positive impact on their day.

You will continue to make a difference by:

  • Completing the administration required to make the Service Centre run seamlessly.
  • Adding value to the customer and identifying opportunities to boost the store’s performance.
  • Working with our insurance partners to help customers get the best value for their money.
  • Delighting your customers by vacuuming vehicle interiors, cleaning windows, and helping with the occasional small repairs on windshields (don’t worry – our tools are easy to use!)
  • Shuttling vehicles to and from the repair shop.

Who you are:

  • You value building relationships with customers and your teammates.
  • You have experience in helping people whether it’s in retail, hospitality, or tourism.
  • No formal education is required – we provide on-the-job training!
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs, have a valid Class 5 driver’s license, and the capability to work at different Belron Canada locations within your specified geographic area.

Why Belron Canada will bring out your best:

  • You will be able to see the results of your work and are given the opportunity to try new things.
  • Forget unpredictable schedules and long hours. We have a life and know you have one too.
  • Our comprehensive benefits and pension package starts on your first day of employment.
  • We are a growing organization where opportunities for advancement, training, and skill-development are always coming up.

We know job applications can be time-consuming and your time is important to us. That is why no cover letter is required in your application, making the process quick and easy.

About Belron Canada

Walk into any of our Service Centres across 30 countries and you will feel the difference. People light up when you enter a room and will want to get to know you. We share ideas, take every opportunity to laugh, and cheer each other on - see it for yourself.

At Belron Canada, you will never wonder how you can make a difference again. We come together to support local charities that are important to us  through our From Us, To You program and actively participate in Spirit of Belron, Belron International’s annual triathlon.

Recognize any of our brands like Speedy Glass, Broco Glass, Apple Auto Glass, and Vanfax across Canada and you will know that these are places where you can excel. You can be a part of a community. You can make a difference. You can bring out your best.

Start your career at Belron Canada.

title: Customer Service Clerk
description:
Company Description

ARE YOU CUT OUT FOR KENNY U-PULL?

Get ready to immerse yourself in a professional playground of cars.

Become our clients’ ally to provide the best customer service. At Kenny U-Pull, we adhere to high operational standards to maintain an organized and efficient workspace where we repurpose cars and their parts to give them a second life. Join our team in one of North America’s leading companies in the self-service auto part industry.

It’s simple: we do it right. We aim for excellence.

This position is eligible for an annual retention bonus of up to $1,050

Job Description

  • Welcome and guide customers in the store, in the yard or in our various neighboring branches;
  • Provide advise to customers on their questions, including different car parts, vehicle models in inventory, our return and exchange policies, etc.;
  • Identify customer needs and materialize sales opportunities for our various products.
  • Operate the cash register and carry out transactions;
  • Perform transactions related to the purchase of vehicles. Ex: reception of towed vehicles, vehicle verification, setting up the file in our system, etc.;
  • Fill, place, organize and dust batteries, tires and windshield washer cans on shelves in the store;
  • Perform cleaning tasks in the store, in the parking lot and in the yard occasionally.
  • Look into bags, toolboxes and wheelbarrows at the entrance and exit of the store for any forgotten parts or for tools not authorized in the yard;
  • Assist in clerical or support tasks for the production department or for management. Ex: Perform audits, take pictures of vehicles, mark cars for production, etc.;
  •  All other related tasks.
Qualifications

  • Be engaged and able to hold a conversation with customers;
  • Offer an excellent customer service;
  • Reliability, attendance and punctuality;
  • Be resourceful;
  • Pay attention to details;
  • Knowledge of automotive parts (asset);
  • Be able to lift items up to 30lbs.


Additional Information

  • Hours: We are open 7 days a week, from 9 am to 5 pm;
  • Ability to work indoors and outdoors in a changing environment;
  • Full-time, permanent position.

What we offer:

  • Group insurance (after 3 months);
  • Group RRSP with employer contribution (after 6 months);
  • Overtime at time and a half after 44 hours;
  • Employee discount;
  • Free parking;
  • Paid steel toe boot from day 1;
  • Uniform provided from day 1.

American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries offer equal employment opportunities to everyone. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Associate Loyalty Specialist
description:
Company Description

SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kids-wear, and Everything Else™.

SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description

Reporting to the Loyalty and Retention Manager, the Loyalty Associate Specialist will support key business objectives by driving and executing customer loyalty projects and assisting the continuous improvement of the loyalty program and other customer retention activities.

The primary mandate will be to collaborate cross-functionally to drive ROI positive projects that will encourage our clients to make repeat purchases, maintain customer dashboards, collaborate with other teams to optimize the customer journey, and support customer selection for exclusive perks. The ideal candidate will bring a culture of optimization via measurement and testing, considering different approaches in line with organizational values, policies, and procedures.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Support and maintain daily operation of the loyalty program 
  • Support planning, development and deployment of loyalty projects to exceed sales targets while staying in line with business and brand values
  • Identify and develop new commercially valuable offers to be given to specific client segments
  • Create and analyze performance dashboards, identify optimization opportunities and communicate results 
  • Create customer segments to support targeted marketing campaigns and/or specific customer needs
  • Support several teams in optimizing through testing the customer journey across touchpoints
  • Collaborate in the development and execution of key retention initiatives cross-functionally
  • Participate in the development and implementation of the Loyalty roadmap
  • Stay abreast of the latest trends, best practices, strategies, and industry standards

SKILLS

  • Analytical and detail-oriented
  • Team player with a natural ability to build relationships
  • Creative thinker with excellent problem-solving abilities
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Interest in fashion, an ass
Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or a related business field
  • Master’s degree, an asset
  • A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in a data-driven role with a focus on CRM, retention programs, email programs, and/or web projects
  • Strong track record of exceeding revenue growth expectations
  • Strong understanding of data manipulation and segment creation
  • Strong knowledge of Google Analytics, Excel, and statistical packages

title: Customer Service Representative (FT)
description:
Vitasave.ca is looking to hire a Customer Experience Specialist for the Full-Time position.

When faced with a problem, do you only look for solutions? Are you goal-focused and take massive action to achieve greatness? Do you believe that nothing is impossible? If you answered yes to any of these questions, chances are working with Vitasave.ca’s Customer Service Team would be a fit for you.

Responsibilities:
  • Assisting customers with phone orders.
  • Answering product questions.
  • Responding to emails and phone calls.
  • Taking part in specific tasks that help our Customer Service team run smoothly.
  • Prioritize tasks and projects with good time management.

Requirements:
  • Multi-tasker and detail-oriented.
  • Exceptional execution and follow-through skills.

Benefits: 
  • Full-Time hours -Tuesday -Friday .9am - 5pm
  • $16.25/hr.
  • Staff discounts - Discounts at both our retail store and HQ to make sure that you too can keep on top of your health.
  • Exclusive entrance to tradeshows - CHFA, VegeExpo & The Wellness Show (when available to do so again).
  • Mentorship and opportunity for growth.
  • Fun and positive teamwork environment.

About the Company: 
  • Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest-growing eCommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make health accessible and affordable for everyone.

Reminders on COVID-19 Protocols: 
  • Have you left Canada within the past 4 weeks?
  • Have you personally/ or been in contact with anyone transmitted of COVID-19?
  • Social distancing must be in the act.
  • Washing hands every hour.
  • Gloves and masks will be supplied.
  • We ensure health and safety for all staff. It is our number one priority.

Thank you for your interest in working with us, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted by email.




    About Nutraways Enterprises:

    Vitasave.ca is one of Canada’s fastest growing ecommerce companies in the natural health product industry. Our mission is to make health accessible and affordable for everyone.

title: Dental Receptionist (PT)
description:
A friendly and people-oriented dental office in Burlington is looking for a receptionist for 3 days a week to start. The person should be amiable, personable, detail-oriented and confident with good communication skills. Being comfortable with using a computer management system, calling patients on the phone, and clearly conveying information is crucial. Certification as a dental assistant is preferred and will be given special consideration, but is not required. The remuneration will be fair and above market average.

Situated in a new facility with a cozy and homelike environment, we are a wellness-based dental practice with advanced and modern equipment. Our hours do not encompass evenings and other than weekdays, we are open only one Saturday a month. The team is close-knit and welcoming, and we are excited to have you join it!

title: Call Center Agent - Bilingual
description:
Job Details 
The Call Center Agent - Bilingual is responsible for handling all incoming alarm signal activities and taking appropriate action per instruction. Including video surveillance and monitoring of security equipment on-site at military facilities. The associate will also make outbound calls in order to dispatch Police/Fire Departments regarding alarm activities while following standard operating procedures. This role requires heavy phone work as well as taking verbal instructions, typing, reading, speaking and writing.

How you will do it:
  • Resolve operational, customer service and/or employee issues.
  • Operate all call center equipment and peripheral equipment.
  • Interact with external and internal customers via telephone, email and in person.
  • Promote a positive customer service atmosphere.
  • Initiate necessary action when irregular signals are received or trouble develops.
  • Work with outside repair technicians, guards, etc. to ensure that signals are received properly and that circuits and signaling devices are restored to normal operation.
  • Notify appropriate authorities and customers if alarm signal is received.
  • Must be able to adhere to standard operating procedures and special instructions.
  • Respond quickly and precisely to incoming phone calls.
  • Document all alarm activity and subscriber phone calls via PC and activity reports.
  • Other duties as assigned.
What we look for

Required:
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Bilingual French and English 
  • At least one year of customer service experience; in a call center environment preferred.
Preferred:
  • Associates or Bachelor’s Degree
  • Law enforcement, emergency dispatching, or criminal justice background
  • Experience working with DoD Masterminds software
  • Professional communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Intermediate computer knowledge including Microsoft Windows.
  • Able to multi-task in a fast-paced work environment.
  • Comfortable handling potential emergency situations.
  • Able to type a minimum of 25 words per minute.
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to multi-task, and detail orientation.
  • Successful completion of training module (minimum 80% accuracy).

title: Buyer - CSR
description:
Responsible for processing customer and supplier orders with the majority of orders under $250 and are ad hoc spot buys. Identifies and develops new opportunities to add value and reduce costs. Interacts with all Supply Chain disciplines including vendor order placement, customer cost savings initiatives, problem resolution and delivery performance for a unlimited range of products and services. Functions with limited management oversight from direct supervisor. Operates with a fair degree of autonomy.


Description:


+ Process Customer orders following established Customer Contract guidelines with a focus to maximize Billing Margin.

+ Maintain contact with customer on status of order

+ In-depth knowledge of company’s order process and procedures.

+ Reviews customer returns when required.

+ Able to perform and execute supplier sourcing strategies.

+ Prepare requests for proposal/quotation and evaluate responses.

+ Maintain accurate product information, manufacturer names/part numbers, pricing, and cost data on applicable company systems.

+ Key contributor in new customer start-ups and implementations.

+ Build and maintain strong working relationships with suppliers and ensure that Wesco is perceived in a positive manner.

+ Expedite product delivery with suppliers to ensure customer commitments are met.

+ Resolve receiving and supplier invoice discrepancies.

+ Review supplier shipping errors and determine appropriate action.


Experience:


+ Prior Buyer/Customer Service experience – 2 years preferred

+ Purchasing and inventory concepts, practices and procedures


Skills:


+ Strong verbal and written communication skills

+ Computer skills, including Microsoft Office


Education:


+ High School Degree or Equivalent

+ Bachelor’s degree required.


_EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER_

_WESCO International, Inc., including its subsidiaries and affiliates ("WESCO"), is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of WESCO to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination._

title: Night Auditor
description:
Sherwood Inn is Hiring!

RESPONSIBILITIES:  

  • Check guests in and out of Resort ensuring standards are met. 
  • Posting of charges to guest accounts.
  • Closing off of computer systems and running all applicable reports for the Resort.
  • Communicate and address guest concerns or issues to appropriate team members.
  • Work overnight shifts from 11 pm - 7 am.
  • Respond to guest inquiries about the local area, resort, and attractions.
  • Answer multi-line switchboard telephone system.

QUALIFICATIONS:  

  • Excellent Interpersonal Skills.
  • Excellent judgement and diplomacy.
  • Must have valid drivers license.
  • Sound Knowledge of MS Office applications, including Word and Excel and property management system, specifically Springer Miller HOST.
  • Strong computer & typing skills.
  • Post-Secondary courses related to hospitality an asset.
  • Excellent problem solving skills.
  • Previous experience in front office and Night Audit a definite asset..
  • A self-starter and team player.
  • Ability to lift 30lbs.
  • Ability to work well independently.
  • Ability to work weekdays, weekends and holidays.

This is a seasonal position.

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact jobs@clublink.ca if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Préposé au service à la clientèle
company: Fabrique de la Paroisse Notre-dame de Montréal
description:
Lorsque nous offrons des postes, nous recherchons des candidat.e.s dynamiques et intéressé.e.s par les défis que nous proposons. Des personnes qui s’épanouiront dans leur travail tout en contribuant à la satisfaction de notre clientèle et à l’atteinte de nos objectifs. Nous sommes fièr.e.s de nos employé.e.s et ouvert.e.s à la diversité culturelle.

Nos employés sont appelés à travailler à différents postes touchant le service à la clientèle, les ventes ou les comptes à recevoir, travail auprès de clientèle endeuillée. Votre approche axée sur les gens, votre empathie et votre ouverture à la polyvalence sont des atouts incontournables pour travailler dans notre domaine!

Nous sommes à la recherche spécifiquement d'employé.e.s saisonniers, pour la période de saison s'échelonnant des mois de mars-avril à septembre-octobre. A l'extérieur de la saison, vous serez appelé à remplacer pour des périodes ponctuelles ou prolongées, selon les besoins. De plus, nous désirons profiter de cette période pour offrir la formation nécessaire à nos nouveaux employés.

title: National Customer Contact Centre Representative (NCCC) (9 Month Contract)
description:
#BeExtraordinary

At Andrew Peller Limited (APL), we deliver the perfect brand experience for every lifestyle, occasion, and generation. Through collaboration, open communication, honesty, drive to win, and accountability, we inspire teammates to be extraordinary every day.


Who We Are

We are one of Canada's largest and oldest wine companies with a rich heritage in quality winemaking.

We produce some of Canada's most recognized brands and offer our teammates a challenging and rewarding employment experience.


We are seeking a dynamic NCCC Representative to join our Supply Chain team on a 9-month contract.

The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring the delivery of timely wine shipments, the administration and management of internal and external customer orders and maintaining ongoing relationships with both internal and external customers. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, personable, have exceptional communication skills, and is confident using technology. The future incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment with a high degree of accuracy. This position requires an ability to work evening shifts per week and on statutory holidays.

We are looking for a teammate with:

  • Post-secondary diploma.
  • Hospitality designation an asset.
  • Proven best in class customer service skills.
  • Adept at complaint resolution.
  • Ability to maintain composure under stressful conditions.
  • Exceptional computer skills and knowledge including Microsoft Office Suite; Experience with Oracle an asset.
  • Ability to provide timely and accurate information.
  • Ability to problem solve while paying close attention to detail and maintaining accuracy.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a high degree of professionalism.

The successful candidate will be accountable for:

  • Maintaining a high level of product knowledge.
  • Processing customer orders, inquiries, returns and credits in a timely manner.
  • Building relationships with customers via telephone and email.
  • Effectively communicating with a national customer base with diverse and unique needs.
  • Supporting management and trade channel managers.
  • Creating and validating upload and import files for management interfaces.
  • Investigating and resolving undeliverable and returned shipments.
  • Operating within established guidelines while respecting and understanding the cross functional impact.
  • Resolving first level customer concerns and complaints.
  • Following safe work procedures and practices and reports all unsafe working conditions/hazards to their Manager.

We are conducting an internal and external search simultaneously. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest; only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In addition, per our "Internal Job Posting Policy"; internal candidates should be in their current position for one (1) year and their performance must be in good standing.

Andrew Peller Limited is committed to meeting the needs of persons with temporary and/or permanent disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We are happy to discuss any need for accommodation in the workplace and will make an effort to meet those needs in a timely manner by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility in the areas of information, communications, and employment.
