title: Customer Service Representative (Remote Workers from Ontario Welcome)
description:
At GMS Health and Travel Insurance, we've been helping Canadians feel protected and live well for more than 70 years. We care about our customers, our community and each other, giving back with our time and talents, not to mention our support for vital health programs in cardiac care and trauma services. We've also been named one of Saskatchewan's Top Employers for 10 years now!

For this opening we are looking to fill multiple openings: Permanent and Temporary positions available.

Think you'd like to be part of a team that truly takes care of our customers, our communities and each other? All in all, we're a pretty awesome bunch to work with!

Here's the role

As our frontline ambassador, you will use your positive attitude and impressive customer service skills to build strong customer relationships. Your listening skills and aptitude for problem-solving will be key in helping meet all our customer's needs. Our comprehensive training program including both in-classroom training and real-time call support will help you achieve success in this great opportunity!

Do you:

  • Have a passion for customer service and helping others?
  • Get excited about identifying and resolving customers' needs?
  • Get a sense of accomplishment from meeting targets and achieving your goals?

If you answered yes to any of the above, this might be your dream opportunity.

Set yourself apart

Here's the nuts and bolts of what we're looking for. Use these as a guide for how you can truly differentiate yourself from the competition.

  • Interpersonal Skills - can we count on you to engage with our clients in a calm, positive and professional manner at all times?
  • Communication Skills - can you put forward recommendations in exciting and clear language?
  • Decision Making - do you have a knack for gathering the necessary pieces of information in order to satisfy your customer's inquiry?

Your must haves

  • High school diploma, or combination of education and work experience.
  • Prior experience in customer service, financial services, an administration background or equivalent industry experience would be considered an asset.
  • An understanding of MS Office.

Why is being a GMS employee so great?

  • Our team is awesome! We work together for great causes and give back to the community in big ways. You'll help contribute through one paid volunteer day per year.
  • Our benefits rock. You will have extensive health, dental, HSA coverage, as well as pension matching.
  • Our hours help you achieve work/life balance. We serve our customers from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm CST, you'll start with 3 weeks' vacation plus one additional paid Wellness Day per month for even more balance.
  • We focus on your wellness. There's access to an EFAP program, on-site yoga classes, do creative lunch and learns, coloring club and so much more!

Are we a fit?

If you think so, please apply by May 8, 2022 . We'd love to reach out to everyone who applies, but we just don't have enough hands! If you're selected for an interview, we'll be in touch. If not, please consider us again in the future.

title: Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator
description:
Sandman Hotel Group is seeking an experienced, motivated Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator. In this role, you will provide a unique opportunity in supporting the overall guest feedback and loyalty program strategy across multiple hotel and restaurant brands, within the Marketing department.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator will have computer background in reservations, working within various website dashboards, reporting tools and all applications within MS Office, including Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Opera Cloud PMS, TravelClick GMS, GV360, iHotelier, and Galaxy is an asset. This position requires analytic work, organization, accuracy, efficiency, dedication, communication skills, and attention to detail. The role requires the individual to work closely with multiple hotel and restaurant brands, within the Marketing department. Requirements include multitasking amongst various mobile devices, desktop admin sites and programs. As such, we are seeking someone who is comfortable working flexible hours and dedicated to bringing new ideas into practice, within an evolving and growing department, at the forefront of new technology.

DUTIES:

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Maintenance of Loyalty Programs, including support for our program members.
  • Supporting projects that substantiate our Loyalty and Guest Feedback Strategy. Projects could include operational projects/enhancements to current offers, implementation of new capabilities or offers for an existing product, or future suite of products.
  • Work closely with the Senior Manager, Loyalty & Guest Feedback, to develop and maintain the appropriate documentation needed for guest feedback and loyalty programs.
  • Ensure that the activities authenticating our loyalty strategy are delivering value to our hotel guests and restaurant customers in a profitable way.
  • With the guidance of the Senior Manager, Loyalty & Guest Feedback, interact with customers, guests, and hotel and restaurant management to resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Contribute to the evaluation of guest feedback and loyalty programs through effective scorecard and metric analysis. Review, track and close feedback matters; issue applicable letters, certificates, loyalty and rewards; administrative maintenance of profiles and rewards points.
  • Work closely with Guest Services and Marketing to ensure continued alignment of Loyalty strategy.
  • Support the department's efforts with respect to projects and development through systems such as (but not limited to) the GDS, IDS, CRS, PMS (Opera Cloud, TravelClick), mobile app and desktop website.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Minimum call centre experience, and/or experience in a development and/or special projects area within a hospitality or hotel management organization.
  • Proven record of developing, supporting and measuring special projects, guest feedback and loyalty activities.
  • Creative problem solver with a passion for innovation, critical thinking, problem resolution, organizational and analytical skills.
  • Ability to effectively interact with all levels within the organization; ensure maximum effectiveness of loyalty initiatives; use his/her networking experience to establish strong internal and external relationships in order to increase marketing opportunities; work well with others and influence teams.
  • Strong focus on performance delivery; results orientated.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with and co-ordinate between various groups within various organizational structures.
  • Able to lead cross functional initiatives and influence effectively, collaborating with multiple levels within the organization, including senior management, support and operational managers.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Developed project management skills, with the ability to manage several dissimilar projects simultaneously.
  • Highly developed PC skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), including familiarity with key industry related software and databases such as the GDS, IDS, Extranets, CRS & PMS (Opera Cloud).
  • Written and verbal fluency in English is required. Bilingual in French and/or Spanish is an asset.

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Coordonnateur(trice) de bureau
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Coordonnateur(trice) de bureau | Service d’achat à domicile d’habillage de fenêtre sur mesure

 

875 Montée Saint-François, Laval, QC, Canada

 

Vous avez de l’expérience en coordination et êtes une personne organisée ? Vous voulez travailler avec une équipe dynamique et être un acteur clé du département du service d’achat à domicile d’habillage de fenêtre sur mesure ?

Nous sommes à la recherche de quelqu'un comme vous pour rejoindre notre équipe !

Le/la Coordonnateur(trice) de bureau relèvera directement la directrice du service de décoration à domicile et agira en tant que coordonnateur du département.  

 

Responsabilités :

  • Placer les commandes pour les stores et les rideaux ;
  • Faire des suivis de façon quotidienne avec les décorateurs et les fournisseurs ;
  • Respecter les délais et avoir une bonne gestion du temps.

 

Description du poste

 Ce que nous vous offrons :

  • Salaire concurrentiel ;
  • Horaire flexible (lundi au vendredi) ;
  • Entreprise familiale qui priorise le bien-être de ses employés ;
  • Environnement positif et stimulant ;
  • Opportunités de croissance au sein de l’entreprise ;
  • Programme d’assurances collectives (médical et dentaire) ;
  • Stationnement sur place ;
  • Rabais sur tous les produits Linen Chest.
Qualifications

  • Avoir de bonnes compétences organisationnelles ;
  • Être bilingue tant à l’écrit qu’à l’oral (français et anglais) ;
  • Bon sens du détail et rigueur ;
  • Être axé sur le service à la clientèle personnalisé ;
  • Avoir le sens des priorités. 


Informations supplémentaires

Venez faire carrière au sein de la grande famille Linen Chest !

 

Emplacement : 875 montées Saint-François à Laval

 

* Le générique masculin inclut le féminin et est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et uniquement dans le but d'alléger le texte

title: Agent au service à la clientèle (réception) _ Eurofins EnvironeX
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Eurofins Scientific est une société internationale des sciences de la vie, fournissant une gamme unique de services d’essais analytiques à des clients de diverses industries, pour rendre la vie et notre environnement plus sécuritaires, plus sains et plus durables. En passant par la nourriture que vous mangez, à l'eau que vous buvez et par les médicaments dont vous dépendez, Eurofins travaille avec les plus grandes entreprises du monde pour garantir la sécurité des produits qu'ils fournissent, l’authenticité des ingrédients ainsi que la précision de l'étiquetage. Eurofins estime être un leader mondial des tests de produits alimentaires, environnementaux, pharmaceutiques et cosmétiques et des services de recherches en agroscience (« CRO »). Il est également l'un des leaders mondiaux du marché indépendant dans certains services de test et de laboratoire pour la génomique, la pharmacologie de découverte, la médecine légale, le développement de fabrication (« CDMO »), les sciences avancées des matériaux et dans le soutien aux études cliniques.

En plus de 30 ans, Eurofins est passé d'un laboratoire à Nantes, en France, à plus de 58 000 employés à travers un réseau de plus de 1 000 sociétés indépendantes dans plus de 54 pays et exploitant plus de 900 laboratoires. Eurofins propose un portefeuille de plus de 200 000 méthodes analytiques pour évaluer la sécurité, l'identité, la composition, l'authenticité, l'origine, la traçabilité et la pureté des substances et produits biologiques, ainsi que des services innovants de tests de diagnostic clinique, en étant l'un des principaux acteurs mondiaux émergents ce domaine.

En 2021, Eurofins a généré un chiffre d'affaires total de 6,7 milliards d'euros et figure parmi les actions les plus performantes d'Europe au cours des 20 dernières années.

En 2018, le Groupe EnvironeX a rejoint la multinationale. Eurofins Scientific est l’un des leaders mondiaux dans le domaine des services analytiques et de l’expertise auprès des entreprises privées et des organismes publics des secteurs de l’environnement, de l’alimentation et de la santé pharmaceutique.

Avec de nombreuses succursales au Québec et plus de 450 employés (Longueuil, Québec, Sherbrooke, Montréal, Saint-Bruno, Saguenay) Eurofins EnvironeX est un partenaire de classe internationale en matière d’analyses de laboratoire.

EUROFINS ENVIRONEX, EMBLÈME DE QUALITÉ DE VIE!

 

POURQUOI REJOINDRE NOTRE ÉQUIPE?

Étant à la fois le leader et un employeur de choix dans le domaine des analyses de laboratoire, nous recherchons des ambassadeurs comme toi pour faire partie de notre grande famille!

Chez Eurofins EnvironeX, voici ce que tu déniches comme avantages :

  • Plan d’assurance collective avantageux*
  • Possibilité de cotiser à un REER collectif*
  • Primes avantageuses pour les quarts de travail
  • Remboursement des cotisations à un ordre professionnel*
  • Possibilité d’effectuer du télétravail*
  • Horaires flexibles
  • Possibilité d’évoluer au sein de l’entreprise
  • Stationnement et café gratuits
  • Profiter d’un menu santé (succursale Longueuil)
  • Bornes de recharges pour voitures électriques (succursale Longueuil)
  • Programme de reconnaissance des années de service

*Selon le poste

Description du poste

  • Accueillir les clients se présentant au comptoir de la réception;
  • Répondre aux appels entrants du centre d’appels de façon courtoise et polie, prendre les messages téléphoniques et déterminer les besoins de la clientèle afin de prendre les actions appropriées selon les demandes;
  • Agir à titre de support technique pour les clients (répondre à leurs besoins et les renseigner sur les services offerts par l’entreprise);
  • Être la personne clé pour la liaison entre les clients et les Chargés de projets;
  • Effectuer l’entrée de données des échantillons provenant du laboratoire dans une base de données informatique;
  • Effectuer tout autre mandat jugé pertinent par le Directeur du service à la clientèle en accord avec les compétences du titulaire du poste.
Qualifications

Exigences

  • DEP ou DEC en bureautique ou tout autre domaine connexe;
  • Détenir 1 à 2 ans d’expérience au service à la clientèle ou dans un centre d’appel;
  • Expérience dans un laboratoire est considérée comme un atout;
  • Connaissance de la suite Office (Word, Excel, Power Point).

Compétences demandées

  • Projeter une image professionnelle et exceller au service à la clientèle;
  • Capacité d’interagir avec professionnalisme et adopter une attitude positive en tout temps avec clients, collègues et supérieurs;
  • Excellentes habiletés de communication, d’esprit d’équipe et capacité de résoudre des problèmes de manière constructive;
  • Organisé, proactif, autonome, bonne gestion des priorités et capable de gérer plusieurs tâches en mêmes temps;
  • Capacité d’apprendre rapidement et de s’adapter au changement;
  • Habileté de travailler sous pression;
  • Langues parlées et écrites : français et anglais (atout).

title: Office Clerk - USG 294
description:
Company Description

Be part of a community of authentic, proud and trusted people.

Our Heavy Vehicle Parts Division is the country’s largest network. This division’s banners include Traction, TW and Cadel. Servicing the transport, construction and farming sectors, we keep them moving forward. This makes for a special kind of workplace. We have the experience and strength of our 100-year legacy and the desire to always do better for our team members and clients. Our 5000 colleagues proudly serve thousands of customers every day across Canada.

If the hat fits, we’d be proud to have you wear it! Send us your resume and join a people-centric company with a reputation of excellence.

 

Job Description

We are currently looking for a part-time Office Clerk.

Are you completing your training in office automation or accounting?

Customer service is your trademark and you are always able to find an alternative solution to meet the needs of customers?

You will be responsible for :

  • Receiving parts and accessories in the computer system (Karmak)
  • Validation of employee hours
  • Follow-up on purchases, invoicing, accounts receivable and cash balances
  • Payment of suppliers and deposits
  • Prepare sales reports as needed;
  • Perform various clerical tasks (filing, data entry, photocopying, etc.).

 

Qualifications

To join our team, you need:

  • Professional degree in office automation or accounting combined with 2 years of relevant experience in a similar role;
  • Knowledge of MS Office, bilingualism and great sense of organization and autonomy.

 



Additional Information

UAP is a diverse community that promotes inclusion and respect. The sum of our individual differences, experiences, knowledge, self-expression, unique capabilities, and talents, represents the richness of our culture. During the selection process, let us know if you need any accommodations. This information will be kept entirely confidential and will only be used to ensure you have a fair and pleasant experience with us

We will contact you as soon as possible if we think we have the hat for you!

title: Sales Support Associate
description:
Sales Support AssociateEquinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together...Sales Support Associate

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed. 

 

We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.   

 

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.  

Job Summary: A Sales Support Associate is a trusted advisor that provides support and guidance to Sales and Partners in all pre-sales and partner activities including: Project Management, deal coordination, Sales delegated opportunity management, along Sales systems, process, new platforms and product support. 

Responsibilities

  • You will collect complete, correct, and validate data 

  • Keeps systems up-to-date with customer information and legal documents

  • Handles cases according to regional case management guidelines

  • Handles quote approval process

  • Assists with new customer set up

  • Handles customer concerns between Sales Support and other internal groups

  • Works on small projects in addition to everyday role

  • Follows up with customer on required documents and missing information

  • Ensures customer PO compliance

  • Follows up on orders

  • Assists with customer questions via email or phone

  • Assists with gathering preliminary QBR info

  • Provides project management for single country, large, complex deals

  • Handles all changes and keeps the quote and documents up to date

  • Engages cross-functional teams to coordinate requirements against deadlines

  • Handles Internal Service Tickets to resolve Credit and Billing issues

  • Executes Data corrections in Siebel based on fall out report

  • Facilitates SFDC opportunity management by cleaning up opportunities based on guidelines

  • Trains Sales reps on new tools, processes, and policies

  • Delivers refresher trainings to address knowledge gaps

  • Communicates process improvements and enhancements to Sales Team

Qualifications

  • 1+ years customer/sales support experience preferred

  • Bachelor's degree preferred

Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Concierge
description:
JOB OVERVIEW:
"It makes me feel good knowing that we make the residentsâ€™ lives better. We laugh with them, cry with them, sing and dance with them â€“ we brighten their day. Working here is an unbelievable privilege and it will be something I carry with me for the rest of my life!"

- Sunrise Team Member
 
At Sunrise, our Concierge is responsible for providing excellent hospitality as they are the first impression for all visitors into the Sunrise community. The Concierge will be greeting potential residents, families, visitors, managing both external and internal calls, taking and communicating messages. The Concierge provides an overview of community information to those inquiries in support of the marketing and sales efforts.
ABOUT SUNRISE:
Sunrise Senior Living has championed quality of life in senior care for more than 30 years. We believe team members are our greatest resource and are looking for people who share our commitment to provide quality care for seniors and their families. It's no surprise that many of the world's leading experts in Senior Living entrust their career to Sunrise.
 
At Sunrise, you willâ€¦

Make a Difference Every Day
We are passionate about our mission â€” to champion quality of life for all seniors. We deliver high-quality care with a personal touch and encourage our residents to enjoy life to the fullest.
 

 

Be Part of a Uniquely Supportive Community
The care-focused environment we create for residents extends to our team members. We offer programs, rewards, and benefits to help you live your best.
 

 

Ignite Your Potential
We believe potential has no limits. We offer best-in-class leadership development programs designed to grow our leaders. We are committed to helping our team members achieve their career goals.
 
Apply today to learn why Sunrise Senior Living is a certified Great Place to Work ®
RESPONSIBILITIES & QUALIFICATIONS:
 
Position is on Call
 
Shifts are either 8am to 4pm or 4pm to 8pm
 
Responsibilities:
- Monitoring the Bistro area for refreshments, music, cleanliness
- General administrative duties
- Welcoming and support the hospitality of a Sunrise community.
 
Qualifications:
- A high school diploma or GED is required
- Proven experience in a customer service role is also required, having demonstrated excellent customer service, organizational and communication skills
- You must have good judgment, problem solving and decision making skills as well as be an organized record keeper
- Proficiency in computer skills to include the use of Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel as well as the ability to learn new applications

title: Customer Service Rep - Sales
description:
We are the leading promotional Advertising company located in Winnipeg. Our goal is simple; we promote our clients at local retail venues to increase brand awareness. We are currently seeking a Customer Service Representative - Sales  to join our promotional team.

Please note - we are only looking to fill a full time position. You must be available for full time work to be considered for the role, or 35-40 hours per week. 

This position will involve managing events on a daily basis, promoting the products and services our clients, and providing live information sessions where you will be communicating directly with customers. 

Candidates who have experience in customer service, sales, and retail will find this can be an asset. We are looking to find a team member with an open mind, a strong work ethic, a friendly attitude and a professional business ethic. 

The ideal candidate will have:
  • Positive energy.
  • A desire to learn and a student mentality.
  • The ability to quickly adapt to a new working environment.
  • The ability to work well in a team or independently.
  • Professional work ethic.
  • Good public speaking skills.
  • A desire to have fun!

Daily responsibilities:
  • Ensure the proper set up of the assigned event.
  • Responsible for managing and overseeing the retail-based event.
  • Interact with customers and clients to promote the products and/or services of our various clients.
  • Be mindful of Customer Service and Sales goals.
  • Keep a proper inventory of the merchandise.
  • Help with the execution and coordination of campaigns, like the opening and closing of events.
  • Have a strong working knowledge of the benefits of all products and services.

Qualifications:
  • Strong leadership skills.
  • Ability to flourish in a team environment.
  • Ability to set and accomplish personal and team goals.
  • 1-2 years experience in a customer service, retail, or sales environment.
  • Must be looking for full-time work.

title: Bilingual Customer Service Public Information Officer
description:
Overview:

We are compelled by our desire to become a globally recognized top tier regulatory agency. We are passionate about the environment and motivated by our want to enable innovation within the energy sector. We are committed to the economic and social development of Ontario and work every single day to deliver public value to Ontarians. We are a diverse, driven, transparent and thoughtful team, and are accountable to each other, the sector, and customers we serve. We are the ONTARIO ENERGY BOARD (OEB).

 

We are currently seeking a Bilingual Customer Service Public Information Officer.  

Responsibilities:

 

  • First point of contact for all enquiries and complaints, from members of the public regarding the Ontario energy sector and the regulation of entities licensed by the OEB within the established timelines
  • Gathers and analyses complaints, inquiry trends and sourced data to resolve disputes between consumers and regulated entities
  • Assists in the determination of whether regulated entities are following the governing legislation
  • Assesses the nature of the enquiry/complaint/correspondence and uses appropriate questions to ensure understanding of the issue
  • Seeks guidance or searches for additional information to respond to enquiries when appropriate
  • Submits complaints to regulated entities for response
  • Reviews with consumers the regulated entities responses to complaints and works towards a resolution with both parties
  • Ensures all interactions with consumers and regulated entities are recorded in CRM database
  • Provides coverage for reception duties
  • As the subject matter expert, provides information on products and services offered by the industry
Qualifications:

 

  • College or University Degree in related field or relevant work experience
  • Fluent bilingualism in Canadian French and English is required
  • Fluency in other languages is an asset
  • 1-3 years working in a client service call center environment, providing services to the public either on the telephone, written correspondence and/or in person
  • Demonstrated experience explaining and sharing information, responding to requests and enquires and resolving customer complaints and problems
  • Highly proficient with Microsoft Office Applications (Excel, Word and Outlook)
  • Experience with CRM is required, knowledge of Pivotal is considered an asset
  • Demonstrated analytical skills and investigative mindset to explore issues from all angles
  • Experience in gathering information and providing solutions  
  • Demonstrated experience in resolving issues by utilizinginvestigative practices
  • Demonstrated time management and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
  • Ability to respond quickly, and within the established time frame, to consumers in a high-volume call center in a courteous and knowledgeable manner

title: Contact Centre Representative
description:
(2) Contact Centre Representative

Who We Are

Util-Assist is a leading consulting company to electric, water, and gas utilities, with customers throughout Canada and the United States. Utilities today are undergoing an exciting digital transformation; the widespread deployment of smart grid technologies and renewable energy sources is colliding with customer demand for electric vehicles, energy savings, and better customer experiences to produce a dramatic shift in how utilities do business. Util-Assist is at the forefront of that shift.

Our vision is to be the trusted partner in driving digital innovation that reshapes the utility landscape. To bring that vision to life, Util-Assist is leading the way in helping utilities take advantage of the latest developments in utility IT, with growing practices for data analytics and customer experience consulting building on our well-established smart meter procurement and implementation management services. Our managed services division provides a variety of services to utility customers, including outage management, hosted billing, and intelligent monitoring services.

Teamwork is key to the success of the Util-Assist family; mutual respect, cooperation, and honesty are hallmarks of our principles. We offer a range of energizing, multi-disciplinary careers in a high-tech industry, with great potential for development and advancement as both the industry and our company continue to grow. Util-Assist’s new hybrid/remote-friendly work model allows us to effectively engage and support our staff by offering a diverse range of employment options, whether in office, on a hybrid schedule, or fully remote. Using technology that maximizes performance, our staff work wherever they can best serve our customers productively and efficiently, with the support they need to be most effective.

We are firmly committed to fostering a welcoming, positive, and diverse workplace. Thanks to our outstanding culture, we are the proud recipients of several national and local awards, including the Employee Recommended Workplace Award (three years running), the York Region Business of the Year award, and the Newmarket Large Business of the Year Award.

We’re excited to meet you! Learn more about Util-Assist at www.util-assist.com.

What We Need

Util-Assist’s rapid growth and expanding client base requires two (2) contact centre representatives. Joining the Contact Centre department, the successful candidates will liaise with clients, provide product/services information, and resolve emerging client issues with accuracy and efficiency while ensuring excellent service standards and high customer satisfaction.

What You’ll Do

Respond to customer inquiries in a professional and timely manner and document all calls on customer accounts.

  • Make payment arrangements with customers and respond to general inquiries regarding payments or charges.
  • Provide clients with direction regarding move requests including required documentation, security deposits and account set-up.
  • Diffuse upset customers and ensure information is communicated appropriately.
  • Provide customers with information regarding the on-line portal and self-serve options.
  • Guide customers on requirements to apply for financial assistance.
  • Keep abreast of changes and updates to systems, processes and procedures.
  • Analyze and process move-in, move-out and pre-authorized payment plan forms received from customers.
  • Validate information provided to ensure accurate information is entered in the CIS and portal.
  • Ensure all documentation is processed and appropriately filed.
  • Assist in the collection of outstanding accounts via various communication channels.
  • Analyze assigned service orders to make necessary adjustments on customer accounts.
  • Prepare reports and listings ensuring that information has been cross-referenced for accuracy.
  • Participate in the training of new employees.
  • Participate in ad-hoc projects and other tasks that may be assigned

What You’ll Bring

Experience and Education

  • 3-5 years of experience in a call centre or customer service role
  • Previous experience in the utility industry an asset

Skills

  • Advanced customer service skills
  • Advance verbal and written communication skills
  • Advanced problem-solving skills
  • Advanced multi-tasking skills
  • Advanced organization skills
  • Intermediate Microsoft Office and social media skills

Knowledge

  • Advanced knowledge of call centre practices and procedures
  • Intermediate knowledge outage management software applications
  • Intermediate knowledge of Control Room operations
  • Intermediate knowledge of the Employment Standards Act
  • Intermediate knowledge of the Ontario Electrical Safety Code

Working Conditions

  • Hybrid office environment (currently remote, with the expectation that the office will reopen in June 2022)
  • A successful SIN and passport clearance along with a police vulnerability check is required
  • To satisfy our obligation to provide a safe and healthy work environment and meet the needs and standards of our clients, the successful candidate will be required, as a condition of employment, to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 in accordance with Util-Assist’s vaccination policy. Util-Assist will comply with its obligations under applicable human rights legislation to accommodate the successful candidate if unable to receive the vaccine due to medical and/or religious reasons, up to the point of undue hardship. Additionally, if the successful candidate does not provide proof of vaccination, Util-Assist will consider whether the inability to provide proof of vaccination was the result of a lack of availability of the vaccine at the time of offer, or because the start date does not allow for vaccination prior to commencing work, and/or the successful candidate's reason for not being vaccinated. Failure to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 may result in an offer of employment being rescinded.

What We Offer

  • A competitive base salary and comprehensive health benefits
  • Work-life balance with flexible working arrangements (including working from home during the pandemic)
  • The opportunity to work with an innovative company that is on the leading edge of technology
  • Plenty of opportunity for career advancement in a fast-growing company
  • A results-driven environment
  • True team collaboration
  • A fun, social, award-winning culture

 

 

Individuals interested in applying please submit resume and cover letter by no later than:

May 13, 2022

We thank all applicants for their interest in Util-Assist; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

Util-Assist is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Agent administratif
description:
Vous êtes reconnu pour votre service à la clientèle hors pair ainsi que pour apporter un soutien administratif de qualité à votre équipe ou votre directeur?

Voilà une belle opportunité pour une personne qui a de l’expérience en tant que réceptionniste, secrétaire administrative ou encore adjointe de direction!

Un organisme communautaire qui œuvre plus particulièrement dans le domaine du logement recherche des personnes qualifiées en soutien administratif.

Plusieurs de leurs bureaux sont situés dans le centre-ville de Montréal mais il y en a aussi aux alentours (Rivière des Prairies, Dollard-des-Ormeaux, Cartierville, Lachine). Ils sont majoritairement accessibles en transports en commun.

Vos atouts:

- Vous aimez la coordination et le suivi de dossier;

- Vous maîtrisez les tâches administratives suivantes: gestion des appels, rédaction de lettres et de documents, organisation de réunions, classement des dossiers, rédaction de comptes-rendus;

- Vous êtes à l’aise en facturation et avez quelques notions en comptabilité/ gestion de budget;

- Vous connaissez la suite Microsoft Office;

- Vous avez un très bon niveau en français (écrit et parlé) et vous avez un très bon anglais parlé.

Vous bénéficierez d'un salaire concurrentiel et vous pourrez vous épanouir dans un environnement qui favorise la formation, la mobilité ainsi que l'évolution de son personnel.

Si vous avez à coeur de participer au développement social et urbain de Montréal, venez relever de nouveaux défis professionnels au sein d’une belle équipe!

En tant qu'employeur souscrivant aux principes d'équité en emploi, Personnel Alter Ego valorise la diversité au sein de son personnel, et vise à maintenir une juste représentation de tous les groupes. Les candidats/es qui postulent doivent avoir le droit de travailler au Canada.

title: Receptionist - Aesthetics Clinic
description:
We are looking for a receptionist for our Medical-Aesthetics Clinic based in Ville St-Laurent.

Are you bilingual? If have a particular interest in the field of aesthetics and wish to work in a friendly environment, this opportunity is for you!

Tasks include:

- Greet and inform customers

- Answer the phone

- Complete and transfer client files

- Manage payments

Required skills:

- Bilingualism French/ English

- Energy, dynamism

- Excellent presentation

- Being flexible with schedule

The working hours are Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday 11:00 to 17:00 and Thursday 12:00 to 20:00.
The schedule will change in the future.

Send us your CV now!

As an equal opportunity employer, Personnel Alter Ego values diversity in its workforce and seeks to ensure all groups remain fairly represented. Candidates must have the legal right to work in Canada.

title: Member Reception Agent
description:
(Work place: Québec)

Desjardins values diversity and equity in the workforce and is committed to meeting the needs of people with disabilities by adapting the recruitment process, as needed.

Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

Job Level

NV-03

The incumbent is responsible for welcoming members and customers warmly and courteously. He or she must quickly ascertains members' and customers' needs in order to direct them to individuals who can assist them or to alternative distribution channels. He or she transmits general information on Desjardins Group's service offer to members and customers.

General Information on the Position

Caisse Desjardins Des Rivières de Québec, located in a rapidly developing urban setting, serves nearly 67,000 members through its 5 service centres. It is focused on client satisfaction, democratic and cooperative vitality in its community and exemplary business performance.

Its business volume is $4.8 billion and its total savings amount to $2.4 billion (on and off balance sheet). The Caisse stands out for its business development potential and its reputation, and plays an important part in the Greater Quebec City business community. Since the well-being of its staff is a key priority, it places employees at the heart of its success and encourages them to reach a high level of professional achievement. Management creates conditions that are conducive to developing know-how and people skills.

Main Responsibilities

  • Consistently adhere to Desjardins service standards when welcoming members and customers in order to provide a distinctive experience.

  • As time permits, foster member and customer autonomy by assisting them in the optimal use of alternative tools and channels (e.g. ATMs, AccèsD Internet and telephone, Desjardins mobile services, Desjardins.com, and complementary channels such as the Student Service Centre and Desjardins Bank).

  • Ensure that members and customers experience a reasonable waiting time in the waiting room. To that effect, observe their reactions and maintain their satisfaction.

  • Pay attention to the needs of members and customers to ensure their full satisfaction and seize sales opportunities.

  • When coming into contact with members and customers, work to strengthen the trust they have in Desjardins by adequately meeting their needs.

  • As needed, schedule appointments following the process established by the caisse.

  • As required and on an ad hoc basis, answer and route phone calls and collect and provide general information.

Other working conditions

  • Schedule : 30 hours/week

  • Workplace : The work arrangement for the position is full-time on-site work #LI-Onsite

  • Number of jobs available : 2

Qualifications

  • High school diplômas in a related field

  • A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience

    Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

    • For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required

    Specific knowledge

    • Knowledge of all counter and convenience products and services

    • Knowledge of all Desjardins products and services aimed at caisse members and those offered by business centres, components, distribution networks/channels and as well as those of competitors

    • Knowledge of security measures, legal framework and internal controls

    • Understanding of the philosophy and fundamentals of financial services cooperatives

    • Knowledge of reception procedure

    • Knowledge of the general responsibilities of the caisse teams (organizational structure, roles and responsibilities)

    • Knowledge of service standards

    Desjardins Cross-sector skills

    Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning

    Key competencies for the job

    Communicates effectively, Interpersonal Savvy, Situational adaptability

    Work Location

    Caisse Desjardins Des Rivières de Québec

    Trade Union

    Non Syndiqué

    Unposting Date

    2022-05-16

    Job Family

    Member/client sales and service (FG)

title: Guest Services Supervisor
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Job Description Summary The Front Desk Supervisor (FDS) is responsible for consistently delivering results that contribute to the mission and overall success of the hotel by accomplishing performance objectives covering the front desk and is the lead Front Desk support for the Operations Manager. The main focus of the role is the training, supervising, and scheduling of the front desk team. This role also assists the Operations Manager with the accounting and human resources functions of the Front Office. The FDS serves as the lead point person with regard to the Front Desk technology systems and in-house guest marketing initiatives. The FDS also represents the hotel with all guests in absence of the General Manager and Operations Manager. Will also function as a Guest Service Agent. Job Description DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Deliver on the promise of Sonesta Service in all interactions with guests and clients. Manage according to the Sonesta G.U.E.S.T. standards and instill a passion for customer service in all associates of the hotel. Ensure all staff is properly trained on all front desk operations, hotel facilities and services, local directions and safety and emergency procedures. Ensure all staff has the supplies needed to effectively carry out their job functions. Supervise the front desk and reservation functions to ensure the delivery of superior guest services, the security of monies, credit card transactions and guest information. Responsible for the supervision of the security of cash, credit card transactions, and guest information. Supervise the overall seasonal demand reservation strategy as communicated by the hotel management team with regard to room type and length of stay pricing. Work with the hotel’s property management system (Opera) and reservation system (Synxis) to maximize revenue through occupancy and rate adjustments based on market conditions. Establish effective Front Desk communication and information system through logs, department meetings, and one-on-one interaction with the staff. Ensure guest special requests are fulfilled and proper delivery of guest services is delivered. Supervise the daily execution of the shoppe and the pour by ensuring each is stocked and maintained in an orderly and appealing manner. Establish and implement appropriate service recovery guidelines in order to ensure complete guest satisfaction. Respond to guest complaints or concerns in a prompt and professional manner. Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other shifts and departmental management. Register guests, issue room keys, provide information on hotel services and room location. Answer phones in a prompt and courteous manner. Supervising the accurate processing all cash and credit card transactions in accordance with established procedures including but not limited to posting all charges, completing cashier and other reports, preparing deposits, and counting/securing assigned cash bank(s). Communicate any outstanding guest requests or issues to management that may require additional monitoring or follow-up. Regularly sell hotel rooms through direct client contact. Ensure compliance with federal, state and local laws regarding health, safety, and alcohol services. Perform other duties as assigned. Act as Manager on duty QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: High School diploma or equivalent required. Two years of previous hotel experience required. Previous background from the extended stay industry preferred. Ability to speak, read, and write fluent English; other languages beneficial. Professional verbal and written communication skills. Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances preferred. Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities preferred. Will be required to obtain a ServSafe certification. May be required to obtain a TIPS certification. Experience with Microsoft Office and Opera systems required. Valid driver’s license required. Frequently standing up, bending, climbing, kneeling, and moving about the facility. Carrying, lifting or pulling items weighing up to 50 pounds. Frequently handling objects and equipment. Will be required to work mornings, evening, weekends, and holidays. Additional Job Description Sonesta is a equal opportunity employer. Should you require accommodation under AODA please let HR know. Benefits Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Health Savings Account with Company Match 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match Paid Vacation and Sick Days Sonesta Hotel Discounts Educational Assistance Paid Parental Leave Company Paid Life Insurance Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance Various Employee Perks and Discounts Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.</section>

title: Specialist, Client and Crew Communications
description:
SKYSERVICE BUSINESS AVIATION 

Skyservice is a North American leader in business aviation. Built on the key principles of safety and service excellence, we provide a full service experience from Aircraft Management, Aircraft Charter, Maintenance and Aircraft sales from our Fixed Base Operations that span Canada and the western United States. People and values are the inseparable assets that drive our dedication to Quality, Safety, Respect, Commitment and Efficiency. These are the core values that guide us every day and help build our reputation as leaders in aviation services. Skyservice is a team dedicated to supporting and developing our employees. If you want to grow your career and broaden your experience, then Skyservice is the right team for you.

SUMMARY OF RESPONSBILITIES:

  • Implement and track a client communications plan to ensure on time delivery;
  • Create, develop and issue communication campaigns, guidelines and strategies, and monitor their effectiveness;
  • Craft engaging content and client and crew communications;
  • Work with key internal stakeholders to brainstorm content ideas that are aligned with company and client and crew communication strategies and plans;
  • Coordinate external and internal flow of client and crew communications (i.e. memos, etc.);
  • Plan pre-and post-communications initiatives that support Client Solutions and Crew Support;
  • Track metrics for client and crew communications engagement;
  • Ensure consistency across all communications adhering to the Skyservice brand guidelines;
  • Plan and execute on new communications initiatives as required;
  • Other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • 5-7 years’ experience in a similar role;
  • Bachelor’s degree or college diploma in PR, Corporate Communications or a related field and/or equivalent combination of education and experience;
  • Digital communications experience (web, social media, CRM);
  • Previous experience in managing communications as it relates to internal and external stakeholders;
  • Intermediate proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite (i.e. Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator) is an asset;
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite;
  • Superior communication and organizational skills;
  • Confident self-starter with the ability to multi-task, prioritize and develop relationships while working independently and confidently;
  • Deadline driven with meticulous attention to details;

Skyservice is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. If for any reason you cannot apply through our job board, please contact a member of our Human Resources team for special accommodation.

title: Part-Time Customer Service Representative
description:
Inside Sales/Customer Service Representative

As a member of the Lynden Door sales team, the Inside Sales/Customer Service Representative position will deliver the highest level of customer service and sales support, thereby strengthening customer relationships and contributing to profitable new business opportunities for the Organization. The responsibility of the Inside Sales/Customer Service Representative is to concentrate on the reputation of the organization and achieving total customer satisfaction through creative approach and active experience. They will collaborate with inter-departmental team members to deliver industry-leading customer service and sales support to Lynden Door's customers.

HOURS: Part-time with flexible hours, preferred hours Monday-Friday 9am-2:00pm (22.5 hours/week).

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Positively address customer concerns and / or questions
  • Cooperatively interact with purchasing and production departments to evaluate costs and procedures required to successfully fulfill order requirements
  • Administer sales product samples, pre-finish samples and product literature
  • Prepare routine estimates under general supervision for the purpose of winning commercial projects for Lynden Door
  • Verify orders for accuracy of date and scheduling
  • Order Processing:
    • Process change orders & credits
    • Support product shipping logistics
    • Distribute appropriate information to required departments

CORE SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Customer Service oriented/attention to accuracy, detail, quality and service
  • Strong organization skills - ability to productively work on multiple tasks
  • Creative and solution-oriented problem-solving skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work well with internal & external customers, even in tense or aggressive situations
  • Experience with Office Systems, Business Machines and Computers
  • Working knowledge of spread sheets for estimating, costing, analysis (Preferred, not required)
  • Knowledge of Door Industry, Products and Services (Preferred, not required)

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Related college degree preferred

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

  • Compensation based on experience

MORE ABOUT OUR COMPANY:

We are an equal opportunity employer and one of North America's leading manufacturers of quality residential and commercial interior wood doors. The great service and products we deliver are a result of the hard work and talent of our exceptional team. We work very hard to hire the best team members who share our core values in respect for all people, integrity in every situation, and quality in everything we do. A supportive team with diverse backgrounds and career experiences from all around the world strengthens who we are and provides many opportunities for continuous growth and development within our Company.

title: Bilingual Customer Care Advisor - English/Spanish
description:
<section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The Achievers Employee Success Platform™ delivers high-frequency recognition that drives business outcomes for HR and business leaders, from decreased turnover to increased engagement. Designed specifically to meet the needs of today’s workforce, it empowers employees to recognize each other in real time and aligns them to the values and goals of the company. With more than 3 million users, the Employee Success Platform inspires brilliant performance in 170 countries. Visit us at www.achievers.com to learn more and join us in our mission to Change the Way the World Works™.

Overview:
A Customer Care Advisor is a highly motivated, customer-orientedindividual who is passionate about the Achievers members experience!Our Global Member Experience team guarantees the highest level of excellence to ensure that members rave about our services and get the answers they need in real time. If you are technically savvy and are passionate about delighting customers, you’ll fit right in! As a Customer Care Advisor you will have the opportunity to advance your career with additional internal training opportunities leading to increased customer support and technical understanding.

Responsibilities:
· Get connected and handle inbound and outbound queries via phone, live chat and email in multiple languages (English + Spanish)
· Turn our customers into “Raving Fans” using your exemplary customer service
· Use your epic problem-solving skills to resolve customer inquiries, questions, and complaints
· Navigate our platform like a pro and stay up to date with new features and releases
· Recognize your peers and be recognized for being awesome!
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English & Spanish OR French
· Troubleshoot issues with computer systems, web‐based applications, and mobile technology
· Achieve personal goals and departmental SLA’s consistently 
· Work alongside of some of the best teammates in the industry
· The ability to work flexible hours, in shifts, between the hours of 6:00 am‐3:30am (including regular day shifts and some weekends)

Qualifications & Skills:
· Must have a passion for supporting customers and eager to learn what it takes to create an amazing customer‐ centric team
· Previous related customer service experience
· Attends to responsibilities through a quality and attention to detail lens
· Ability to actively listen and communicate effectively 
· Proficient in resolving conflict through utilizing problem-solving and negotiation skills
· An aptitude to create positive member experiences through a member-oriented approach

About Achievers:

As Achievers employees, we are passionate about disruptive technology, welcome constant change, and understand the value of employee success in the workplace. We enjoy coming to work every day because we believe in our product and love our culture. Achievers is more than just a software company; we are industry leaders in the HR space.

We have been recognized in numerous publications for our contributions to HR, for technical excellence and for our outstanding workplace culture!

Check out our platform in action here

Achievers does not offer employment to prospects without first ensuring that qualified candidates speak directly with the hiring manager and a member of our HR team. All qualification will be done face-to-face, whether that is in person or over Zoom. Achievers does not send out offers of employment without meeting candidates and does not offer employment via text. If you are requested for any personal information via text and/or without having met a member of our hiring team in person, please disregard.

Our employees are a diverse and inclusive team of passionate, hardworking individuals. Achievers is committed to creating an environment where our employees can do the best work of their lives. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply to join our A-Player family. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.</section>

title: Receptionist
description:
Peterbilt Pacific is currently seeking a Receptionist for a temporary contract to cover a leave of absence (6 months +). The Receptionist greets clients arriving at the office, directs visitors to appropriate person or service, answers and forwards telephone calls, takes messages, and performs other clerical duties.

 

At Peterbilt Pacific, we strive to conduct our business as a well-respected organization; with integrity, hard work, and with the highest care for our people, customers, and business partners.  Every employee at Peterbilt Pacific is absolutely critical to our success. Our promise is to keep delivering the same award-winning service and value that our community has come to expect from our dealership group throughout the years.

 

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities

  • Maintain switchboard and direct incoming calls
  • Take messages and forward to voicemail accordingly
  • Re-file parts accounting copies when returned from head office
  • Prepare daily mail and Loomis packs
  • Maintain Postage in postal meter – by phone
  • Open incoming mail, sort and distribute as necessary
  • Assist with taking deposits to the bank
  • Prepare, sort and catalogue request for Credit for Parts, Cores and Warranty department
  • Match payables to packing slips and code for approval
  • File payable on return from HO
  • Handle all miscellaneous request from all front office personnel
  • Assist customer with account inquires
  • Handle any request from HO to search for invoices, rfc’s or miscellaneous paperwork
  • Ensure that all office supplies are adequate for each department
  • Stamping, coding and posting payables
  • Sort Repair Orders, separating accounting copies for HO
  • Other duties as assigned
     

Education and Experience Requirements

  • Grade 12 or GED required
  • 3+ years of experience in a fast-paced administrative role
     

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Strong personal organizational skills as they relate to workload, time management and setting priorities in an unsupervised environment
  • Effective problem solving and negotiating skills
  • Effective conflict resolution skills
  • Type 60+ words per minute

title: Service Receptionist- Barnes H-D Langley
description:
HEY YOU! Yes, YOU! 

You’re ENERGETIC, GOAL-ORIENTED and EFFICENT as all heck! You love fast-paced environments and solving new challenges! 

You’re looking for THE BEST place to advance in your CAREER! 

Just ask many of our Service Advisors how they got their start! 

Take the first step to your dream career, it’s right here in front of you! 

Become a Service Appointment Coordinator with Barnes Harley-Davidson! 

What we need: 

  • We need a super hero of appointment booking! You have no problem accepting inbound calls and making outbound calls to book appointments! 

  • You’re a super sleuth in finding solutions for problems and challenges 

  • Your organization skills are A1 

  • Have Quorum experience? Nice! We’ll call that a bonus point 

  • You can handle customer service like an absolute champ 

What you get: 

  • Compensation – Best in industry pay. Almost all our pay plans are incentive based so the sky is the limit for your earning potential. You never want to be capped and we never will.  

  • Culture – we are a performance driven organization with high accountability and constant feedback on how our team members are doing. If you are looking for a place to perform and showcase your skills, this is the culture that fits you need.  

  • Health & Dental – Do benefits make you SMILE? Show off that grin! Receive comprehensive benefits such as health care, dental, gym membership, mental healthcare benefits, and more! 

  • Career Development– Your success is our success. From our internal Barnes University training programs to factory training from our manufacturers to all sorts of opportunities, if you want to never learn we are not the company for you.  

  • Opportunity for Growth – We have people that go from washing bikes to running dealerships and everything in between. We’ll help you make it happen 

  • Community – we give back to the communities we do business in in meaningful ways.  

  • Family Owned and Operated – For over 40 years the Barnes Family has been hands on running  our dealerships, get personal leadership and mentorship not some corporate text book. 

At Barnes Harley-Davidson we build careers. Ask about one of our many career path success stories during your interview. 

The first step towards the life you want starts now. Rev the throttle, drop the clutch and apply today.

title: Customer Fulfillment Associate - Toronto
description:
New Goodfood Store launching in the Junction area
Location: 51 Vine Avenue, Toronto, ON M6P 1V6

Please check the location of the job and make sure that you can access the location before applying.

Salary: $16.00 per hour!

Schedule: TBD

In-light of the COVID-19 pandemic Goodfood is committed to upholding the absolute highest health and safety standards by putting strict procedures in place to ensure your safety at all times. Your health and safety and our members’ are #1 priority for us.

About Goodfood: Goodfood is Canada’s leading online grocery company, delivering fresh meal solutions and grocery items directly to members’ doorsteps, making it easy for members from coast to coast to enjoy delicious meals at home every week.

Goodfood is growing and expanding our operations here in Ontario. We are piloting our very first “Cloud Store'', which is a small fulfillment centre located at Spadina and Front Street intersection in Toronto and will soon expand to other locations. The purpose of this cloud store is to have a location in close proximity to our downtown customers so that we can pick, pack, and deliver their orders the same day! This environment is about the size of an average convenience store and is not refrigerated, as we will store our products in stand-up freezers and refrigerators.


What you’ll be doing: Under the direction of the Shift Coordinator, and Operations Supervisor, the Fulfillment Associate position is responsible for helping us prepare, package, and ship each order according to the needs of our customers. Our Fulfillment Associates use their attention to detail and care to ensure our customers receive the highest quality product and have a seamless customer experience. If you enjoy an active and fast paced environment, we have multiple shifts available to suit your schedule!


Responsibilities:

  • Assemble customer orders from storage racks and coolers
  • Carefully and efficiently prepare and pack customer orders for same day delivery
  • Ensure Goodfood customers receive the highest quality product, every time
  • Take direction from Supervisors and ensure key performance targets are met (especially around quality)
  • Proactively monitor and report inventory levels to Supervisor
  • Follow all food safety regulations
  • Foster an environment where teamwork and inclusivity is prioritized
  • Contribute to a culture of innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment at all times


If you want to be part of a growing company that’s changing how Canadians eat, now is a great time to put on your steel-toe shoes and join!

  • A High School diploma or equivalent
  • 4 months + experience in a warehouse/manufacturing industry is required
  • Strong English written and oral communication skills
  • Well developed attention to detail skills
  • Ability to take direction/ coaching and put into action
  • Strong work ethic and professional attitude
  • The ability to regularly lift up to 35-40 pounds
  • Experience in and preference for working in a fast-paced environment

What Goodfood can offer you:

  • Protective gear and COVID-19 measures to keep you safe;
  • Permanent role in a competitive job market;
  • Ability to start a new and exciting role immediately;
  • To be part of a growing company with passionate colleagues;
  • Free coffee & parking, and nearby bus stops to the location
  • The possibility to move up the ranks and build your career.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Are you passionate about cryptocurrency and ready to explain it to anyone, from an expert to a novice? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment? If yes, we have the job for you!

As one of Canada’s largest and fastest growing cryptocurrency trading platforms, NDAX has set the bar high for the country’s fintech industry and is constantly leading the way in terms of security and innovation. We’re on a mission to empower more Canadians to unlock the full potential of digital finance. To address the various needs in the Canadian cryptocurrency space, NDAX has assembled a multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds, including finance, technology, engineering, compliance, marketing, and more.

NDAX is currently looking to hire a Customer Support Agent. As a customer support agent at NDAX, you will become one of the faces and names associated with our brand, so it is vital that you are friendly, understanding, patient, and kind to every NDAX client.

In this position, you will interact with customers to provide information in response to inquiries about products and services; you will also handle and resolve client's questions and complaints. Excellent communication abilities and data entry skills are essential for candidates.

Our clients have different levels of trading experience; there will not be a one-fit-all solution for every customer – being able to understand each customer's needs and meet them at their level is an important skill for any member of our customer support team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Respond to customer service live chats, emails, telephone calls, and voicemails
  • Maintain customer relationships by handling questions and concerns with speed and professionalism
  • Resolve customer complaints, manage database records, draft status reports on customer service issues
  • Provide a great experience and build loyalty with every customer you talk to
  • Stay on top of promotions, product launches, and cryptocurrency trends
  • Create value through superior customer service and expert product knowledge

:

  • Self-motivated with an ability to solve problems on-the-fly
  • Passionate for customer satisfaction with strong interpersonal communication skills
  • An enthusiastic learner with a desire for continual growth
  • Available full-time and have flexible schedules that meet business needs, including morning and evening shifts
  • Extended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)
  • Paid Time Off Benefits
  • Work From Home - Flexible Hours
  • Training & Development Opportunities
  • Bonus – Awards – Gifts

title: Client Service Advisor (Auto/Flat Glass)
description:
We are Market Leaders in the service industry with a 4.9 rating on facebook & google. With generations of experience delivering the highest quality service available to over 10,000 customers, Allbrite Glass & Tint provides Auto, Home, Business Glass & Tint and is fully dedicated to maintaining its position as Kitchener-Waterloo, Cambridge Guelph, Woodstock Regions #1 rated service company.


We are a very aggressive company with tremendous growth potential. With multiple service vehicles and dedicated employees, we want only the "best of the best" who are seeking a long-term career with growth and development. That means you must be highly energetic, motivated and have a "winning mindset". As an equal opportunity employer, candidates will receive consideration without discrimination against race, creed, color, sex, national origin, handicap status or veteran status. Allbrite Glass delivers Service You Can Trust!


  • We are looking for highly motivated, professional, Client Service Experts that are responsible for greeting & giving WOW SERVICE!! experience to our clients throughout the repair process and handling and organizing much of the branch’s administrative paperwork.
  • We will train for the right person that loves working with people and deliver high value!.


Why join our team and Whats in it for you?


  • Plenty of advancement opportunities
  • Training, Career & Positive Life Development
  • We want to help fulfil your personal & professional dreams
  • Great working environment
  • Paid vacations AND birthdays
  • We fight for your livelihood
  • We respect and treat you like family
  • Ability to earn more!!! ($18-$25per hour)
  • Bonuses & prizes available on top of base pay
  • We live by our core value
  • Must be willing to pursue, develop and participate in continuing education.
  • Follow the outline of company policies and procedures.
  • Communicate professionally and respectfully with client, office staff and coworkers.
  • Outgoing, professional, clean cut, aggressive, and drug-free.
  • Participate in all required staff meetings and training.
  • Help maintain and promote a high company moral, professional, and friendly work environment.
  • Work hard, smart and efficiently.
  • A superior service-attitude towards customers and an excellent telephone manner
  • Always neat in appearance
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Professionally answers incoming phone calls from policy holders, insurance agents, retail & commercial customers
  • Follow and be guided by our Core Values , Brand Promise & Company Purpose.
  • Follow all training in our Client Service Advisor, Job dispatch, Inbound & Outbound Playbooks
  • Skills / Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Excellent sales abilities
  • Prior experience in customer service
  • Demonstrated Point of Sale System and Microsoft Office proficiency
  • Knowledge of computer and telephone systems
  • Knowledge of auto glass products, installation and repair procedures
  • Knowledge of scripting and claim processing procedures for the assigned insurance company
  • Ability to operate computer and telephone systems while seated for extended periods of time
  • Skill in speaking with a pleasant voice, retaining composure, and building rapport among peers, stores, and customers
  • Excellent training & development programs
  • Flex schedule
  • Sales Bonus Program
  • Allowance for uniform
  • Health/Dental Benefits
  • Fitness Benefit
  • $16-$22 per hour
  • Apply in Confidence – Apply now!
  • We thank all candidates for their interest. Only the qualified, selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Guest Experience Agent | Agent service a la clientele
description:
Our Mission
To offer a haven for personal renewal in the Scandinavian age-old tradition where body and mind find peace.


Vision
To be recognized as the best relaxation experience in Canada while providing a meaningful workplace that encourages a balanced lifestyle.


Fundamental Values


Authenticity: we are welcoming and genuine. With the simplicity and quality of the experience we offer, we lead by staying true to the Scandinavian tradition through our locations, materials, and scents.

Team Spirit: we communicate, display empathy and work in a family spirit. We approach change in a positive way, are always willing to help, and rally around common goals.

Professionalism: we anticipate our guest needs and go above and beyond their expectations, we are experts, we perform at the highest level, we lead by example, are accountable and deliver great results.

Expectations
To offer a warm, friendly and professional welcome to guests.
To create a comfortable environment for guests.
To sell and promote the products and services offered by the Spa Scandinave Whistler.

Tasks & Responsibilities:
Welcome the guests and give explanation regarding:

The Scandinavian Baths procedures;

Massages procedures;

Orientation of The Scandinave Whistler using map of the site;

Understanding the needs of the guests and offering appropriate services and products to the guests;

Opening and closing procedures for the Spa;

Processing a variety of transactions depending on guest needs using TAC:

Scandinavian Baths & massages;

Gift certificates & Gift cards;

Bistro products;

Boutique products;

Ensure the efficient control of locker keys, towels and waiting list;

To ensure the order, cleanliness and ambiance within the reception area; lobby, change rooms, fireplace, bathrooms, etc.;

Preparation of the gift packages;

Ensuring adequate staffing presence in the reception

Reviewing and educating yourself of the various sales and marketing promotions.

Ensuring that breaks and lunches are taken in a responsible fashion IE. Stations are covered while breaks are being taken;

Lost and found procedures and protocols are followed;

Receiving mail and packages;

Keeping all products fully stock for example towels, bathrobes etc.;

Keeping all products in Boutique stocked;

Knowing how to process various types of transactions in TAC based on the guests' needs using TAC i.e baths, massage gift certificates, packages, etc.;

Be aware of the various sales and marketing promotions in place as per the Sales and Marketing Team;

To respond to the needs of groups in accordance with the directives of Sales and Marketing;

Keep reception area fully stocked with necessary supplies i.e. pens, brochures, gift cards, etc.;

All other tasks requested of you for the smooth and efficient function of the Spa Scandinave Whistler

Prerequisites:

Minimum 2 years of customer service experience

Ability to remain professional and courteous with customers at all times

Must be available to work evenings, holidays and weekends

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Must be able to think on their feet, be proactive, problem solve, and deal with change on a daily basis

Clear criminal record check


***For Scandinave Spa Mont-Tremblant and Scandinave Spa Montreal please review the Job Description in French as the tasks and prerequisites may differ***



Notre Mission

Offrir un lieu de ressourcement qui poursuit la tradition millénaire des bains scandinaves où le corps et l'esprit sont au repos.

Vision

Être reconnu comme la meilleure expérience détente au Canada tout en offrant un milieu de travail valorisant qui encourage un mode de vie équilibré.

Valeurs de l'entreprise

Authenticité : Nous sommes accueillants et sincères. Par la simplicité et qualité de l'expérience que nous offrons, nous nous démarquons en restant fidèle à la tradition Scandinave à travers nos emplacements, matériaux et senteurs.

Esprit d'équipe : Nous communiquons, faisons preuve d'empathie et travaillons dans un esprit de famille. Nous abordons le changement de façon positive, sommes toujours prêts à aider et nous nous rallions vers des objectifs communs.

Professionnalisme : Nous anticipons les besoins de nos invités et allons au-delà de leurs attentes, nous développons nos compétences pour performer, nous donnons l'exemple, nous respectons nos engagements et livrons d'excellents résultats.


SOMMAIRE :

Accueillir les invités et donner les explications relatives aux :

Procédures des bains scandinaves;

Procédures de préparation pour les massages;

Orientation sur le site et emplacement des divers endroits;

Cerner les besoins du client puis offrir les produits et services disponibles;

Effectuer divers types de transactions à l'aide de notre logiciel, selon les besoins des invités, soit bains et ou massages, cartes-cadeaux et de la boutique;

Assurer le contrôle des clés des vestiaires et de la liste d'attente, le cas échéant;

Répondre aux besoins des groupes en accord avec les directives du directeur adjoint;

Conserver l'ordre et la propreté du pavillon de la réception, boutique, vestiaires, etc.;

Conserver bien remplis les items de la boutique;

Toutes autres tâches assignées nécessaires au bon fonctionnement de l'entreprise.

EXIGENCES ET PRÉREQUIS

  • Aimer le contact avec le public;
  • Sens très élevé de l'organisation;
  • Capacité de travailler avec un minimum de supervision;
  • Sens inné de la communication professionnelle;
  • Faire preuve d'un bon esprit d'équipe;
  • Capacité de gérer plusieurs dossiers;
  • Manifester une attitude constructive;
  • Avoir de l'expérience en service à la clientèle et réservations dans le domaine touristique;
  • Bilinguisme français et anglais (oral et écrit);
  • Maîtrise des logiciels de Microsoft Office.

Perks & Benefits:

  • Data entry 

Qualifications:
  • One plus years of office experience including filing, scanning, and data entry
