title: Receptionist/Clerk/Typist
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Receptionist/Clerk/Typist
Work Site: Medical Imaging Clerical, Vancouver General Hospital
Status: Regular Full Time - Float
Start Date: As soon as possible
Salary: $21.37 per hour
Hours:

0645-1445/0800-1600/1500-2300/2330-0730

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays

Reference#: 162720-jim

 

Come work as a Receptionist/Clerk/Typist with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Receptionist/Clerk/Typist to join the Medical Imaging Clerical team at Vancouver General Hospital, Vancouver, BC. Apply today to join our team!

 

As a Receptionist/Clerk/Typist with VCH you will:

  • Perform a variety of clerical, reception and typing duties such as:
    • Receiving visitors and patients;
    • Answering incoming calls;
    • Responding to enquiries and requests for release of Radiology report information;
    • Preparing and maintaining patient files;
    • Inputting a variety of patient information into an established computerized database system;
    • Signing out images;
    • Printing or copying Radiology images within the darkroom or to disk from the Picture Archiving and Communication System;
    • Collecting and distributing mail, dictation tapes and reports within the department;
    • Typing non-technical material utilizing wordprocessing software; and
    • Investigating and performing corrections to computerized patient information utilizing the Radiology and Hospital Information Systems.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 12, plus  one (1) yearâ€™s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to keyboard at 40 w.p.m.
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Service Advisor (Brampton North Nissan)
description:
Drive for Excellence

Brampton North Nissan is a globally recognized dealership as part of the exclusive Nissan Global Award winners’ club. We are recognized for our performance and commitment to creating a trustworthy guest experience that inspires loyalty.

Part of the Performance Auto Group, a leading automotive group, we are committed to integrity, believe in employee empowerment, passionate about innovating, care about a great guest experience and giving back.

Brampton North Nissan is currently seeking an experienced Service Advisor to join their dynamic team.

About you.

You are a high energy, positive self starter that thrives in a fast paced and results oriented work environment. Brampton North Nissan is a dynamic team who works together as a family in a fun, energetic atmosphere. You are someone who is proactive, transparent and strives for the best service to our valued guests. We have countless success stories and celebrate each and every one. We look forward to having you on board.

Here’s what you’ll deliver:

  • Experienced in providing exceptional customer service.
  • Works with Technicians to identify required maintenance and repairs.
  • Prepare repair orders, enter them into the database system and close the orders by providing appropriate repairs and services. 
  • Provides service recommendation to customers including estimating costs.
  • Performs road tests of customer vehicles to assess customer concerns.
  • Ensures customer satisfaction meets company and manufacturers standards.
  • Strive to meet the department's repair order production standards.
  • Perform other Service related duties as required by management. 

What you need to succeed:

  • 1-2 years of automotive experience would be an asset.
  • G driver’s license with a clean driving record, required.
  • CDK Dealer software experience is preferred.
  • Able to work well under pressure.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times.
  • Ability to analyze and interpret the needs of clients and offer the appropriate options, solutions, and resolutions required.
  • Highly flexible, with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment.
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude.
  • Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information.

What’s in it for you?

  • Excellent management support and guidance
  • Opportunities through our Internal career mobility program
  • Access to health, dental and vision insurance
  • Disability, critical illness and life insurance for the unexpected
  • Our Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family's wellness
  • Discount on vehicles, service and parts for you and your family
  • Discounts to retailers and service providers across the country
  • Free and engaging employee events 
  • Did we mention we love giving back to our communities?!
Performance Auto Group is a leadin automotive company in Southern Ontario with over 1800 employees, 23 brands and 32 locations in Brampton, Brantford, Bolton, Grimsby, Mississauga, Oakville, Orangeville, St. Catharines and Toronto. Performance Auto Group also includes AutoPlanet Direct, Ontario's largest indoor used car showroom. 

Performance Auto Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment and selection process. Applicants may request any accommodation needs required.

title: Service Administrator/Advisor
description:
• Clairmont, AB
  • $18 per hour
  • Monday to Friday, 8 AM to 5 PM
  • Contract to start

Ian Martin Workforce has partnered with a corporation that designs, manufactures, and distributes engines, filtration, and power generation products.

In this role, you would be serving as the first point of contact with customers to promote quality customer service and assist with the increasing business within the branch location.

You will be doing …

  • Serves as the first point of contact with customers either on the phone or at the branch, developing positive relationships with key customers.
  • Assesses customer's needs and gathers pertinent information
  • Creates basic work orders in appropriate systems
  • Provides some status updates to customers, as requested

Why this is the right job for you…  

  • This is an entry-level position ideal for someone that is fresh out of school or to the job market and interested in getting started in a role that could lead to a career
  • Experience with computers, phones, in-person communication
  • Positive, energetic individual. Eager to learn and is curious about engines
  • The environment is fast-paced and would need someone who can adapt quickly



Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help.

At the Ian Martin Workforce, we exist to connect people like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at 

http://subbaiah.uthaiath@ianmartin.com/

or call (647) 957 7166.

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Bilingual Customer Service Agent - Summer Student
description:
Job Details

Job Description

At Kruger Products we have a shared vision for greatness. We manufacture some of North America’s most popular tissue brands - Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®, as well as products for use away from home. We always want to do better for our customers and our world. The awards we’ve earned remind us that our hard work and commitment to doing the right thing pays off. But they aren’t what keep us going. It’s the people who work here, who believe in what we do – and how we do it that truly matters.

We are leaders in our communities, leaders in sustainability, and leaders in connecting with our consumers. Our headquarters is in Mississauga, ON, but we proudly have nearly 2,500 employees spread across eight manufacturing plants in Quebec, British Columbia, Ontario, and Tennessee.

WHAT YOU WILL DO 

The BilingualCustomer Service Agent will coordinate and perform all order management activities, and work with our Supply Chain, Sales, and Logistics teams to ensure accurate and on-time delivery to our customers. This is a summer opportunity and is a great opportunity for students to start building your career!

In this role, you will:

  • Be the first point of contact for our customers and their orders
  • Identify and provide solutions to correct or improve customer issues
  • Manage and track orders to ensure fulfillment and delivery
  • Investigate and perform searches with carriers and other logistics partners to investigate issues of concern

WHAT WILL YOU BRING 

  • Availability to work weekends
  • Must be fully bilingual in English/French with both verbal and written communication skills
  • Previous experience in a customer-focused role
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; SAP experience is an asset
  • Ability to multi-task in a high-pressure environment while maintaining a professional demeanor
  • Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills
  • Required to be on-site

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU

Our mission is to make everyday life more comfortable for our consumers. Together we bring this mission to life. As an ever-evolving business, there are always exciting new challenges, diverse career options, and opportunities to innovate. Want to learn more? Come unleash your greatness with Kruger Products.

We have been named one of GTA’s Top Employers for the past 9 consecutive years, as well as Forbes' Best Employers in Canada.

Kruger Products is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified individuals.  Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under KPLP’s Accessibility Policy and Multi-Year Accessibility Plan - 1.04.33.  Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

We thank all applicants for their interest in Kruger Products but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Receptionist
description:
Job Description

Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

Reporting to the Facility Manager and based at the Calgary Courts Centre location, the successful candidate’s primary responsibility will be to provide professional in-person, telephone, and email reception. In addition, the candidate may provide administrative and document control support as required such as producing miscellaneous correspondence, reports, specifications, and spreadsheets.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Provide professional, courteous in-person, telephone, and email reception.
  • Greet visitors and answer inquiries.
  • Facilitate, document, and track sub-contractor registration and orientation.
  • Respond to service request submissions via phone and email.
  • Monitor shared service request inbox and dispatch service requests to building technicians.
  • Create daily work orders for all service requests.
  • Manage, document, and track building lost & found.
  • Document and track boardroom bookings.
  • Manage ingoing / outgoing mail.
  • Maintain and order kitchen supplies (coffee, tea, etc.).
  • Maintain and order office supplies (stationary etc.).
  • Update and manage office spreadsheets (security clearances, WHMIS, tenant contact lists, etc.).
  • Maintain and update operational binders (H&S orientations, waivers, etc.).
  • Provide vacation relief and backup to other team members when required.
  • Assist leadership team when requested and execute other related duties as assigned.

What will you contribute?

  • Minimum 2-3 years administration/reception experience.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint; experience with JD Edward Enterprise One an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication, and customer service skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
  • Strong organizational, planning, and time management skills.
  • Critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills.
  • Exceptional ability to adapt to changing situations with focus on collaboration.
  • Local candidates will be preferred, and no relocation package will be offered.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

**************************

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available atsnclavalin.comor follow us onLinkedInandTwitter.

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.  

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Client Service Associate
description:
Our client, an independent wealth management boutique in Toronto, is looking for a Client Service Associate to join the team.  You will be working closely with our Investment Counsellors providing administrative support while building rapport with our HNW clients.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Onboarding new clients, trade preparation and verification, cash balances management, account reconciliation, document management, and reporting
  • Manage and resolve requests from clients, custodians, and/or Counsellors
  • Prepare, review, and distribute monthly and quarterly reporting to clients
  • Provide team back-up when needed  

Requirements

  • University degree or relevant post-secondary diploma
  • Successful completion of the Canadian Securities Course (preferred)
  • Minimum three years’ related experience in an administrative or financial services role
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office 365
  • Experience using Client Relationship Management software (e.g. Salesforce) and Trade Order Management software (e.g. SimCorp Dimension), is an asset
  • Compliance focused mindset with exceptional client service skills
  • Hands-on, self-starter with strong interpersonal and team skills
  • Attention to detail is a must
  • Strong communication, analytical, organizational, and troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to prioritize and remain composed in a fast-paced environment

 




Financial Services, Client service, mutual fund trades

title: Client Partner (Toronto)
description:
Job Description

All our positions are available across Canada. We offer collaborative workspaces in Montreal (head office), Toronto, Quebec, and Windsor.

Do you love customer relationship management and digital marketing? Do your instincts allow you to uncover opportunities and turn them into projects? Do you understand the needs of your clients before they are communicated to you?

If this sounds like you, keep reading – we have a Client Partner role that might interest you!

Your day-to-day involves:

  • Participating in business development (prospecting and RFP response process);
  • Advising clients about business challenges related to technology and digital marketing products;
  • Participating in the development of strategies for business proposals that affect clients in your portfolio;
  • Ensuring the sustained growth and profitability of your client portfolio;
  • Organizing and leading planning sessions related to your portfolio activities;
  • Writing specifications (briefs) for project teams;
  • In collaboration with project teams (project manager, creation, production, etc.), monitoring the progress of the projects according to the specifications and client expectations;
  • Developing and maintaining strong business relationships with clients;
  • Ensuring the quality of Nurun's deliverables.

You are someone who is:

  • Creative in business: when customers speak to you, you know how to read between the lines, and you intuitively understand their needs before they do.
  • Diplomatic: you are the client's representative within Nurun, and Nurun's representative with the client.
  • A beacon in the storm: you know how to see changes as challenges, and you manage to motivate customers and your internal teams to overcome them.
  • Skilled in crisis management: not only can you manage a crisis confidently, you know how to attack those kinds of situation with solutions that satisfy customer needs while taking the reality of the agency into account.
Qualifications

  • A minimum of 5 to 7 years of relevant experience, ideally in a client service role or delivering digital services;
  • Agency experience is an asset;
  • Significant experience in managing digital accounts with complex solutions;
  • A university degree in a related field, whether communications, marketing or IT;
  • Flawless bilingualism in French and English.


Additional Information

Why Nurun?

  • A corporate vision with humans at the centre;
  • Large-scale digital projects created for clients around the world;
  • A personalized development plan supported by our continuous training platforms;
  • A wide range of social benefits from day one;
  • The possibility of working 100% from home with access to collaborative offices;
  • A rich collaboration with our 149 passionate experts, each selected with care. 

Who We Are

Nurun creates purposeful digital experiences that elevate brands and transform organizations. From the creation of products and services to data science and human research, we make the most of agility and apply a hybrid approach to adapt to the needs of our clients. Our involvement doesn’t stop after delivery. We push the limits of technology to evolve and optimize our products and their performance. Want to learn more about us? Check out our Instagram and LinkedIn.

title: Seasonal Customer Service Attendant/Dockhand
description:
Proudly building upon a 60 year heritage of aviation excellence, and employing a diverse fleet of fixed wing aircraft on wheels, skis and floats; Rise Air continues to be the largest Scheduled, Charter and MEDEVAC aviation operation in Saskatchewan. Rise Air has opportunities for Customer Service Attendant/Dockhand for this summer float season in Stony Rapids, Saskatchewan.

Seasonal Customer Service Attendant/Dockhand

La Ronge, SK Full Time Term (May to September)

Primary Responsibilities

Customer Service

  • Ensure consistent and superior customer service through awareness of customer needs, and trends.
  • Maintain a positive attitude towards customers and colleagues within a fast-paced work environment.

Check-ins

  • Conduct passenger check-ins for all charter and scheduled flights at the related terminal or base.
  • Process and/or track all baggage and freight requirements.

Cargo

  • Accept and handle cargo in accordance with approved standards, policies and procedures.
  • Process dangerous goods shipments.

Ground Services

  • Handle baggage and cargo and load/unload aircraft.
  • Assist flight crews and customers requiring assistance to enplane/deplane or handle baggage.
  • Safely and efficiently operate and maintain ground support vehicles and equipment.
  • Marshall and tow aircraft.
  • Receive float aircraft on docks and secure them.
  • De-ice/anti-ice aircraft.
  • Groom/detail aircraft interiors/exteriors as required.

Fuelling System

  • Accept fuel deliveries and perform fuel quality checks.
  • Deliver fuel into plane, fuel drums, etc, and to customers.
  • Ensure paperwork for tracking fuel delivery and supply is completed appropriately and in accordance with company policies and procedures.

General Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain knowledge of the company's vision, mission, and values.
  • Foster a team-based environment through collaborative working relationships.
  • Ensure optimal communication with all employees and internal partners.
  • Carry out duties in accordance with health, safety and environment legislation and regulations.
  • May have "on call" responsibilities.

Qualifications

Education and Experience

  • Typically, the knowledge and skills required for this position include a high school diploma or equivalent. Previous experience or training in aviation is considered an asset.

Skills, knowledge, and abilities include:

  • Demonstrated experience in serving a diverse and complex customer base.
  • Professional judgment and well-defined conflict resolution skills in handling sensitive situations with tact, diplomacy, and high ethical standards.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Sound problem solving, decision-making, analytical thinking, planning, prioritization, and execution skills.
  • Ability to learn and adapt quickly to organizational requirements.
  • Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects and tasks and execute effectively and in a timely manner.
  • Strong leadership skills and a hands-on, self-motivated, and demonstrated positive, can-do attitude.
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize, multi-task and prioritize.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Provincial driver's license and an Airside Vehicle Operators Permit (AVOP).
  • WHIMS and Dangerous Goods Awareness Training.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Working knowledge of basic computer applications.
  • Willing to work shifts as needed.

Working Conditions

  • The CSA/Dockhand will work shifts as assigned on days, evenings, and weekends. 50 per cent of the work is performed outdoors, including inclement summer and fall weather.
  • This position is physically demanding. The CSA/Dockhand must be able to safely undertake physically demanding tasks.
  • Able to accept call outs as required. Occasional overtime, on call shifts and/or travel may be required.
  • Ability to handle customer luggage and freight.
  • Ability to lift 70 pounds.
  • Able to safely provide various ground services related to aircraft and equipment.
  • Able to work in enclosed spaces and on elevated work platforms.

As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for controlled substances and alcohol prior to employment. We appreciate all applicants, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Salesforce Consultant - Field Service (SFS)
description:
Company Description

Who are we?

We’re digital transformation specialists in the Salesforce ecosystem. We’ve got nearly 20 years of experience creating unique and effective Salesforce solutions. We help clients all over North America compete with outperforming business processes. 

As a top consulting partner firm for Salesforce, Rootstock and FinancialForce, we’ve retained a solid core of senior professionals through our commitment to fully remote work, work-life balance, and employee satisfaction. 

Looking for your next challenge? We just might be the right fit. Let’s start with the good stuff: 

Benefits

  • Five full weeks of vacation every year, bumped up to 6 after five years at Nubik.

  • Since you’ll be setting up your own remote office, you’re gonna need supplies. Every employee gets $1000 per year (every year) for office equipment. What counts as office equipment? Whatever you need to do your job. 

  • Get your Salesforce certifications while you work. We want you at the top of your game, and we’ll help you get there during work hours.

  • We’re a fully-remote company. That means you work from anywhere you want, and set your own hours. Make sure you’re available during core hours, and the rest is up to you.

  • We’ve got a generous medical benefits package (including dental and paramedical) and we pay for half of your plan.

Job Description

  • Collaborate directly with decision-makers to better understand their business objectives, their reality and their goals in order to create the best solutions;
  • Act as a trusted business advisor with the customer and align business processes with industry best practices;
  • Design and configure components of the solution following best practices;
  • Participate and supervise the implementation during each steps;
  • Perform gap analyses and build out Salesforce roadmaps to address potential gaps;
  • Work in collaboration with Project Manager and teaming with developers, administrators;
  • Assist customers during UAT (User Acceptance Testing);
  • Deliver salesforce training to the end-user and/or power-user;
  • Develop your skills through online certification (Trailhead), shadowing, mentoring and daily interaction with your colleagues and clients.
Qualifications

  • 5 years experience in CRM project consulting role;
  • Certification is an asset;
  • Strong understanding of software development processes;
  • Analytical mind and excellent communication skills;
  • Responsible, methodical, organized and thorough;
  • Knowledge of Agile methodology;
  • Fluent in English (mandatory), French is an asset.


Additional Information

Why work at Nubik

We’re proud of our achievements in work-life balance and employee satisfaction - most recently, we were certified as a Great Place to Work. We were named Best Work Life Balance company by the Quebec Government. We know your life outside of work matters, and we’re committed to helping you find the balance. 

Wanna know more? Just drop us a line - we’d love to hear from you.

Just drop us a line - we’d love to hear from you.', 'Participate and supervise the implementation during each steps;', 'Assist customers during UAT (User Acceptance Testing);', 'Work in collaboration with Project Manager and teaming with developers, administrators;', 'Deliver salesforce training to the end-user and/or power-user;', 'Fluent in English (mandatory), French is an asset.']

title: Supply Chain - Customer Service Representative
description:
Job Description

 Processes orders, prepares correspondence and fulfills customer needs to ensure customer satisfaction. Cross-trains in other administrative areas when required. Practices safe work practices.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

  •  Process orders for stores
  • Prepare billing for order add-ons and pickups
  • Prepare all paperwork for loading and production; run any pertinent reports
  • Prepare invoices for dispatch and attach any necessary communications to the stores
  •  Receive and resolve customer requests, concerns and complaints
  •  Answer and route all departmental calls
  • Maintain filing system for invoices, reports and other customer related information
  •  Provide clerical support to other departments as needed
  • Coordinate and disseminate corporate, marketing and other company information to the stores 
  • Assist with routing of trucks where applicable
  • Process credits for the Domino's Pizza stores
  • Code credits for delivery accuracy
  • Coordinate credit requests with appropriate departments for further research
  • Process special orders/pick-ups
Qualifications

•    High School diploma or GED
•    2-3 years of Customer Service experience
•    PeopleSoft experience is a plus
•    Excellent communication and organizational skills
•    Ability to handle multiple tasks
•    Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office software

title: Student Member Service Representative - Supporting Dunnville Branch
description:
Company Description

Why join PenFi

We have a lot of reasons to be proud to work here.

  • We have a deluxe benefits package, success sharing program and comprehensive pension plan
  • Local is everything. We're all about working with local businesses and partnering with our communities to make them strong and vibrant
  • As a credit union, living the co-operative principles are part of our long and rich history
  • We develop meaningful relationships with our co-workers and members - that means learning about their passions, families, ambitions and doing what we can to improve their lives
  • We have a unique culture where we take our business seriously, but we like to have a little fun along the way
  • Education is a priority and we offer an abundance of leadership and professional development programs and training to help you be the best you can be
  • Corporate Social Responsibility is alive and well. From our award winning Skates for Kids Program to delivering financial literacy to new Canadians, to sponsoring local events - we donate our time, money and expertise
  • We are all PenFi ambassadors and we live our truly local brand from the inside out

Who we are

We live, work and play in the Niagara Peninsula. We know Niagara's economy, it's people and every unique community. With over 20,000 personal and business members, we offer all of the products and services that our members have grown to know and love from their truly local credit union. We employ 100 truly awesome people with a desire to provide remarkable member experiences every single day.

Job Description

The Member Service Representative provides excellent customer service that is accurate, timely, and efficient to our Members in all interactions, both at the front counter and/or by phone/email. MSR’s also uncover opportunities where we can better help Members, and potential Members, with our various banking solutions/services and refers them to appropriate branch partner to help our Members achieve their financial goals. The MSR will ensure they are aware of, and adhere to, operating procedures and policies to safeguard the assets of the organization and the Member.

  • Create a personal and exceptional Member experience (both at the front counter and/or by phone), by developing and deepening relationships, maintaining regular communication, answer inquiries, providing timely responses, value-added information and advice to Members while always striving to increase Member satisfaction through service provided.
  • Handle Member requests for deposits, withdrawals, transfers, identify and fulfill member’s financial service’s need and other basic transactions. Assist members with ATM, MasterCard and Debit Cards by accepting payments, applications, encoding of new cards, and inquiries.
  • Promotes credit unions’ products and services when a need or opportunity specific to the member is identified by offering a full range of financial services, including registered and non-registered investments, and basic loan services. Make referrals to specialists and advisors as required.
  • Responsible for balancing of daily cash as required and location of all cash differences, ensuring the immediate supervisor is advised immediately. Assist with ATM loading and balancing.
  • Attend to the accurate and prompt preparation and audit of all assigned reports, status checking, investment renewals and internal accounting reports. 
  • Identify opportunities to promote and complete credit card applications with Members and complete regular care calls
  • Open account types and demands, as required and proactively resolve Member concerns and refer to Manager when required.
  • Improve efficiency and simplicity while supporting a culture of innovation, utilize all procedures as appropriate for organizational consistency in application and execution including being personally accountable to ensure that you have read, understood and have implemented your daily work resulting in a satisfactory rating on all branch audits while constantly producing innovative solutions to create efficiencies in your work.
  • Foster truly local banking by identify opportunities to develop business within the community and attract new Members by establishing “centers of influence” outside the branch, and participating in community and branch events as a brand ambassador.

·            Perform other assigned responsibilities.

 

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or equivalent (Post-Secondary School Preferred)
  • Cash handling experience
  • Experience assisting Members in a bank or credit union for a minimum of 2 years considered an asset
  • Previous experience with sales is considered an asset


Additional Information

To learn more visit https://penfi.ca/careers/

While we welcome all applications, only those who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Accessibility accommodations will be made for job candidates upon request.

title: Lending, Sales & Customer Service Specialist (Remote Work)
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">The internal job title is Lending Specialist. LOCATION: Optional for the right candidate to work from home anywhere in Canada. We are seeking talented, dynamic individuals who are looking for a career in a fast-paced team-oriented environment. Your role within the Centralized Lending team is vital to Fairstone’s commitment to be best-in-class service for our customers, as our customers are at the center of everything we do. You will support customers and internal/external partners with a variety of sales and service of our loan products through inbound, outbound calls and digital channels. In addition, you will be supported with professional development and encouraged to further develop an exciting career with us at Fairstone, while delivering exceptional value to our business, our customers' lives and to our communities of which we serve. What do we have to offer: An opportunity to build your customer service and sales skills Paid training Competitive base salary Shift premiums on certain evening shifts Incentive plans A comprehensive benefits program Employee discounts Employee engagement activities Your work life: Guaranteed 40 hours a week Department flex hours: Monday to Friday 9am - 9pm Saturday & Sunday 9am - 9pm What will you be doing: Handle all customer inquiries and applications coming through our different marketing channels, inbound, outbound and digital Understand and determine customer needs to recommend solutions specific to those needs while exercising discretion and confidentiality Achieve assigned goals and business objectives by promoting financial solutions and completing application and loan processes in a timely, compliant and accurate manner Connect personally with customers to effectively gather information during the loan application process to identify additional financial needs Be a team player by respecting coworkers, staying committed, and keeping everyone current on the status of your daily activities Servicing existing customers by reviewing accounts and available products to better serve them Support various corporate strategic initiatives as needed by: Adjusting daily work activities to support the requirements of company initiatives Adapting to meet unique process flows, scheduling, expectations, technology, etc. Providing feedback to test, learn and refine processes/technology Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent preferred Business related post-secondary education, an asset 0 - 2 years of experience in sales and/or customer service Preference given to those with directly relevant sales/lending experience Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal Adapts easily to new technology as required Must be able to work flexible hours including evenings and weekends to serve 9am to 9pm local time Authorized to work in Canada Ability to organize, prioritize and manage time in a fast-paced environment Must work well independently, as well as within a team environment. Strong sense of ethics Must have a professionally secured workspace and appropriate communication device and computer equipment What’s in it for you? At Fairstone, we offer all our permanent employees: A minimum of 3 weeks paid vacation (prorated to your start date) Wellness days Employee referral program $2000.00 or more. Great Benefit Program (flexible health and dental benefits, access to virtual health care provider Dialogue, pension plan and much more!) Ongoing Learning and development Training Tuition Assistance Programs Paid volunteer day and organized volunteering event across the country A growing company with potential for personal growth and career advancement. And Much more. If you’re seeking a role with a growing business that values employee development, Fairstone is the right place for you! Come join our team! Fairstone is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will make reasonable accommodations to respond to the needs of people with disabilities. Individuals who view themselves as Aboriginals, members of visible minorities, and disabled are encouraged to apply in confidence. Whether you’re seeking first-time employment or are making a career change, Fairstone has the internal support to help our team members grow and succeed. Please note that applicants who receive a conditional offer from Fairstone Financial will be required, as a condition of employment, to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated pursuant to applicable law, with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada. Fairstone Financial will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to health or other permitted grounds. Time Type: Full time Job Type: Permanent</section>

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
T.K. Graphics, a Surrey based print house, is looking for an enthusiastic Customer Service Representative (CSR) that have an aptitude for learning and are interested in working and growing within the printing industry. Growth opportunities are available within our organization.

T.K. Graphics embodies the new definition of print, introducing customers to creative thinking that can help them take marketing campaigns beyond ink for greater effectiveness, accountability and relevance. We work incredibly hard to provide quality products and services. But eventually, it is our exceptional support that creates a lasting impression.

Role & Responsibilities:
  • The Customer Service Representative will work together with the sales, pre-press & production team to serve our customers by understanding their expectations and then communicating and coordinating to achieve the desired outcome.
  • The CSR will primarily be responsible for achieving customer satisfaction by efficiently managing: response to requests for pricing, job entry, implementing change orders, recording alterations, monitoring production and due dates, communicating with mid-management and preparing jobs for billing. CSR will be the primary point of contact for the work they manage.

Requirements:
  • Excellent communication skills, comfortably and professionally interacting directly with customers and co-workers.
  • Outstanding project management and organizational skills.
  • Attention to detail, while managing multiple tasks.
  • Work successfully in both a team environment and individually, with considerable self-direction.
  • Ability to work well under pressure.
  • Able to exceptionally manage multiple high-profile projects simultaneously.
  • Strong problem solving ability.
  • Having solid knowledge of computers, e-mail, MS Office, Excel.
  • Professional telephone mannerism is a must.
  • Fluent in English (both verbal & written).
  • Enthusiasm & self-motivated.

Job Type:
  • Full-time.

title: Commis de bureau
description:
Envie d’un emploi stable et permanent? Envie de travailler dans le domaine de la santé dans une entreprise familiale québécoise? Médicus recrute et croit en votre potentiel!

Chef de file québécois en matière d’orthèses-prothèses, de compression, d’équipements de mobilité et de soins à domicile depuis plus de 60 ans, Médicus positionne le client au sommet de ses priorités.

Notre Siège social de Montréal est à la recherche d’un(e) Commis de bureau à temps plein du lundi au vendredi. Prenez part à notre mission et venez faire une différence dans la vie de nos précieux clients.

Relevant du Chef comptable, notre futur(e) collègue sera appelé(e) à :

  • Ouvrir le courrier du département
  • Photocopier et numériser des documents
  • S’assurer de l’archivage
  • Classer les documents dans les dossiers des clients
  • Participer activement au besoin du département
  • ouverture des dossiers clients
  • facturation de certains dossiers clients

Profil recherché :

  • Diplôme d’études secondaires (DES)
  • Minimum de 2 ans d’expérience dans un domaine administratif
  • Être à l'aise dans un emploi plus routinier
  • Capacité et soucis à respecter les échéanciers
  • Volonté de travailler en équipe et d’aider ses collègues
  • Grande habileté à travailler avec la suite MS Office

Ce que nous avons à vous offrir :

  • Assurances collectives payées en partie par l’employeur;
  • REER collectif avec cotisation de l’employeur;
  • Congés fériés supérieurs aux Normes;
  • Congés mobiles;
  • Rabais très avantageux sur nos produits et services;
  • Rabais chez nos partenaires;
  • Activités et club social;
  • Et bien plus !

L'emploi du genre masculin a pour but d'alléger le texte et d'en faciliter la lecture.

title: Regional Customer Service Coordinator
description:
Celebrating 62 years of Business

We Bring Food to Your Family’s Table!

We are now hiring a Regional Customer Service Coordinator for our Baden or Mississauga, Ontario terminal!

Shift Details: Days, Monday-Friday 8:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.

 

  • Bookingdeliveryappointmentsfor several Erb delivery terminals in Ontario and Manitoba.
  • Arranging full loads and full loads appointments for several Erb Terminals.
  • Monitorloading,unloadingand appointments – follow up with customers regarding delays, missed appointments and late arrivals.
  • Ensure customer/shippers are kept informed (follow up) on loads.
  • Communicate any supplemental billing i.e., additional detention charges, holding charges to the Billing Department.
  • Customer communication: Follow up regarding specials, rates, and equipment and delivery schedule.
  • Work with 3rd party Logistics systems i.e., C3, Retail Link, BluJay etc.
  • Passon any feedback to Load Coordinator to drivers or customers not adhering to Customer Service or Appointment policies and procedures.
  • Havea complete understanding of the policies and procedures of the Customer Service department and appointment booking.
  • Communicate effectively with other departments as it relates to the Customer Service or Appointments.
  • Assist other team members when required.
  • Special projects as assigned by Load Coordinator.
  • All other duties as required.

Qualifications:

  • Excellent keyboarding skills, accurate with details and have knowledge of Erb Operations.
  • Understanding of AS400
  • Previous experience in the transportation industry preferred.
  • Ability to handle difficult situations with both internal and external customers.
  • Have strong investigative skills.
  • Commitment to customer satisfaction and customer focused.
  • High level of personal energy and willingness to take the initiative to make Improvements and resolve issues.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Good organizational skills, time management and the ability to multi-task
  • Pleasant telephone manner and good attitude
  •  Willingness to learn all aspects of the Customer Service Department
  •  Ability to work as a team player.

We Offer:

  • Top industry wages
  • Early vacation bonus
  • Workplace safety award program
  • Group benefit package, including company matched TFSA, RESP, RRSP
  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Referral bonuses
  • Employee engagement activities

Make “Another Cool Move”- Join our family of essential workers at Erb Transport!

Contact us 1-800-461-5299 or 

Recruiting@erbgroup.com

Company website: www.erbgroup.com

 Named by Trucking HR Canada as Top Fleet Employers for eight consecutive years, and Best Fleets to Drive For (2022) through Truckload Carriers Association, we have grown significantly since our induction in 1959 and have become one of Canada’s largest family-owned refrigerated trucking companies. Although we have over 1,500 employees, we have not forgotten where we started or that our greatest asset is our people. Strong values and support for our fellow colleagues is a unique and important part of the workplace experience that is encouraged here.

Erb Limited is committed to the principle of equality in employment.

title: Client Support - Remote, Canada
description:
Being a Client Advocate (CA) is like being a combination of a research scientist and a teacher. We use logic and our knowledge of the LMS to test theories in order to narrow a list of possibilities to the final solution. We are also there to clearly explain the answers to our client’s questions while teaching them about the functionality of our system. Finally, our roles have a direct impact on our client’s satisfaction with Absorb as a whole, so being friendly and understanding, with a strong customer focus is an asset. If you enjoy detective work, working closely with other teams, client service and continuously learning new things, you’ll fit right in here in Client Advocacy. ~ Paul, Client Support 

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to accelerate your career growth, and develop your client relationship management skills in a fast-paced and growing organization?

We are looking for entry level candidates who are customer service oriented, tech savvy and who are very comfortable working on a computer. This role requires someone who can answer client tickets either by phone or email and complete them in a timely manner.

As a Client Support team member, you will be expected to engage our clients by providing technical support, researching and answering questions, and troubleshooting problems within our Learning Management Software (LMS).

Interested in hearing from someone who has worked in a Client Support role with Absorb? Check out what Dan Ritchie, has to say:

Dan Ritchie - Absorb LMS

https://absorb.wistia.com/medias/hjvc6db8yl

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide email and phone support in a fast-paced environment.
  • Handle all assigned tickets within specified SLA response times.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues and partner with other cross departmental teams to resolve them.
  • Provide excellent customer support by engaging clients, conducting in-depth investigations and providing assistance.
  • Deliver solutions based on client needs and concerns.
  • Successfully act as the advocate and voice for the client while simultaneously acting as the voice of the company to ensure that all communications are delivered on such as issue statuses and their resolutions.
  • Learn and understand the LMS platform to provide knowledgeable assistance in using Absorb LMS.
  • Answer questions regarding functionality of the LMS.

Key Requirements:
Minimum Requirements

  • Minimum 3 years' experience in a technical support or customer facing position, ideally in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven experience in a metrics driven role is required.
  • Excellent communication skills including both written and verbal.
  • Experience troubleshooting technical customer issues.
  • Basic understanding of core web components.
  • Exceptional attention to detail.
  • Proven time-management capabilities.

Preferred Requirements

  • Previous LMS/E-Learning experience.
  • Previous experience in a call center environment.
  • Technical documentation experience.
  • Zendesk, mySQL, Jira, Confluence.
  • Previous experience working with remote teams.
  • Fluency in other languages (Spanish or French would be a bonus but not required)

Technologies we use:

  • AbsorbLMS, Zendesk, Jira, Confluence, Zoom, Microsoft Office

The Company:
Absorb Software is a learning technology company based in Calgary, Alberta Canada, with offices in London, Dublin, Tampa, Boston and Sydney.

Absorb offers both Absorb Infuse, the first Learning Experience Platform (LXP) to offer a true in-the-flow learning experience, and our flagship product, Absorb LMS, an industry-leading and award-winning Learning Management System for businesses, higher education, government and non-profit agencies around the world. Absorb is setting new standards in learning technology and support, fueling companies who believe that people are their greatest asset.

We exceed expectations across enterprises, industries and continents, helping people learn at the speed of now and preparing companies for the future of work. How do we do it better? We pay attention to the details and go deep where it matters. Turning a culture of learning into a revenue engine for global titans the world over.

Care to join us?

Why work at Absorb Software?

  • This position is eligible for participation in Absorb’s Bonus program as outlined in Absorb’s Bonus Program Policy.
  • RRSP match program.
  • Employer paid benefits: health, dental and vision. 
  • Professional development plans.
  • Career progression/internal mobility opportunities.
  • Inclusive work environment.
  • Casual dress code.
  • Volunteering opportunities.
  • Company/team building events.
  • Flexible remote working options for selected roles:
    • This role can be fully remote.

Additional requirements/information for candidates:

  • In the event a current Absorb employee would like to apply for this role they will inform their supervisor prior to submitting their application.
  • This position will be subject to pre-employment background screening, including a criminal record check.
  • The successful candidate must be able to show proof of legal eligibility to work in Canada without sponsorship.
  • Incomplete online applications will not be considered.
  • Applicants will be accepted until a suitable candidate is found.

Absorb Software (Absorb) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. Absorb is committed to providing employees with an environment free of discrimination, bullying and harassment. All employment decisions at Absorb are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. We will maintain our commitment to and support of equal employment opportunity for all individuals without regard to race, national/ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics or disability. Our commitment to equal employment opportunity extends to any other protected classes which may exist under applicable law.

We acknowledge and are mindful that our Calgary, Alberta operations are located on traditional territories of the Blackfoot Confederacy (Siksika Kainai), the TsuuT’ina, the Îyâxe Nakoda Nations, the Metis Nation (Region 3) and many diverse Inuit, Métis, and First Nations peoples who make their homes in the Treaty 7 region of Southern Alberta. We recognize their distinctive spiritual relations with the land that supports our home and our business. We are humbled that our office is built upon the generous land that sustained indigenous people for centuries.

title: Front Desk Agent
description:
POSITION: Front Desk Agent DEPARTMENT: Front Desk REPORTS TO: Front Office Manager STATUS OF POSITION: Full Time WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests
Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts
If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for! Position Summary The front desk agent is responsible for servicing guests as they arrive at the hotel, including welcoming them to the resort and checking them in while ensuring the highest level of guest satisfaction
This person will be responsible for becoming familiar with packages and group rates offered by the resort
Front desk agents will need to keep in communication with housekeeping as to have the recent room status information
Duties and Responsibilities: Be knowledgeable about the Resort, all its amenities, its policies as well as the surrounding area
Be familiarized with the general rates, packages, group/special event rates
Become well familiarized with general and special rates, plans, and packages Ensure that all special requests or problems are routed to the appropriate areas and follow up with outcome
Balance inventory of rooms and take appropriate action to rectify
Assign rooms for groups that require special attention (i
e
Hockey team, school trip) to better accommodate all parties involved
Welcome and register guests arriving, follow policy and procedures regarding billing and standards
Inform House Keeping Team of any changes in room status, room moves, request or concerns and maintain positive communication and strong sense of team work between departments
Log any in-house guest issue in log book to record for next shifts and for better follow up and communication
Check out guest in a timely manner and be empowered to rectify any issue upon their departure to achieve our goal of guest loyalty and satisfaction
Prepare the next days team for success(i
e
arrival packages, restock inventory of pens, vouchers, papers, etc) Emergency Calls: monitor and respond to the emergency phone lines and follow Health and Safety procedures to take action
(i
e
calling 911 and filling out supporting documentation) Answer individual work email accounts as well as shared account and direct to information to appropriate departments
Qualifications: Positive and passionate, conveying to our guests and callers enthusiasm in every interaction
Must be creative, self starter, able to meet deadlines, work independently/part of a team and possess excellent interpersonal skills
Highly organized, detail oriented, individual with the ability to multi task
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Reliability and punctuality are imperative
The ability to work independently and as part of a team
The role requires working weekends, holidays and shifts vary from days, mid-shift and evenings
Hours of department from 7am-11pm daily
Able to stand on your feet for extended periods of time
Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our other affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka

title: Service Coordinator
description:
We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Currently, we are seeking a Service Coordinator to join our Service team based in Kamloops, BC.

Reporting to the Regional Administrative Team Lead, the successful candidate will be responsible for providing excellent customer service and a variety of administrative services to assist with effective and efficient operations for our Kamloops Service Division.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Receive calls, emails, and faxes from customers requesting work
  • Dispatch/scheduling of service electricians
  • Entry of work orders into accounting system
  • Providing consistent, high quality customer service
  • Billing cash sales
  • Invoicing
  • Preparing quote letters
  • Filing and other administrative tasks

Experience and Skills:

  • Experience working in an office environment
  • Must be flexible with the proven ability to multitask in a changing, fast-paced team environment
  • Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, etc)
  • Must be tech savvy: proficient with computers and other software (experience with JDE, and other client driven service management systems would be an asset)
  • Proven teamwork skills complemented by the ability to work well independently
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, good phone skills
  • Highly organized and detail oriented
  • Able to problem solve

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The salary for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Service Coordinator". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Sales and Customer Service Executive
description:
Fusion Security, is now the 10th largest Security Company in BC! Our goal is not to be the biggest but a company that provides the BEST service, and we are achieving this with the relentless efforts of our Team. As we continue to experience fast growth, we are looking for a passionate, proactive, and driven salesperson to take the next leap in their career and corroborate our efforts in attaining even more success. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, go getter, and a people's person who is excited by the opportunity of making a huge impact on people's lives, every single day.

At Fusion Security, our Sales Account Executives are masters of new business acquisition. In this role, you will be responsible for delivering Fusion Security's proven value proposition to industry leading organizations throughout British Columbia. This role is perfect for a proven sales professional looking to join a passionate team that is disrupting the industry norm.


Daily Responsibilities:

  • Qualify new Prospects through phone calls
  • Cold calling and lead generation
  • Deliver the Fusion Security value proposition to Prospects via the phone
  • Analyze Prospects' needs and create a tailored solution
  • Solution Sell to new Prospects
  • Be the master of your sales cycle start to finish
  • Manage communication with Prospects across BC
  • Execute deals to meet and exceed monthly targets
  • Work in an open concept office as a part of our Sales Team

You are the right fit if you have:

  • A natural charisma that allows you to easily build relationships
  • A team player, excited to be part of a phenomenal organization
  • A strong negotiator and know how to turn partnerships into win-win propositions
  • An understanding of B2B sales and hold a track record of significant overachievement
  • A vehicle and a valid Class 5 driver's license

Required Experience

  • Minimum 2 years' experience in the Security Services industry
  • Post-Secondary Education
  • Track record of success with a short or long sales cycle
  • Proven experience in cold calling and with closing deals
  • Sales experience would be an asset

Skills & Abilities

  • Hunter - type personality; have a drive to succeed, willing to take on new challenges with a can-do attitude
  • Excellent communication (written & oral), presentation, organizational, and time management skills
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word & Excel
  • Sales Software knowledge an asset
  • Superior customer service skills, professional attitude and appearance
  • Excellent relationship management and credibility building skills
  • Strategic/creative thinker
  • Results-oriented salesperson
  • Strong team approach to business

If you are committed to winning, obsessed with helping partners succeed, action oriented, resourceful, creative and determined, we want to hear from you. Please submit a resume AND cover letter explaining how you would fulfill this role. Applications received without a cover letter will not be considered.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in Fusion Security, however only formal applications will be considered, and only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Email: careers@fusionsecurity.ca

Office Address: Suite 160 - 4321 Still Creek Drive Burnaby, BC

title: Service Advisor
description:
Thompson Chrysler is growing again! We are currently looking for a full time Service Advisor to join our ever growing team and enthusiastic team. The winning candidate will have a strong work ethic & will possess excellent customer service skills.

We would ask that you please not call, but to submit your application via email.

Thank you.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain dealership-customer relationships via email & phone.
  • Contact customers when service is due.
  • Advise clients of vehicle service requirements and recommendations.
  • Confirm Customer Service Appointments & arrange shuttle transportation if needed.
  • Gather and note servicing information from customers to assist service advisors.
  • Update any customer information changes.
  • Manage Service Advisor appointments & shop time.

Required Skills

  • Strong communication skills
  • Time management skills
  • Work well in a fast-paced & team environment
  • Organization
  • Positive Attitude
  • Experience working with computers & excel is an asset

Please email resume to:

Sylvia Conley, Service Manager

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

title: Receptionist- Part time- Barnes Wheaton GM
description:
Barnes Wheaton GM has a new opportunity for a full-time Receptionist to join our team! 

Job Summary: 
Reporting to the Office Manager, you will be our front-line ambassador of the Dealership responsible for greeting all incoming guests, visitors, and team members while providing an exceptional customer experience for our clients. This position also requires accounts payable processing. 

Responsibilities: 
Our Receptionist is responsible for providing our customers with a welcoming first impression while completing the following duties: 

  • Greeting customers visiting the showroom and inquiring as to the purpose of their visit. 

  • Referring customers to the appropriate department, notifying the employee concerned that a customer is waiting and introducing customers to the sales consultants. 

  • Welcoming and serving customers visiting the service department. 

  • Helping customers with directions or any appropriate information they need while maintaining high company confidentiality and customer satisfaction. 

  • Maintain a tidy and stocked customer waiting lounge, kids play area, and coffee station. 

  • Professionally answering phone calls and re-directing those calls to respective departments 

  • Acquiring basic knowledge about the dealership, to be able to respond to inquiries for general information. 

  • Taking payments from customers and issuing receipts along with other office duties as required or requested by management. 

  • Stock in New & Used cars and assist sales department with vehicle inventory control. 

  • Distribute any incoming mail to appropriate personnel. 

What we need: 

  • Front-facing customer service is an asset. 

  • Experience with Quorum is an asset. 

  • Dealership admin experience is an asset. 

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications (Word, Excel, Outlook). 

  • Excellent customer service skills with positive and courteous telephone etiquette. 

  • Strong organizational and time management skills. 

  • Ability to multi-task without compromising on quality. 

  • Extremely dependable and punctual. 

  • Ability to prioritize tasks according to importance in a fast-paced environment. 

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 

  • Ability to interact professionally with both co-workers, guests and vendors 

  • Data entry skills. 

What you get: 

  • 17.00/hr 

  • Compensation – Best in industry pay. Almost all our pay plans are incentive based so the sky is the limit for your earning potential. You never want to be capped and we never will.  

  • Culture – we are a performance driven organization with high accountability and constant feedback on how our team members are doing. If you are looking for a place to perform and showcase your skills, this is the culture that fits you need.  

  • Career Development– Your success is our success. From our internal Barnes University training programs to factory training from our manufacturers to all sorts of opportunities, if you want to never learn we are not the company for you.  

  • Opportunity for Growth – We have people that go from washing bikes to running dealerships and everything in between. We’ll help you make it happen 

  • Community – we give back to the communities we do business in in meaningful ways.  

  • Family Owned and Operated – For over 40 years the Barnes Family has been hands on running our dealerships, get personal leadership and mentorship not some corporate text book. 

At Barnes Wheaton GM we build careers. Ask about one of our many career path success stories during your interview.

title: Customer Service Representative
company: Mr Rooter Plumbing of Mississauga ON
description:
In 1995, Mike Kolakovic opened up a plumbing company in Mississauga ON, called Mr. Rooter Plumbing of Mississauga ON.  Mr. Rooter® Plumbing grew because it earned a reputation for good work at a quality price and for caring about customers’ homes. At Mr. Rooter, we love what we do, and we believe in it. It’s not just plumbing to us, but a philosophy applied to every area of our lives. It’s just the plumbing that’s made us famous.

As a Customer Service Representative, you are a key member in upholding our service philosophy to provide the highest level of customer service. You are responsible for handling incoming calls and scheduling service calls to meet customer requirements. Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

We are looking for a Full Time Customer Service Representative who is self-motivated, energetic, creative and enjoys helping people. You are driven to provide the highest level of service and satisfaction and able to effectively manage a variety of situations on a day day-to-day basis.  Our employees are the heartbeat of our company.  

 Specific Responsibilities:

  • Receive incoming calls in professional and courteous manner
  • Build sustainable relationships & trust with customers through open and interactive communication
  • Prioritize and coordinate the scheduling of services
  • Coordinate delays in schedule with customers and service technicians
  • Use customer development techniques to solicit work through phone, email, mail and personal customer contacts  
  • Perform other duties as needed which may include cross-training in related positions
Job Requirements:

  • Minimum two years Customer Service Experience
  • Must be in present or most recent position for at least two years
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills  
  • Detail-oriented with strong data entry skills
  • Positive & Professional Attitude
  • Superior time management
  • Team player who can work independently
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize & manage time effectively
  • Work some weekends
Compensation: $20.00/HR Starting - $25.00HR
Benefits 
Pension Plan

We are actively interviewing for this position - Apply today and our hiring manager will follow up!

Mr Rooter Plumbing of Mississauga ON
281 Queen St S
Mississauga, ON
L5M 1L9
mrrooter.ca/mississauga/

 

    

Notice

Mr. Rooter LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Rooter® franchised system. Each Mr. Rooter® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Rooter LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Rooter® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Rooter LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Rooter LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Commercial Lines CSR
description:
Commercial Lines Customer Service Representative - Stoney Creek

Responsibilities:
  • Respond promptly and in a friendly manner to calls, mail and emails, ensuring a high level of service is maintained;
  • New Business workflows with Account Executives;
  • Renewal reviews and make recommendations, completing comparison quotes and remarket when needed and ensuring that all renewals are delivered to the clients in a timely matter;
  • Review and/or issue Certificates of Insurance
  • Accurately handle change requests with an emphasis on risk management;
  • Handle Complex Accounts to provide creative solutions to meet the needs of our clients;
  • Function as a front-line underwriter for qualifying, maintaining, and promoting sound quality business;
  • Assist clients with reporting claims and follow up in a timely manner to ensure quality service from our insurance partners;
  • Manage account receivables;
  • Work closely with Account Executives to identify other lines of business as cross sell opportunities.

Qualifications:
  • RIBO License
  • 2+ years of insurance experience
  • Adapts to change and performs effectively under pressure
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • A team player with a strong work ethic
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks, and follow-up on uncompleted tasks
  • Working towards CAIB or CIP Designation
  • A strong attention to detail
  • Computer knowledge in MS Office products such as Word and Excel, Outlook and experience with Power Broker.
